story:
Who I am and this campaign

Heyo, 

My name is Andy Chew. I'm a singer/songwriter living in New Hampshire most of the last decade but originally from Rhode Island. I've worked as a studio potter, carpenter and currently as a medical professional who is always pursuing my true love of music as a side hustle. 

I've always loved the music of a lot of 60's and 70's artist and have been waiting for the moment when I felt ready to go into the studio and bring the right set of songs to a producer to make an album. I figured the music of that time period was all recorded in the analog format to tape and I would like to do my best to capture some of that aesthetic in this studio album. Its definitely become a huge life goal to make a real analog album and print it to vinyls.

Life's short and I don't want to look back at it and say I didn't try to follow my biggest passion. I have an obsession with recording and writing and have been doing so on my own in my home for a decade now. The first couple homemade albums made a bigger splash than I ever expected them to online and so I'm really hopeful for whats next while also realistic about the amount of effort and hard work it takes to make a cohesive and well done album.

With the help of your contribution I will be able to take a lot of songs I've developed for years at home and bring them into a much more professional production. My hope is this will bring more recognition to the songs and help them reach a larger audience. I will never stop recording and enjoying making music, it's definitely a lifelong obsession. 

I've always wanted to make music that captured atmosphere. Just the other day I was walking around Salem, Massachusetts in the autumn air and could feel the heaviness of the place. Later upon coming home, I felt like I could channel that energy into a song. This is the process of most all of my music and I'm passionate about the history, and atmosphere of the old towns and forest I grew up around. The music itself is usually a blend of ethereal harmonies with acoustic instruments, octave mandolins, banjos, etc... 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read!

What You Get

For a smaller amount contribution you'll get the digital album!

And for the various larger amounts you can get 1 or more of the album on CD!

The Impact

I've felt that history, nature and all things that are beautiful inspirations in life are things worth preserving in songs. 

I never expected my first two album to go as far as they did with thousands of streams and downloads. So I'm very excited to see the potential of something recorded by professionals in the highest quality format.

Risks & Challenges

If I cannot reach my goal I will use what I have to start recording a project and release the album in parts as I raise enough for each individual section. 

Recently I've seen a lot of other artist such as Trevor Hall do a similar tactic with his album "The Fruitful Darkness" which was released over the course of 6 months in four parts. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute thats totally ok!

I've certainly been there before myself. Some other ways you can help are  by sharing the campaign, streaming my homemade albums (Embers, From the Ruins, Golden Leaves) online and sharing/adding them to playlist so they get more streams and potentially bring more listeners who might help with the campaign!

Thank you for anything you do!

story:
A "TINY" Part of the Story...

Two years ago, Arvie and Bunny decided to cash in their retirements, pay off all their debts, give away most of their possessions, move from South Carolina to Tennessee, and build a "Tiny House" in the peaceful woods about an hour outside of Nashville.  Going "TINY" has offered Arvie the opportunity to focus completely on songwriting and artwork which has helped alleviate some of the suffering from chronic migraines and  surprisingly culminated in the opportunity to sign with an independent label here in Nashville.   With this tremendous prospect on the horizon, Arvie and Bunny need to return to the studio here in Nashville to record their new songs and remaster some of their previously recorded songs. 

http://www.arviejr.com

Our Part of the Story...

Arvie and Bunny will use all the funds given to...

  • Record new original material written by Arvie or Bunny
  • Remaster previously recorded material from Omni Studios-Nashville
  • Produce and Promote the new album through radio tours, digital media, and physical cds
  • If we do not reach our goal of $10,000 we will still produce a new CD but not at a Nashville recording studio

Your Part of the Story...

Arvie and Bunny  both believe in hard work, coming from families that have been farmers, mill workers, members of the Armed Forces, and educators.  For many years, Arvie was also a teacher in schools with high levels of poverty, and Bunny is a social worker and published author, dedicating her career and writings to improving the quality of life, health, and mental health of her clients and readers.  They will never forget their roots and appreciate how hard it is to earn money and support a family.  With that being said, they pledge to use each penny given with the greatest care and precision, with the goal of making a positive change in the world always in the forefront of their minds.  Arvie and Bunny have also created several perks for those who partner with us to make this dream come true.

Our Risks and Challenges...

The music industry is ever changing and evolving.  There are no guarantees that a song or an album will be a top 40 hit or even recoup the money spent on recording and production.  However, the one sure thing is that if even one person is moved by a song, if even one life is changed, then that song becomes priceless and timeless.  We do this, not for the money and not for the fame, but for the privilege of seeing someone changed. 

Other Ways You Can Help...

Arvie and Bunny know that sometimes it is just not possible to support us financially.  First and foremost, we ask that you would say a prayer for us.  Pray that we would make a difference in the lives of everyone we meet and make a positive change in the world.  Secondly, you can help us by spreading the word about our campaign to anyone who would like to partner with us.  You never know when you sharing could make the difference.  Thank you...Arvie and Bunny

story:
5 Guys One Soul

Hey there. We are Great again. We are five musicians from germany that play music for almost all of our live and have come to the point where we want to release our first album together.

Our influences are mostly in the 70s/ 80s hard rock scene like Savatage, Black Sabbath, Scorpions, Guns N Roses, WASP and Aerosmith. When we met for our first rehearsal we had no exact idea how we would sound so we did experiments in every direction and you will hear that in our debut album- in the positive way! Check out this demo:

https://soundcloud.com/user-339482416/great-hit-mix

From ballads to to metal hymns, everything is in.

You want to score with your girl? We've got the ballad.

You had a really great night? We've got the triumphal Metal- Hymn

You got fired because you were late for work? We've got fast aggressive Rock

So you go drinking with your friends? We've got the Feel-Good Rock-Classic

The party ends at the campfire? We've got the acoustic guitar song that everybody can sing along, even in the worst mental condition

 

Are we there yet?

We nearly finished the recording of the album and are about to send it to a Producer to mix it and do the final mastering. And here's where you have to support us: Since this part of the production process is quite expensive we would like to ask you for support to reach that goal!

We will run the campaign for 60 days. In the meantime, we will hopefully finish mixing and mastering of the album so we can start to order the perks in march. Some of the perks will need more time so we are optimistic that we are able to send the stuff in May.

Preview

story:
Legendary bassist David Ellefson of Megadeth is making a new solo album, and NO COVER, a collection of covers of 70's and 80's Rock and Metal staples, with his solo band ELLEFSON, including classic tracks from Twisted Sister, Def Leppard, W.A.S.P, Nazareth, AC/DC, Judas Priest, Dead Kennedys, and more. Help us fund the recording and release of these amazing projects, and claim killer exclusive merchandise, perks and experiences!

"ELLEFSON, featuring Ellefson on bass, with Vocalist Thom Hazaert, Guitarists Andy Martongelli and Ron “Bumblefoot” Thal (Sons of Apollo, Yes, Ex-Guns N’ Roses), and drummer Paolo Caridi, will be joined by a laundry list of legendary guests including Charlie Benante (Anthrax), Eddie Ojeda (Twisted Sister),  Al Jourgensen (Ministry), Brandon Yeagley (Crobot), Dirk Verbeuren (Megadeth), Frank Hannon and Troy Lucketta (Tesla), Mark Slaughter, Jason McMaster (Dangerous Toys, ex-Watchtower, Evil United), Greg Handevidt (Kublai Khan, Ex-Megadeth), Chuck Behler (Ex-Megadeth), Gus G, John Aquilino (Icon), Doro Pesch, Dave McClain (Sacred Reich, Ex-Machine Head), Dave Alvin (White Trash), Todd Kerns (Slash & The Conspirators),  Andrew Freeman (Last In Line), Jacob Bunton (Mick Mars), Dead By Wednesday, and more TBA."

story:
What's Happening?

Food Will Win the War is teaming up with some incredible names in the music industry and many of our most talented friends (as special musical guests) to bring you a fresh batch of studio tracks. Getting into the studio and producing the songs properly is not a small task, and we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

The costs to make the album include basic tracking, overdubs, mixing, and mastering. We've come up with some exciting perks to show our appreciation for your support. There will be limited edition Food Will Win the War posters, VERY limited edition cassette tapes of the six song EP, and EXTREMELY limited hand-knit FWWtW pom pom hats.

Other Ways You Can Help

We deeply appreciate any support you are able to give to our campaign. In addition to financial support, please consider sharing this campaign on social media and/or sending a link to anyone you think might be interested in helping us make this exciting new album. Your help is essential to bringing this project to fruition. Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
About Me

 

"Ron is a highly accomplished multi instrumentalist whose talent and knowledge of Scottish       music is apparent in both the rehearsal room and on stage." 

Iain Gillie, Managing Director of PW Productions Ltd.

"Ron has a fantastic knack for producing a catchy rhythm with his guitar that can make a played out traditional tune seem completely refreshed and new again." 

        Alisdair McLaren, Director of The National Youth Pipe Band of Scotland

 

Born and brought up in the small, coastal village of Findochty in the North East of Scotland, my musical journey began when receiving fiddle and piano lessons at primary school. During my teenage years, I received tuition from Donald Barr and then James Alexander, both of whom were incredibly inspirational, supportive, and encouraging. I will be forever grateful to the opportunities that Donald and James both gave to me as a youngster. 

Fast forward a couple of years, and the reason I play guitar today is down to one man. Innes Watson. A never ending source of creativity, imagination and expressiveness, Inness' genius inspired me at a gig he once did with Ross Ainslie in the Piping Centre, and from then on my journey as a guitarist and accompanist began... 

Being an accompanist is amazing, it truly is. I feel so lucky to be able to play with such a diverse range of incredibly talented musicians, and seeing how this can influence and shape you as a player. This is where the idea for this project came from. I wondered what it would be like, and how it would sound to bring some of these skilled professionals together, all with their own ideas and creative outlooks, but to have myself at the core, as the continual musical thread that would link everybody together.

In some ways it would almost be like a compilation album, brining together some of my favourite people I've worked with over the years and having it all in one place, but in other ways, it may well spark something entirely new and creative. It would also be an album ran by someone who is accompanist, whose project it is, but they are never really at the forefront, just in the background holding everything in place and making everything stick together, just as an accompanist should do. That in itself is something that appeals to me and is quite unique and I'm not really sure it has been done that much before... 

Any amount that you could donate to this project would mean so much to me, as I'd love nothing more than to share music with some of the finest young musicians in the country, all in one place, and I'd be eternally grateful for your support.  

 

Costs... 

Although I will be investing my own money, realistically, it'll be in the region of £10,000 to cover all the costs for this album. Main costs include... 

  • Musicians fees
  • Studio fees (recording, engineering, mixing, mastering) 
  • Printing / Distribution 
  • Artwork / Design
  • Promotional material / PR & Marketing

 

Risks & Challenges

I know this may seem like a lot, but I can't stress enough how eternally grateful I would be to those of you who decide support this project. Anything that you feel you could donate towards this would be greatly appreciated. 

Rewards for if you do decide to donate include... 

  • Pre-orders (signed and unsigned)
  • PDF's of sheet music 
  • Guitar lessons 
  • Fiddle lessons
  • Tune compositions
  • Gig tickets 
  • House concerts / small performances 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone is in a fortunate enough position to be able to help by donating to this page, however you can still support by doing the following... 

  • Following me on social media platforms under Ron Jappy  - Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube 
  • Sharing this campaign on your own social media pages 


Thanks for taking the time to read this, and if you can support this project in anyway, I thank you in advance :) 

RJ x

story:
> PARA LER O TEXTO EM PORTUGUÊS, SEGUIR ESTE LINK <

WHO WE ARE

We are The Dowsers Society, an independent rock band from Lisbon, Portugal. Our music is a blended modern-vintage groovy rock'n'roll, highly influenced by the blues, the stoner and some psychedelic rock. Our songs reflect a relentless pursuit for electrified, reverberated sounds that echo and transport our imaginary to a desert space.

As this is being written, we are wholeheartedly working on the pre-production of our second album. As soon as we finish that phase, our goal is to move to a second phase, where we’re going to record our amazing next album in a professional recording studio [Black Sheep Studios]. You are a very important part of this process because, with your support, we’ll make this album come true.

Our band was born in 2014, by the hands of Carlos Alves, Luís Gama, and Ivo Martins. One year later, we entered the Black Sheep Studios with a handful of songs to record our eponymous debut album. It was a great experience and we all feel very fortunate to have our first album recorded, mixed, and mastered by Bruno Pedro Simões [Sean Riley & The Slowriders] in late 2015.

(

Our first album was released in March 2016 and was well received by some people that became our fans and some critics, in Portugal and abroad [Turkey, Brazil, Poland, Germany, Spain, USA, UK and others]. Since then, we have been promoting it with concerts around Portugal and Spain, giving us the opportunity to play in amazing venues such as Sabotage Rock Club [Lisbon], Texas Bar [Leiria], Costello Club [Madrid], Sala Filomatic [A Coruña] and many other great clubs with amazing crowds. Without you listeners, fans, backers, friends and family, none of this would be possible.

For the last couple of years, we have been working hard on the composition of new songs for our upcoming album. We want it to be better and greater than the first one and that’s why your support is so important. Our intention is to make a record with a total of 11 tracks, that are already written. For the next months we’re going to be deeply immersed in the pre-production of this record, just to make sure every single detail is going to be perfect when we enter the recording studio.

 

ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN

WHAT WE NEED?

Our campaign needs your support in order to get what we need to pay for:

  • Professional studio time for Recording, Mixing and Mastering all the tracks for the new album. This includes everything that we need from the studio: one week of Studio Time in a professional studio [Black Sheep Studios], Sound Engineer Work, Producer Work, Backline Renting, Special Gear Renting - €2500
  • The production of the physical album, in a 300 limited edition CD - €825
  • The Production of the Perks | Rewards for this campaign - €565
  • Other expenses like: instruments, cables and pedalboards maintenance… and a lot of coffee - €210

For this release we aim to raise a total of €4,100.

 

WHAT YOU GET?

Without you guys our music wouldn’t make any sense, so let’s make this journey together and, with your support, we’ll make this album come true. You can make donations OR get a Perk [reward] with a specific contribution amount. Every backer of this campaign will have their name in the Album Credits [unless you don’t want us to].

This is a Flexible Funding campaign, which means that if our campaign doesn’t meet its goal by its deadline, we will keep the funds anyway. Any amount of money will help us reaching our goal and still being able to fulfill all the perks for you. Your support is really important, because it will leverage our investment on recording this album.

For this record, the songs will be professionally produced by Carlos Bb António [from Keep Razors Sharp and others] in Black Sheep Studios, with the support of a resident sound technician.

We are really excited about making this record! Sharing it with you, our audience, is the icing on the cake. Our goal is to have the album ready for release on the first quarter of 2021.

For the kind of music we produce, to make a professional recording with the highest quality we’re aiming for, we need two main ingredients: to love what we’re doing and to invest a lot of time and money. 

If we surpass the target for the €4,100 amount, we will continue to raise more money for other activities that will be really important to promote this new record, such as:

  • Video[s] to promote the song[s] that will be released as single[s] for the album;
  • Production of a limited edition of the record in vinyl. This will include the remastering of the album specifically for vinyl pressing.

 

PERKS | REWARDS

€3 EUR - DIGITAL SINGLE - Digital Single download with 2 songs from the album

€10 EUR - DIGITAL ALBUM - Digital Album download of the full album

€15 EUR - CD + DIGITAL ALBUM - CD + Digital Album + 2 Guitar picks

€17 EUR - POSTER - Poster with the official album cover

€20 EUR - AUTOGRAPHED CD - Autographed CD + Digital Album

€25 EUR - T-SHIRT + DIGITAL ALBUM - T-shirt with the album cover + Digital album download

€30 EUR - AUTOGRAPHED CD DISCOGRAPHY + DIGITAL ALBUM - Autographed CD Discography [2 albums] + Digital Album [New album]

€50 EUR - BAND REHEARSAL + AUTOGRAPHED CD - You can come to a Band Rehearsal + Autographed CD

€60 EUR - ALBUM PRE-LISTENING SESSION + AUTOGRAPHED CD DISCOGRAPHY - Being with the band in a listening session of the full album, before it is released + Autographed CD Discography

€95 EUR - MAKING THE ALBUM - “Behind The Scenes” goodies [Studio recording sessions videos & photos] + Studio recording session autographed and enlarged printed photo

€1000 EUR - PRIVATE CONCERT + T-SHIRT - Private Concert [minimum 30 people] + T-shirt with the album cover for each attendee. Only available for Portugal [Azores and Madeira not included] and Spain. For other locations, send us an e-mail and we will manage case by case.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. If that’s your case, don’t worry. Just make sure you get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Spread the word in your favorite social media platform, using the link for our Campaign or for our Pitch Video. Don’t forget to Like our page on Facebook and follow us on Instagram. If you don’t like any of the social media platforms, just send an email to your friends. You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

If you have any doubts regarding our campaign, or if you have any question about what we’re doing on the album, don’t hesitate to ask us, using our social media pages or the email below:

FACEBOOK | https://www.facebook.com/TheDowsersSociety

INSTAGRAM | https://www.instagram.com/thedowserssociety

EMAIL | thedowserssociety@gmail.com

 

If you want to know a little bit more about us, follow the links below:

SPOTIFY | The Dowsers Society Album

ITUNES | The Dowsers Society Album

YOUTUBE | The Dowsers Society Album & New Found Land Video
story_txt:
> PARA LER O TEXTO EM PORTUGUÊS, SEGUIR ESTE LINK <WHO WE AREWe are The Dowsers Society, an independent rock band from Lisbon, Portugal. Our music is a blended modern-vintage groovy rock'n'roll, highly influenced by the blues, the stoner and some psychedelic rock. Our songs reflect a relentless pursuit for electrified, reverberated sounds that echo and transport our imaginary to a desert space.As this is being written, we are wholeheartedly working on the pre-production of our second album. As soon as we finish that phase, our goal is to move to a second phase, where we’re going to record our amazing next album in a professional recording studio [Black Sheep Studios]. You are a very important part of this process because, with your support, we’ll make this album come true.Our band was born in 2014, by the hands of Carlos Alves, Luís Gama, and Ivo Martins. One year later, we entered the Black Sheep Studios with a handful of songs to record our eponymous debut album. It was a great experience and we all feel very fortunate to have our first album recorded, mixed, and mastered by Bruno Pedro Simões [Sean Riley & The Slowriders] in late 2015.(Our first album was released in March 2016 and was well received by some people that became our fans and some critics, in Portugal and abroad [Turkey, Brazil, Poland, Germany, Spain, USA, UK and others]. Since then, we have been promoting it with concerts around Portugal and Spain, giving us the opportunity to play in amazing venues such as Sabotage Rock Club [Lisbon], Texas Bar [Leiria], Costello Club [Madrid], Sala Filomatic [A Coruña] and many other great clubs with amazing crowds. Without you listeners, fans, backers, friends and family, none of this would be possible.For the last couple of years, we have been working hard on the composition of new songs for our upcoming album. We want it to be better and greater than the first one and that’s why your support is so important. Our intention is to make a record with a total of 11 tracks, that are already written. For the next months we’re going to be deeply immersed in the pre-production of this record, just to make sure every single detail is going to be perfect when we enter the recording studio. ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGNWHAT WE NEED?Our campaign needs your support in order to get what we need to pay for:
Professional studio time for Recording, Mixing and Mastering all the tracks for the new album. This includes everything that we need from the studio: one week of Studio Time in a professional studio [Black Sheep Studios], Sound Engineer Work, Producer Work, Backline Renting, Special Gear Renting - €2500

The production of the physical album, in a 300 limited edition CD - €825

The Production of the Perks | Rewards for this campaign - €565

Other expenses like: instruments, cables and pedalboards maintenance… and a lot of coffee - €210

For this release we aim to raise a total of €4,100. WHAT YOU GET?Without you guys our music wouldn’t make any sense, so let’s make this journey together and, with your support, we’ll make this album come true. You can make donations OR get a Perk [reward] with a specific contribution amount. Every backer of this campaign will have their name in the Album Credits [unless you don’t want us to].This is a Flexible Funding campaign, which means that if our campaign doesn’t meet its goal by its deadline, we will keep the funds anyway. Any amount of money will help us reaching our goal and still being able to fulfill all the perks for you. Your support is really important, because it will leverage our investment on recording this album.For this record, the songs will be professionally produced by Carlos Bb António [from Keep Razors Sharp and others] in Black Sheep Studios, with the support of a resident sound technician.We are really excited about making this record! Sharing it with you, our audience, is the icing on the cake. Our goal is to have the album ready for release on the first quarter of 2021.For the kind of music we produce, to make a professional recording with the highest quality we’re aiming for, we need two main ingredients: to love what we’re doing and to invest a lot of time and money. If we surpass the target for the €4,100 amount, we will continue to raise more money for other activities that will be really important to promote this new record, such as:
Video[s] to promote the song[s] that will be released as single[s] for the album;
Production of a limited edition of the record in vinyl. This will include the remastering of the album specifically for vinyl pressing.
 PERKS | REWARDS€3 EUR - DIGITAL SINGLE - Digital Single download with 2 songs from the album€10 EUR - DIGITAL ALBUM - Digital Album download of the full album€15 EUR - CD + DIGITAL ALBUM - CD + Digital Album + 2 Guitar picks€17 EUR - POSTER - Poster with the official album cover€20 EUR - AUTOGRAPHED CD - Autographed CD + Digital Album€25 EUR - T-SHIRT + DIGITAL ALBUM - T-shirt with the album cover + Digital album download€30 EUR - AUTOGRAPHED CD DISCOGRAPHY + DIGITAL ALBUM - Autographed CD Discography [2 albums] + Digital Album [New album]€50 EUR - BAND REHEARSAL + AUTOGRAPHED CD - You can come to a Band Rehearsal + Autographed CD€60 EUR - ALBUM PRE-LISTENING SESSION + AUTOGRAPHED CD DISCOGRAPHY - Being with the band in a listening session of the full album, before it is released + Autographed CD Discography€95 EUR - MAKING THE ALBUM - “Behind The Scenes” goodies [Studio recording sessions videos & photos] + Studio recording session autographed and enlarged printed photo€1000 EUR - PRIVATE CONCERT + T-SHIRT - Private Concert [minimum 30 people] + T-shirt with the album cover for each attendee. Only available for Portugal [Azores and Madeira not included] and Spain. story:
Welcome! 

Hi there, I’m Michelle! Welcome to the Overcomer campaign!

About me: I’m a Vocalist, Composer, Voice Over Artist, Entertainer, and Cancer Survivor based in San Diego, CA--at least for now ;)  Last October, I celebrated 25 years cancer-free!

This Indiegogo campaign will wrap up on this year's National Cancer Survivor Day, June 6th, which is always a day to celebrate!

What's it all about?

Overcomer is a rock song I wrote, which feels like part rallying cry and part theme song for cancer survivors/thrivers, people living with diseases or chronic illnesses and conditions, and anyone who's been struggling in life. You are not your struggles--you are an Overcomer!

In supporting this campaign, you're actually becoming a partner in the project--helping to make it possible to record the song in LA and be filmed there as part of a young adult cancer survivor documentary. And when else will you have the opportunity to help make a rock song possible?! :)

NOTE: Recording, filming, and photography are TBD until things are a little more stable in the world, regarding the pandemic. The campaign is happening now to make sure we can proceed with it all when the time is right--hopefully a little later this year. 

Song mockup in the works, too--stay tuned! ;)

Why Overcomer?

For years, I felt like I was failing at life--because the side effects of my cancer treatment kept getting the best of me. Since childhood, I’ve struggled with long-term side effects of my cancer treatment--the most impactful of them being chronic fatigue and chemo brain (aka brain fog), and chronic back pain with past muscle spasm episodes. 

After numerous dropped college classes, dropped semesters, college changes, moves, and failed jobs over the years--plus the brain fog getting more invasive these past few years and a scary gut health issue--it's been wearing on me. I felt like a failure and an imposter, too. On the outside, it looked like I was doing well, but on the inside, I felt so insecure, and struggled with bouts of depression, too.

Then one day, I decided to give myself a reframe--and everything started to shift. Last Fall, I saw a comment that a past teacher wrote on a post I'd made involving a cancer charity. She said, "Michelle, you are an overcomer." I read that a few times--considering what an overcomer is. Could that really be me? In the following weeks, I kept thinking about that word and finally decided to try it on.

Reframing myself as an "Overcomer" was a total game-changer.

I realized that life had dealt me a lot of challenges, and I've worked so hard to overcome them--but I never really gave myself credit for that. Can you relate? I have a feeling that a lot of you reading this are Overcomers, too.

Join me on this journey. Take a leap of faith. Start calling yourself an Overcomer, and see how your view of yourself and the world changes. You can do it! :)

This campaign has 2 sides—the Fundraising side and the Community side.

Fundraising:

Funds raised here will go toward the costs for my new song, Overcomer, including recording costs, musician stipends, and professional photography.

I’m keeping the budget pretty tight, so the perks I’m offering are digital, instead of me sending you a bunch of stuff that'll collect dust in your home! The other bonus of digital is that this campaign isn’t generating crazy amounts of packaging and trash—it’s zero waste!

Estimated costs:

  • Recording costs: Recording studio hours, Mixing hours, Mastering fee
  • Musician stipends
  • Professional photography of recording session & for single cover

Community:

On the Community side of things, join me in creating a reframe for anyone who’s been struggling in life. Maybe it’s you. I want to know—What’s your story? How would the way you think about yourself and your life change if you started to think of yourself in a more empowering way—as an Overcomer? (Facebook group coming soon!)

It’s my hope that this campaign will also bring more awareness about young adult cancer survivors and some of the challenges we face as a result of our cancer treatments. There are also many people who live with chronic diseases and conditions, like my dad, with Parkinson's Disease. Overcomer is for also for my dad, and all of you, too.

Many of my friends are survivors and thrivers who continue to have tests, scans, surgeries, and treatments so they can keep busy living life! They're some of the most incredible people I know, contributing to the inspiration for this song. Together, we have all kinds of *fun* side effects--since cancer treatment is the *gift* that keeps on giving--and despite what some of us have been told, we're not "too young" to be experiencing them!

Perks:

  • A personalized Thank You email to supporters 
    • All supporters receive this, since every dollar helps!
  • Thank you to each supporter in Media - All supporters
    • In the end credits of the music videos, once they're made, even if they're simple at first
    • On my website
    • On CD cards or sleeves (whenever I can make physical CDs)
    • Shout outs on social media
  • Digital download of the song art - for the Silver level and up
    • Once it's created & released with the song!
  • Be in the future Overcomer music video!
    • Be an Extra in the video!* - Gold level and up
    • Be a Featured Extra in video!* - Platinum level and up 
    • Filming note:
      • Dates TBD with this pandemic, but I'd love for you to join me when it happens
      • If you can't make it in person, I'll think of a creative solution to include you
      • *Guidelines for filming will be provided & must be agreed to for participation, to ensure everyone's safety & well-being
  • Not a perk yet, but...
    • Hoping I can also provide a digital download of the song to supporters once the song is recorded and released. I'm looking into the best way to do this
    • I'm working on a Virtual drawing!
      • I'm reaching out to local small business to partner with for products and services valued at $25 and up - for the Silver level and above
      • Each $25 increment of support = 1 virtual ticket
        • Example: Gold ($50) = 2 tickets, Platinum ($100) = 4 tickets, etc.
  • More perks in the works!

I really appreciate your support and want to shout "thank you" from the rooftops to all of you!

Other Ways You Can Help!

  • Share my campaign with your friends, family members, loved ones, teachers, co-workers, bosses, people you meet on the bus/train/subway... I'd be so grateful!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out about my campaign!
  • Use these 3 hashtags together in your posts: #Overcomer #MichelleDeNicola #Indiegogo

About the Artist

Since childhood, I’ve been singing, playing instruments and performing, and even I started writing songs before I learned music notation (my mom thought they were coded messages!)

To date, I’ve written and recorded 2 original songs, We Rise and Life is Beautiful to Me, both released during the pandemic in 2020. I’ve recorded a few jazz songs, too--one of which I released in August 2020, Corcovado, and one Christmas song so far, O Holy Night, released this past December. Many more original songs are in the works, plus I hope to record more jazz songs for an entire jazz album, with original arrangements to mix things up!

My music doesn't quite fit into a single genre. We Rise is a folk song that's very relevant to the times we live in, and Life is Beautiful to Me is a pop song I wrote to celebrate 25 years as a cancer survivor! (I can hardly believe it myself!) Throughout college, I've performed numerous jazz standards and Bossa Novas, plus some musical theatre songs, too. On the writing side, I have a pop song with electronic music in progress and I'm working on a country, song, too. To round all of that out, Overcomer is a rock song. 

But I don't choose the genres--the songs do! 

More about that later ;)

Connect with me! 

Check out my music & more at MichelleDeNicola.com

Links at MichelleDeNicola.com/Links

Facebook.com/MichelleDeNicola.Music

Instagram: @MichelleDeNicola

story:
SONGWRITER'S JOURNEY

I love a song that took guts to write. A song that feels like relief when you listen to it. Feels more like medicine in the form of a melody. A song that makes you feel validated, understood. That's what has driven my songwriting over the years, the literal years it's taken me to bring forth these 10 songs for my debut studio album.

It's time to make this record; it's time these songs are connected with their audience; it's time to give these songs back to the world and people that helped me write them. They're about bravery & vulnerability; heartbreak & hope; friendships & family. Songs driven by deep human emotions and experiences. Songs meant to make my listeners - to make YOU - feel and feel seen.

RECORDING IN NASHVILLE

Singer-songwriter and producer Mary Bragg will be producing the record and bringing these songs to life. Mary's "Violets as Camouflage" was rated one of NPR's 10 Best Albums of 2019. We'll be recording 10 tracks in Nashville, TN in the studio of Josh Kaler (Josh's former clients include Marc Scibilia, William Fitzsimmons, Matthew Perryman Jones, Jump Little Children, among others.) A host of professional session musicians will give my little baby songs color and depth.

PRE-ORDER THE ALBUM

I believe these songs are important, not just to me, but to people who seek validation; to listeners who need space to feel vulnerable; to anyone who needs a boost of courage. It's one thing to make this album, and another thing entirely to ensure this album reaches listeners' ears. By pre-ordering this album, you're helping ensure the successful distribution of these songs.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Cam Kimbrough. I am a Hill Country Blues artist from North Mississippi. My Grandfather is Legendary Hill Country Bluesman, Junior Kimbrough. I grew up around Grandaddy’s juke joint as a little boy not even old enough to ride a bike yet. I would watch as my dad, Kenny Malone Kimbrough played the drums and sat behind him trying to mimick his movements, not knowing at the time that the music that was being played would become famous for it's own origin. It would be several years until I actually sat at a drumset and played—or, attempted to play at this small Baptist church in Potts Camp, Ms where I was born and raised. I was thirteen years old when me and my dad went to Beale street in Memphis, TN where we ran into Lightnin Malcolm, an associate of my dad’s who gave me my first opportunity to play the drums in front of a crowd. It was at that moment that I realized that I had a passion for music.

Several years passed until I would meet back up with Lightnin again when he would ask me to tour with him as his drummer. We recorded an album and toured everywhere from east to west coast performing in front of audiences of five folks to thousands of people. During this tour I realized I wanted nothing more than to continue this lifestyle as a musician so, I began teaching myself to play guitar and studying more about the craft of the hill country blues. I have performed with Robert Belfour, Eric Deaton, Cedric Burnside, R.L. Boyce, Gary Burnside, Joe Ayers, Homemade Jamz, and Leo Bud Welch.

About The Campaign 

I’m starting this campaign because I am now ready release my first solo blues project: the Head for the Hills EP. Over the course of a few years, I have put together a small home studio which has enabled me to record my own music.  I’ve written and recorded 6 new songs and now that the tracks are recorded, I am ready to take the final steps in the completion of this project. Head for the Hills has 5 tracks and 1 bonus track at the end. This EP is important to me because this is the beginning of my chance to keep my grandfather’s legacy going. I put my soul into this music. It is truly the first time I have ever put this much energy and this much of myself into a project. Whether I get famous like him or not, I really want to make Grandaddy proud in hopes that he smiles down from the heavens.

North Mississippi Hill Country music is on the brink of extinction and contributors will help keep this unique style of music alive. There’s not very many current artists playing this style of music and I want to contribute to the culture and the art as well as play a part in introducing a new generation to this music that I love so much and leave behind a legacy for my own children.

Goals & Perks

My goal for this project is $2000. The money will help pay for the mixing and mastering of the tracks, the manufacturing of the EP (getting it pressed up), the disc artwork and layout, copyrighting, promotion, packaging and shipping. I am hoping to reach my goal and then some. If I exceed my $2,000 campaign, any money received over the initial goal, will be used to help me upgrade my home studio and buy pampers for my newborn! :-)   There are some really great perks if you help out! If you pledge anything from $10 to $1000, you could receive perks such as signed copy of the EP, a guitar or a personalized song written by yours truly. If I do not reach my entire funding goal, the funds raised will be put towards the mixing and mastering of the EP. I really appreciate any help in funding this project.

The Impact 

I want this project to give people hope in the fact that there is still real music to come; music with substance, true emotion and life experiences. This project is important because it is a continuation of a culture that reminds us that Blues is in everything. It surrounds us and reminds us that there is still light at the end of the tunnel.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with this project is funding the mixing, mastering and manufacturing of the EP (the 3 M’s! :-)). I hope this campaign reaches enough folks that I’ll meet my goal and bring you one unforgettable Hill Country experience! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Pledging is not the only way to help. You can also help us get the word out about this campaign.  Get on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Myspace and share, share, share! Thank you in advance for any and all support! 

p.s. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Hello, my name is Cam Kimbrough.
I am a Hill Country Blues artist from North Mississippi.
My Grandfather is Legendary Hill Country Bluesman, Junior Kimbrough. I grew up
around Grandaddy’s juke joint as a little boy not even old enough to ride a bike
yet. I would watch as my dad, Kenny Malone Kimbrough played the drums and sat
behind him trying to mimick his movements, not knowing at the time that the
music that was being played would become famous for it's own origin. It would
be several years until I actually sat at a drumset and played—or, attempted to
play at this small Baptist church in Potts Camp, Ms where I was born and
raised. I was thirteen years old when me and my dad went to Beale street in
Memphis, TN where we ran into Lightnin Malcolm, an associate of my dad’s who
gave me my first opportunity to play the drums in front of a crowd. It was at
that moment that I realized that I had a passion for music. 
Several years passed until I
would meet back up with Lightnin again when he would ask me to tour with him as
his drummer. We recorded an album and toured everywhere from east to west coast
performing in front of audiences of five folks to thousands of people. During
this tour I realized I wanted nothing more than to continue this lifestyle as a
musician so, I began teaching myself to play guitar and studying more about the
craft of the hill country blues. I have performed with Robert Belfour, Eric
Deaton, Cedric Burnside, R.L. Boyce, Gary Burnside, Joe Ayers, Homemade Jamz,
and Leo Bud Welch.

About The Campaign I’m starting this campaign because I am now ready
release my first solo blues project: the Head for the Hills EP. Over the course of a few years,
I have put together a small home studio which has enabled me to record my own
music.  I’ve written and recorded 6 new
songs and now that the tracks are recorded, I am ready to take the final steps
in the completion of this project. Head for the Hills has 5 tracks and 1 bonus
track at the end. This EP is important to me because this is the beginning of
my chance to keep my grandfather’s legacy going. I put my soul into this music.
It is truly the first time I have ever put this much energy and this much of
myself into a project. Whether I get famous like him or not, I really want to
make Grandaddy proud in hopes that he smiles down from the heavens. 

North Mississippi Hill Country
music is on the brink of extinction and contributors will help keep this unique
style of music alive. There’s not very many current artists playing this style
of music and I want to contribute to the culture and the art as well as play a
part in introducing a new generation to this music that I love so much and
leave behind a legacy for my own children.

My goal for this project is $2000. The money will help pay for the mixing and mastering of the tracks, the manufacturing of the EP (getting it pressed up), the disc artwork and layout, copyrighting, promotion, packaging and shipping. I am hoping to reach my goal and
then some. If I exceed my $2,000 campaign, any money received over the initial
goal, will be used to help me upgrade my home studio and buy pampers for my
newborn! :-)   There are some really great perks if you help out! If you pledge anything from $10 to $1000, you could receive perks such as signed copy of the EP, a guitar or a personalized song written by yours truly. If I do not reach my entire funding goal, the funds raised will be put towards the mixing and mastering of the EP. I really appreciate any
help in funding this project.
The Impact I want this project to give people hope in the fact that there is still real music to come; music with substance, true emotion and life experiences. This project is important because it is a continuation of a culture that reminds us that Blues is in everything. It surrounds us and reminds us that there is still light at the end of the tunnel.

Risks & Challenges


The biggest challenge
with this project is funding the mixing, mastering and manufacturing of the EP
(the 3 M’s! :-)). I hope this campaign reaches enough
folks that I’ll meet my goal and bring you one unforgettable Hill Country
experience! 
Other Ways You Can Help

Pledging is not the only way to help. You can also help us get the word out about this campaign.  Get on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Myspace and share, share, share! Thank you in advance for any and all support! 
p.s. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About Me

After a career in professional basketball and teaching a fire that had been lit as a child had somehow erupted into a full out blaze. In 2009 I formed Sweaty Llama Music (an idea that was actually envisioned in 2001). Within the first year in my hometown of Cleveland, Ohio I produced two full albums an EP and a host other songs for a few artists. 2012 would be the year where crazy met faith. I decided to sell my house and everything in it except my musical equipment and my son's bedroom set and moved my family to California with the mission of maximizing my abilities as an artist. Since the move I have built many new and lasting relationships in the music industry and earned the respect of my peers. I have been on four tours around the world playing drums for some very creative and  diverse artists. I gained a wealth of knowledge in my experiences but one of the lessons that I treasure most is that people need each other especially in areas where they are limited. Although I've self produced, mixed and mastered over 5 Albums and EP's for some very talented artists, my vision was never a problem but I realized that my resources and my own skill set in certain areas were limited. This time around I would love to incorporate the personnel of the experts to independently create the quality of music that will actually be able to stand along and push the threshold of today's mainstream music and  compete with award winning artists alike. 

What I Need

The Goal is to raise $30k in 30 days. The costs will be allocated in these categories:
  • Recording: I recorded my first solo album in my closet due to limited resources. It got the attention of listeners from around the world through iTunes, Spotify and other online outlets. Although I am extremely grateful for each and every listener, I felt like the project would have been a better experience for the listener if I had recorded it the way I had envisioned in a professional studio. 
  • Mixing: THE MIX IS ONE ELEMENT YOU CANNOT COMPROMISE! I also mixed my first album which wasn't terrible but when stacked next to my competition (award-winning artists, mixing engineers and producers) the results are night and day in terms of sonic quality. With your support I get to delegate these critical elements of a successful album to the proper professionals. 
  • Mastering: The final polishing of the recording.
  • Manufacturing: There are still music enthusiasts who like hard copies (cd and vinyl) of their music.
  • Artistic Collaboration: On this album I want to feature some talent that perhaps you've heard of as well as turn you on to some talent that you may not know.
  • Marketing: For a record label some of their mid to high profile artists can get marketing budgets into the tens and hundreds of thousands of dollars. I believe that this project will be a matter of getting it into the right hands. I will be allocating funds to a publicist who will in turn present it to some of the more reputable blogs in an effort to create awareness for the project.
  • Visuals: Songs that have strong visual campaigns gives the songs an added level of awareness and support. I already have some unique concepts constructed for a few of the songs and will be collaborating with videographers to bring them to fruition.
  • Perks: I have some cool perks that you can get your hands on. The perks range from a facebook high-fives, to t-shirts and signed merch all the way to me cooking one of my favorite meals for you! You'll find them listed below.
  • If I do not reach the goal then I will return to the closet finish the album and gas up the Uber car! Any funds received short of the goal will go towards Mixing and Mastering. These two may be the most critical elements of any musical project and cannot be compromised! 

The Impact

With your contribution to this project you have the unique opportunity to put an under-the-radar artist into the light and show the world that collaborations of this format can help unlock the creator's full potential. The purpose of this project:

  • To display my musical talents and ability to coordinate a quality cast of individuals who are dedicated to producing quality art. 

  • To execute an industry ready and quality recording using what is considered to be a low budget. 

  • To help create sustainably of future work for the artists and personnel used in the creation of this project. 

  • To inspire the aspiring art creators of mine and future generations with the message of anything is truly possible with a little help. 

  • To inspire the hearts of the listener to play an active role in the Loveolution!

Risks & Challenges

  • Not securing collaborations: To overcome this obstacle I have a large network of highly competent and qualified individuals that will be more than ready to step in if I am unsuccessful in securing any of the envisioned collaborations due to budget or availability. 
  • I've already taken the risks for you. I left my hometown with no other plan but to succeed and maximize my abilities as an artist. It's been nothing but a wonderful learning experience and adventure. Now all I need is a boost to show what I can really do with the appropriate resources.
  • Please feel free to research me @DameDrummer or DameTheDrummer, check out my social media outlets to check my consistency and even reach out to people that you see associated with me if you want an extra level of comfort in trusting me with your contribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially please share!!!

  • Help spread the word for 30 days. Let people know that you're interested. Who knows the may take interest too. Word of mouth is still the #1 form of advertising! 
  • Indiegogo has some really cool sharing tools so use them as much as you'd like for 30 days until we hit the goal.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Hey friends, Madman's Window here from Cobourg, Ontario. A few years back we decided to put together a band to perform our favorite folk songs from Ireland, Scotland, and Canada's East Coast. Our name comes from a rock formation near our family home in County Antrim in Northern Ireland. Our music tries to capture the passion of that ruggedly beautiful part of the world mixed with the joy and warmth of your favorite neighborhood pub. Add a touch of madness and piracy and you've got Madman's Window.

Our goal is to raise funds to produce our debut recording. Recording an album is a dream of most musicians. It is a chance for us to say "look what we've accomplished". This recording will also allow us to introduce our sound and our music to a broader audience and open up new doors for us as performers. But we can't do it without the support of contributors like you. You can help us to fulfill our dream of capturing our music on CD.
What We Need & What You Get

We want to make our debut recording a professional quality recording. Using a professional studio with a professional recording engineer to best capture our sound and the energy of our live performances. We have teamed up with the amazing Matt Azzarello. Matt is an incredible producer and audio engineer. We are lucky to get the chance to work with him.

We also wish to make our CD look, sound, and feel the best we possibly can. We want the cover art done by a professional local artist, the design and layout of the CD done by professional local graphic designers, and the CD and packaging done by professional manufacturers to give our listeners the best quality product. The kind of quality we are striving for comes at a cost. We are asking for your help to raise the money needed to record our music and get CDs made. 

We estimate the cost of making this recording to break down like this:

$ 3,500 Studio time, recording and mixing

$ 1,500 Printing and Packaging

$ 500 Cover art (Plus one of us has to get it tattooed on them)

$ 500 Graphic design for CD covers.

By helping us make our recording you are not only helping us make our dreams come true, you are also helping to preserve an important style of music. Your contribution will allow us to create a professional quality recording of these wonderful songs. Our recording will help preserve some fantastic traditional pub favorites, a classic Canadian sea shanty, and a few of our own original songs done in the traditional style.

In the event that we are unable to raise the full amount required we will still make sure that your contribution is put to good use. We will still release our recording. However we may have to put fewer songs on the CD, scale back on the cover art and packaging, or delay our release date until we can raise the funds.  


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that times are tough and not everyone is able to contribute financially to our project. But there are still ways you can help out that can be just as valuable. Please help us out by spreading the word that Madman's Window is putting out a recording. You can visit and "Like" our Facebook page. You can share our campaign on social media by using Indiegogo's share tools. And you can come see us when we play at your local pub or festival and let us know that you support us.

Thank you Very much.

story:
Short Summary

Hi Everyone,
My name is Tim Chatwood and I am a new music composer from Reno, Nevada. I have some very good news. I am excited to announce that my piece Flicker was selected for performance at the 2016 New York City Electroacoustic Music Festival!! This performance is a great opportunity for me and my musical career. This event is a major festival in the electroacoustic/new music scene and attending this event will allow me to network and share my music with others.  

What We Need & What You Get

The funding I need is to cover the cost of travel from Reno, Nevada to New York City and to cover the event registration fee. I will be offering some exciting perks to the contributors of this campaign.  

The Impact

The impact to supporting this campaign is tremendous. New music is trying to find a place in todays world and events like this give new music a place to be performed. 

  • I will be sharing my music with others.
  • Meeting other new music composers and performers. 
  • Building experience in performing to other audiences.

Risks & Challenges

I feel that is campaign has very few risks. I have been accepted to perform at the 2016 New York City Electroacoustic Music Festival. The only challenge is having enough funds to make the trip. I can overcome these challenges if needed by:

  • Working more shifts at my day job.-This would take away from time to write,
  • Finding other sources of funding. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to this campaign, there are many other ways you can help.

  • Like my facebook page https://www.facebook.com/Tim-Chatwood-Music-1524248447857464/?ref=hl
  • Share this campaign with others. 
  • Check out my pieces at https://soundcloud.com/tim-chatwood-music

story:
A Little Bit About Us

Well, hello there! We are Scarlet Cord, an Alternative Rock band from the island of Oahu, Hawaii. We have performed at a variety of venues including Ala Moana Center, Crossroads, Waikiki Shell, and multiple local bars. Recently, we have opened up for two popular, national bands: Hawthorne Heights and The Wonder Years.

We are in the process of recording our first full length album. We've been working hard in and out of the studio and we are super excited for you to hear the finished product. By donating funds to us through this campaign, you grant us more time in the studio and provide us with the capital to manufacture and distribute physical copies of the album.

Our first single off the album: Grandma, is available to stream for free at our website http://scarletcordband.com as well as Spotify. It is also available to purchase on Amazon, iTunes, and other major online retailers. We are extremely excited and very close to completing our album, but we can't do it without your help! 

Our Goal And Your Rewards

Our goal is to raise $1000, and all of it will (regardless of if we reach it or not) go into the production of our album, whether it be studio time or manufacturing physical copies of our album.

Your rewards* come in a whole bunch of forms! Check it out:

  • $5 donations will recieve a personalized thank you email and drawing from Preston, Evan, Reese, and David 
  • $10 donations will have their name in the credits of our album
  • $25 donations will receive a signed copy of the album. 
  • $50 donations will receive a Scarlet Cord T-Shirt
  • $100 donations and Scarlet Cord will cover any song of your choice. 
  • $150 donations will receive free concert tickets to our paid shows for the year of 2017
  • $200 donations will receive a personal dinner (with up to 3 other people) cooked by the band 

*Donating $25 will get you the respective reward as well as the rewards under it. (eg. $20 donations will receive the $10 and $5 reward etc.) 

The Impact

Simply put: having an album is the first huge step towards making our "local music" into perhaps "national music" or even "international music." This as a result would give us the privilege of living primarily off of the money we make from our music and other merchandise. The best and most humbling part about it is it wouldn't be just us who would have gotten ourselves to that place. It would have started with you!

Other Ways You Can Help

As a band that needs help financially, we completely understand if you aren't in a position to give. If that's you, but still would like to help, there are still many things crucial to the success of this campaign anyone can help us with!

You can also help us by:

  • Spreading the word about our campaign. You can share/message the link, or even tell people in person about it. Anything helps!
    • If you're looking for an easy way to share our campaign, IndieGoGo provides a Facebook, Twitter, or Email sharing tools (located towards the top right of this page).
  • Prayer, encouragement, and advice.
    • We always welcome these things in situations like this. We don't know everything, so when you pray, encourage, and/or give us advice, you empower us to move on with more motivation and purpose. As a result, we hope for it to show in our performances and future endeavors.

Thank you for taking the time to get to know who we are and what this is all about. Have an awesome day!

- Preston, David, Reese, and Evan

This as a result would give us the privilege of living primarily off of the money we make from our music and other merchandise. The best and most humbling part about it is it wouldn't be just us who would have gotten ourselves to that place. It would have started with you!

Other Ways You Can Help
As a band that needs help financially, we completely understand if you aren't in a position to give. If that's you, but still would like to help, there are still many things crucial to the success of this campaign anyone can help us with!
You can also help us by:

Spreading the word about our campaign. You can share/message the link, or even tell people in person about it. Anything helps!If you're looking for an easy way to share our campaign, IndieGoGo provides a Facebook, Twitter, or Email sharing tools (located towards the top right of this page).

Prayer, encouragement, and advice.We always welcome these things in situations like this. We don't know everything, so when you pray, encourage, and/or give us advice, you empower us to move on with more motivation and purpose. As a result, we hope for it to show in our performances and future endeavors.


Thank you for taking the time to get to know who we are and what this is all about. Have an awesome day!- Preston, David, Reese, and Evan

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Wes Charlton and I am a singer, songwriter, producer/engineer, musician and performer. I have released two albums to-date: American Bittersweet (2004, End of the Road Records) and World on Fire (2008, Judy Collins’ Wildflower Records). Both albums achieved critical acclaim and had songs featured on television shows such as Real World Key West and World of Jenks. Songs from both albums were also featured in the film The New Twenty, and the song Promised Land won 2nd place in the International Songwriting Competition.

Here’s what some people have said about my music:

“Good songs – great lyrics!”          -Marshall Chess, NYC

"He has that sound that pop music has been missing: a sincere, singer with something to say and haunting melodies to match! I know I'm hooked!”- Anna Goodman-Herrick, Producer, MTV

"Wes is one of those singer songwriters who don't so much re-write the rules as re-invent them. Just when you think it's all been done, someone like Wes shows you how every generation gets the chance to add to the musical conversation."   - Jerry Jodice,  www.GreatAmericanMusicHour.com

"With the landscape of the South to inspire him, the result is a voice whose country & folk soul is drunk with addictive pop melodies.”-Leah Manners, Station Manager WCWM 90.7 FM, VA

"Wes is as good a young songwriter as any I have ever worked with."

          -Chris Keup, Co-writer/Producer for Johnathan Rice & Jason Mraz

What we need and What You Get

I am set to release my third album, titled Morning Stars, in early 2017. Based on demos and rough mixes of the songs on the album, there is already considerable interest in the industry. Thus far, I have self-funded the entire recording process, which is now complete. While this has been a strain on my family, they support me 100%, making this a true labor of love.

The only costs that remain are final mixing ($4,000.00), mastering ($2,000.00) and album duplication ($1,600.00). Contributions will go directly to help cover these final post-production costs and will make this labor of love a reality. It’s likely that contributors will help this album gain world-wide distribution and gain high-profile spots being featured in various television shows and films. Most importantly, contributors can rest assured that they are helping me bring what I am confident is great American music to the wider listening public, and they can have a front-seat role in the tradition of great American songs.

Risks and Challenges, plus Perks

I am confident that we will reach our mark for contributions and that this album will be released. If contributions end up not covering all expenses, though, then the contributions received will be applied first to final mixing, then mastering, etc…The remaining costs will be covered by hook or by crook, so rest assured this album will be coming to you soon!

Here is a detailed list of perks for each level of contribution:

$20 preorder copy of Morning Stars


$60 preorder signed copy of Morning Stars

$80 preorder signed copy of Morning Stars + signed copy of American Bittersweet & World On Fire

$100 all of the above + copy of handwritten lyrics for all songs on Morning Stars plus a t-shirt with the album cover (see the cover image for this campaign and the video)

$200 all above + Shutterfly book of photos taken by acclaimed photographers Aaron Farrington and Jack Roebuck of me and the musicians in the studio recording

$300 all above + copy of album the full GarageBand demos of Morning Stars I recorded prior to the studio recordings – these are intimate recording demos of the songs that will be featured on the final album

$400 all above + your name in the album credits for Morning Stars

$500 all above + I will record a fully arranged song for you – you pick, cover or original

$750 all above + I will write and record a song for you (you provide me subject and theme)

$1000 all above + a free private show (if out-of-state then pick a location in Virginia or pay travel fare) or I will co-write a song with you and record a demo of it with you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but are not in a position to contribute financially, don’t worry! You can still play an essential role in helping me realize this project by sharing this campaign with as many people as possible, spreading the word about me, this album and my other albums, and if you’d like to see a show, contact me about booking (wes.charlton@gmail.com).

Thanks to everyone who has given their support and faith  along the way. Let's do this. 

Wes Charlton

story:
Please make an urgent contribution of $10 to promote our "dump trump - VOTE HILLARY"  music video

Here's the truth: This race has tightened dramatically over the last several weeks in every single battleground state.9 We would be foolish to pretend that it isn't happening.

We must invest in the reality we want.

Please vote now by contributing $10 to promote our “dump trump – VOTE HILLARY” music video.

The media isn't doing its job. They are acting irresponsibly and failing to hold Trump accountable for his ignorant—and even illegal—actions. In fact, they're spending more time focusing on Hillary Clinton taking a sick day then they are on Trump's irrational and bigoted policies or whether we can risk someone so unstable and corrupt with his finger on the nuclear button.

So we have to educate and turn out voters ourselves—one click at a time.

Now’s the time to be heard – as little as $10 DOES CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE

Please click to vote with $10 now  -- VOTE HILLARY!

story:
We in RPRT have been hard at work over the fall and winter writing new songs for our album. Long drives and countless hours in the studio have culminated in a bunch upbeat riffs and poppunk ballads. The only problem we have as of yet is these recordings are only demos. The next step if for us to get back in the studio and record them into their sweet, finalized, mastered state ready for your ears. Once the tracks are finished we are going to have them printed to CD's. Yes that's right, as a perk you will be able to have the first ever physical copies of RPRT songs! 

With all this said we are asking for some help from you, our loyal and just downright awesome friends. Yes that means you too, even though we may have never met, if you are a fan of RPRT, you are a friend of RPRT! 

Huge Thank You from all of us,

Dakota, Tyler, Pierce, Cody, Jacy

story:
Kin-Tama Record Label

Kin-Tama (Golden Eggs) came from the idea that everyone should be able to show who they are, show their golden balls on the beat or whatever it is you do. Whether it's trowing a back-flip or skate boarding.

With the creation of this record label the opportunity for unsigned artists internationally are limitless.We will help fund and create dreams while producing our own. Most important we do not temper with the revenue share of an artist and individuals property is his/her art and we respect that.

By contributing to this cause you will help us realize our dream of producing music and helping numerous artist that need most marketing support, to make a possible breakthrough in their own career, or even if it is to be discovered by another artists or label we want to provide the first steps necessary to make a music production for unsigned artists.

Supporters needed

The 20K needed shall provide for the legal establishment and a few equipment, since we already have studio and such all of the accumulated money will be invested in the growth of the company and equipment needed to make an international record label thrive. 

Because of our connections in the Caribbean , Europe and Japan we have a broad marketing crowd that will love the music we create and the productions we release.
What are funders will receive from us are CD's and Albums even features that will let the supporter come in contact with the artist he supported. Further more there are shirts made from the company logo and other specific designs that are also part of the perks.

If the entire 20.000$ Goal is not reached all the fund will go in the establishment of "Kin-Tama". And of course it will be visible on our thank you Facebook page on all the artists we were able to help record an album that they wanted or produce a beat that they had in their head.

The Impact

The contribution you make will make a huge difference in the music industries because marketing is everything. and now days most artists don't get recognized because of the amount of people that can hear them. because the people who do hear them like the music but can't share it enough. so it all comes down to deliverance and marketing. 
What KinTama wants to do is make sure that the artist does not get ripped off, this is also a common problem in the industries that artist to not get payed what Their music is worth and the person on top makes the money even though he only did a little bit of connective marketing.

Kintama Record label will be released with a song called "Kin-Tama" and that will be the first example of what our record label can accomplish for artists world wide.

Whatever comes in our way

There will always be Challenges on the way, a record label does not start out to be successful but i am convinced that with my team much can be accomplished in  a short amount of time. the world we live in now craves for positivism and no negative vibes. 

I am also convinced that with the diversity of the music we will bring to the table will open a new perspective on how things should be done in the artistic way. 
We do not limit ourselves to one genre like trap , house, or cultural but instead we aim to be able to mix them all in to one master piece and massage the music that we create in what we want our final production to be.

Contribution doesn't mean money

We will be very happy with whatever you contribute, it doesn't have to be money it could also be just a little bit of your time to share our champagne with the indiegogo tools made or if you know any artist or family member that will like to do something in the area of music, tell them to contact us.

story:
The story so far...

Hello everyone, we're Black Label, a local band from Maastricht, the Netherlands. For five years, we've been making music together, and we've already recorded our first demo. Since we started the band, we've played over 100 shows and recorded a 5-track demo and 2 singles. Now, we're looking to record a 5-track EP, and we need your help to make it a reality!

What's in it for us, and what's in it for you?

We're keeping our expenses very simple. We are going to record the EP at the same recording studio we also used to record our 2 singles. At €400 per song, that's a €2000 budget we're going for.

Should we raise more than €2000 (haha, I know, right?), we'll put that money to funding the perks we're offering, and if we have money left after that, we're going to record a video for one of our songs!

For every level of contribution that you're willing to make to this cause, you'll receive a reward. These rewards range from a digital download of the EP, all the way to Black Label writing, recording and performing a song just for you!

Why it's important to fund your music scene...

Local bands, unlike the big bands with big labels behind them, are comprised of just regular Joes like you and I. Recording an EP takes time and money. We can put in the time, but the money is a challenge for us. Shows are unpaid more often than not, where we play just for the exposure and the good times, and the band is costing is money rather than making it.

We also want to keep a level of independence. Signing to a record label takes away a degree of freedom, and we believe that artistic and personal freedom is what rock 'n roll is all about. So we look to the community, the fans, the headbangers, the moshers, those who share our passion for music, to help us realise our goals.

What could possibly go wrong?

We've kept our goals modest, and we want to see how well this goes before committing to more serious projects. The worst that could happen is that we don't raise our €2000 goal, in which case we pay a little bit more to Indiegogo. The money we do raise goes into the recording process, naturally, and we'll have to chip in ourselves for as much as we can.

Even if we do not reach our goals, we are 100% determined to honour our commitments and give the perks to those who contributed to our cause!

Other Ways You Can Help...

We know that some of you, like us, share the passion for the music, but don't have a lot of money to spend. Well, in that case, there are a few things you can help us with, if you'd feel inclined!

Spread the word about our fundraising campaign! The more people become aware, the easier it will be for us to make this a reality. Indiegogo has a lot of very handy sharing tools for all kinds of social media!

Come visit our shows! We'd love to see you attend a Black Label show! Come say 'hi' and grab a drink with us!

Support your local music scene! Go see the small, independant, local bands live! Buy a t-shirt, or a CD, or a beer, or just give them a well deserved pat on their sweaty backs after a long night of rocking out!
