story:
Hi,

I am Ireen Bill - a Female Bassist, Double Bassist, Singer, Songwriter and Girl-Child/Women Empowerment Advocate, from Nigeria, Africa.

My music borders on afropop with a rich mix of Afrobeats, Urban Highlife and Jazz. My fans and music lovers are called BILLONIERS*.

My brand stands to showcase the creativity, beauty and strength of the african woman and my music generally features strong African vocals , lyrics and percussions, laced with electric bass solos, bass lines and double bass grooves.

You Gotta Be Stronger Than A Horse!

TO BE A FEMALE IN AFRICA = CHALLENGING.

TO BE A FEMALE BASSIST, DOUBLE BASSIST AND SINGER = EXTRA-CHALLENGING.

As an African Female, most times you are expected to be normal ; doing all the normal things which the society expects of a woman.....

*sips tea*.

But that ain't gonna be me. I no go gree! ( pronounced i wont agree) *frowning face* Because i am ready for the challenge!

Here's a little part of my story......

Years Ago, I fell in love with Music and the Bass. The passion grew so strong and  it gave me a purpose in life; one that would help people get better in every way, through my music.

Suddenly In 2010, I was involved in a ghastly motor accident that left 2 dead.

I was bedridden for months, almost giving up, gained a lot of weight, depression, anxiety and fear set in!

But my love for the bass and music, and the love from those my bass-playing and music inspired, gave me a reason to keep pushing, kept me motivated and got me up on my feet.

The bass, music and love revived me, and it has the power to do so for everyone out there;

This is my story; my message and this is why I need you to join me touch the world through my talent and music.

Being Unique is Never Easy......... 

Sometimes you have to stand alone, not following the crowd, if you must be unique.

I decided to be different and never giving up; even while faced with numerous challenges ranging from :

  • Lack of readily available - genuine support systems and backing for talented African females.
  • Fear of the unknown when I dumped my certificate as a graduate,to tread the path less travelled, with hopes of a fulfilling future.
  • Fear of the unknown, as i ventured into a future of majoring on an uncommon big thick- stringed instrument called the double bass ( which some people still call the big violin - like seriously??), yes and i have had to carry my 4/4 double bass on my back severally - you better believe it, see for yourself * 

  • Fear of the unknown as I took up the electric Bass Guitar (which is a far cry from a sustainable income career), while working on my singing and songwriting skills simultaneously.

What keeps me going has been :

Everyone who has been entertained and inspired by my brand, talent and music.

Also, The young girls which my brand has given hope to, inspiring them to be creative, beautiful and strong - while achieving great feats and pursuing their dreams, no matter the limitations and challenges.

And its on this foundation that my Annual Girl-Child/Children Support Project was built.

African Bass Charity Concert (ABC Concert)

Talking about my passion for the Girl-Child/Children Support, every year i mark my birthday (28th September) with a charity project for children who have nothing and no one.

But this year, with your help - we ll be reaching out to helpless and homeless children in Nigerian internally Displaced Persons (IDP)  camps , through donations and the African Bass Charity Concert (ABC). 

ABC Concert will hold after the campaign, and your contributions - as little and easy as ABC-  will make a difference in the lives of these children..

ITS JUST YOU AND ME!

This music is ours, It's just you and me, no record label drama.

Its time for Ireen Bill and you the Billoniers to create something magical together!

Welcome to the Billoniers Club (Ireen Bill Fans ONly)!!!!

 I ,my manager and my team, promised ourselves to deliver nothing short of unique and magical contents to you my special billoniers.

( YASS!!! IREEN BILL'S fans, lovers and supporters are called BILLONIERS)

So Here Is What We Are Gonna Do

I want us to cover the costs of writing, recording, mixing, and mastering the B.I.L.L EP album to global standards and that is so expensive for an individual to fund.

The Funds will be spent On:

  • Recording Costs For Studio Time, Gear, Engineers, Musicians, Backups, Production fees
  • Mixing & Mastering.
  • Making Your Billonier T-shirts and Other Perks.
  • Charity Bass Concert And Donations to Children In IDP Camps
  •  Initial CDs run for backers! 
  • Transportation/Moving My Instruments and Gears For recording.
  • Indiegogo Fees
  • Web-related fees
  • Packaging, design et al.

Funds raised above the goal (stretch goals) will be directed towards higher production level, marketing, shooting a video, and helping those kids on a larger scale.

So, the more backers i get, the better chances i get at Bridging the Gap; touching the world and those children in the IDP camps.

 

Hurray!!! I've Got Amazing Rewards And Perks For You........Yes You!!!!

Yesssss! I got lots of amazing exclusive and limited offers for you, when you contribute to this project.

I am excited about this rewards, because they contain my secret passions , hobbies and abilities.

Check Some Of Them Out!

*A Private Concert At Your Home By Me ' And The Mystery BassMan.

Imagine this : You/your family & friends, Me, My Bass(or double bass), My Percussionist, the Mystery BassMan And Some Sweet African Music - A Private Concert At Your Home Or A Venue Of your Choice! (Ill come in my beautiful African attire ,makeover, and lyrics book for y'all)!. 

Wow!! ,, Your Name Will Be Written On My First Ever Double Bass ( My Precious Possession)

In case You didn't Know , that double bass is one of my most precious possessions, loaded with lots of memories of failures, successes, challenges, and above all TRIUMPH!!

*Bass-Banging Billonier Tee-Shirt. 

Be among the few special Ones to Get the Exclusive Ireen Bill Billonier Tshirt!

*I'll Come Cook You An African Dish For Dinner..

I will come cook you an African dinner, teach you how to make it and turn your kitchen into a 7-star music restaurant with some acoustic bass and voice- Soul music! as we add each ingredient and spice to the cooking pot!!!!! You can get this and a lot more under my MEGA BILLONIER PERK.

*Signed Copy of B.I.L.L CD Album

Signed and Numbered Albums, we count from 1 upwards based on when you contributed, so pick a perk early to get the sweet numbers.

 

*I'll Paint You A Portrait, With An African Theme! And You Also Get African Artworks

Painting has always been my secret Passion I will Paint an African potrait of you/your loved one

*You Be The Director/Executive Producer Of The B.I.L.L ALBUM

I will also be giving out EXECUTIVE PRODUCER and CREATIVE DIRECTOR credits to a limited number of people, on the B.I.L.L Album.(Once in a lifetime opportunity y'all).

Yes!!! You can get your name written for a hundred years on the B.I.L.L Album when you grab the BILLONIER OF THE CENTURY PERK for $100!!

And so much more!!!

Diamond Bank

story_txt:
Hi,
I am Ireen Bill - a Female Bassist, Double Bassist, Singer, Songwriter and Girl-Child/Women Empowerment Advocate, from Nigeria, Africa.
My music borders on afropop with a rich mix of Afrobeats, Urban Highlife and Jazz. My fans and music lovers are called BILLONIERS*.

My brand stands to showcase the creativity, beauty and strength of the african woman and my music generally features strong African vocals , lyrics and percussions, laced with electric bass solos, bass lines and double bass grooves.
You Gotta Be Stronger Than A Horse!

TO BE A FEMALE IN AFRICA = CHALLENGING.
TO BE A FEMALE BASSIST, DOUBLE BASSIST AND SINGER = EXTRA-CHALLENGING.
As an African Female, most times you are expected to be normal ; doing all the normal things which the society expects of a woman.....
*sips tea*.
But that ain't gonna be me. I no go gree! ( pronounced i wont agree) *frowning face* Because i am ready for the challenge!

Here's a little part of my story......
Years Ago, I fell in love with Music and the Bass. The passion grew so strong and  it gave me a purpose in life; one that would help people get better in every way, through my music.
Suddenly In 2010, I was involved in a ghastly motor accident that left 2 dead.
I was bedridden for months, almost giving up, gained a lot of weight, depression, anxiety and fear set in!
But my love for the bass and music, and the love from those my bass-playing and music inspired, gave me a reason to keep pushing, kept me motivated and got me up on my feet.
The bass, music and love revived me, and it has the power to do so for everyone out there;
This is my story; my message and this is why I need you to join me touch the world through my talent and music.
Being Unique is Never Easy......... 

Sometimes you have to stand alone, not following the crowd, if you must be unique.
I decided to be different and never giving up; even while faced with numerous challenges ranging from :

Lack of readily available - genuine support systems and backing for talented African females.
Fear of the unknown when I dumped my certificate as a graduate,to tread the path less travelled, with hopes of a fulfilling future.
Fear of the unknown, as i ventured into a future of majoring on an uncommon big thick- stringed instrument called the double bass ( which some people still call the big violin - like seriously??), yes and i have had to carry my 4/4 double bass on my back severally - you better believe it, see for yourself * 


Fear of the unknown as I took up the electric Bass Guitar (which is a far cry from a sustainable income career), while working on my singing and songwriting skills simultaneously.

What keeps me going has been :
Everyone who has been entertained and inspired by my brand, talent and music.
Also, The young girls which my brand has given hope to, inspiring them to be creative, beautiful and strong - while achieving great feats and pursuing their dreams, no matter the limitations and challenges.

And its on this foundation that my Annual Girl-Child/Children Support Project was built.
African Bass Charity Concert (ABC Concert)
Talking about my passion for the Girl-Child/Children Support, every year i mark my birthday (28th September) with a charity project for children who have nothing and no one.
But this year, with your help - we ll be reaching out to helpless and homeless children in Nigerian internally Displaced Persons (IDP)  camps , through donations and the African Bass Charity Concert (ABC). 
ABC Concert will hold after the campaign, and your contributions - as little and easy as ABC-  will make a difference in the lives of these children..
ITS JUST YOU AND ME!

This music is ours, It's just you and me, no record label drama.
Its time for Ireen Bill and you the Billoniers to create something magical together!
Welcome to the Billoniers Club (Ireen Bill Fans ONly)!!!!
 I ,my manager and my team, promised ourselves to deliver nothing short of unique and magical contents to you my special billoniers.
( YASS!!! IREEN BILL'S fans, lovers and supporters are called BILLONIERS)

So Here Is What We Are Gonna Do
I want us to cover the costs of writing, recording, mixing, and mastering the B.I.L.L EP album to global standards and that is so expensive for an individual to fund.
The Funds will be spent On:

Recording Costs For Studio Time, Gear, Engineers, Musicians, Backups, Production fees

Mixing & Mastering.
Making Your Billonier T-shirts and Other Perks.
Charity Bass Concert And Donations to Children In IDP Camps
 Initial CDs run for backers! 
Transportation/Moving My Instruments and Gears For recording.
Indiegogo Fees
Web-related fees
Packaging, design et al.

Funds raised above the goal (stretch goals) will be directed towards higher production level, marketing, shooting a video, and helping those kids on a larger scale.
So, the more backers i get, the better chances i get at Bridging the Gap; touching the world and those children in the IDP camps.
 
Hurray!!! I've Got Amazing Rewards And Perks For You........Yes You!!!!
Yesssss! I got lots of amazing exclusive and limited offers for you, when you contribute to this project.
I am excited about this rewards, because they contain my secret passions , hobbies and abilities.
Check Some Of Them Out!
*A Private Concert At Your Home By Me ' And The Mystery BassMan.
Imagine this : You/your family & friends, Me, My Bass(or double bass), My Percussionist, the Mystery BassMan And Some Sweet African Music - A Private Concert At Your Home Or A Venue Of your Choice! (Ill come in my beautiful African attire ,makeover, and lyrics book for y'all)!. 
Wow!! ,, Your Name Will Be Written On My First Ever Double Bass ( My Precious Possession)
In case You didn't Know , that double bass is one of my most precious possessions, loaded with lots of memories of failures, successes, challenges, and above all TRIUMPH!!
*Bass-Banging Billonier Tee-Shirt. 
Be among the few special Ones to Get the Exclusive Ireen Bill Billonier Tshirt!
*I'll Come Cook You An African Dish For Dinner..
I will come cook you an African dinner, teach you how to make it and turn your kitchen into a 7-star music restaurant with some acoustic bass and voice- Soul music! as we add each ingredient and spice to the cooking pot!!!!! You can get this and a lot more under my MEGA BILLONIER PERK.
*Signed Copy of B.I.L.L CD Album
Signed and Numbered Albums, we count from 1 upwards based on when you contributed, so pick a perk early to get the sweet numbers.
 
*I'll Paint You A Portrait, With An African Theme! And You Also Get African Artworks
Painting has always been my secret Passion I will Paint an African potrait of you/your loved one
*You Be The Director/Executive Producer Of The B.I.L.L ALBUM

I will also be giving out EXECUTIVE PRODUCER and CREATIVE DIRECTOR credits to a limited number of people, on the B.I.L.L Album.(Once in a lifetime opportunity y'all).

Yes!!! You can get your name written for a hundred years on the B.I.L.L Album when you grab the BILLONIER OF THE CENTURY PERK for $100!!

story:
Let Go of Grievances.

  • Listen to the song here: https://soundcloud.com/revroyo/let-go-of-grieva...
  • Rev. Yolanda, is a singer/songwriter who has been performing around the USA all her life, with the last 25 years dedicated to writing new music, performing, and most recently with a music ministry that preaches forgiveness, love, and celebration,  whoever you are. She is a two-time MAC Award winner, is a member of the Blues Hall Of Fame as well as the GLBT hall of fame. When you experience Yolanda's shows you are in a world where you feel uplifted and never preached at.
  • The campaign to raise funds for a new video has been born out of a need to make something that people will watch, share, and help to spread that message. A professionally made video will help us do that and bring fun to people as well as a great message. 
  • We realize that making a video is not cheap but we have secured the services of an experienced team who will work hard to make this video the best it can be, they are not charging a fortune, but we want to make sure that we pay everyone for their time. Your help will be invaluable to us, in making something that will live forever as a way to share Yolanda's message of forgiveness and Joy.  

What We Need & What You Get.

  • To make the video we are hiring an experienced Director, and production team, to make sure we keep to our tight one day shoot, the director will spend time researching, working with the crew and production team to make sure we capture this amazing story in one long shoot day. 
  • For contributing in any way to our campaign we will be creating a special website/webpage that only our treasured funders will be able to access, where you can see the final video first, as well as lots of extras that we will be adding in over the next month.  
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will press ahead to make the video and work hard to make it a reality.

Impact.

  • As a contributor, the impact of how you will help not just us but the people that see the video is incalculable. We hope 1000's of people will see the video and be changed. You will be part of that change. 
  • If you have ever seen Rev. Yolanda perform, you will understand that all that shines from her is love and light. Her ministry is intended to uplift and build bridges of love between people of differing belief systems. "All life is One and everything in life is holy", is Rev. Yolanda's mission statement. 

 

    The Production Team.  

    Audrey Elizabeth Thomas

    Producer & Director 

       

      Love, life and the intimate forms that make up each person’s individual story; this is the fuel that ignites Audrey's passion. she is a storyteller who enjoys the unconventional and strives to give viewers a new perspective. she has been recognized for her work by film festivals in Los Angeles, Seattle, New York, Chicago, Florida and internationally in Ireland & Wales. Audrey creates films for individuals, couples, companies, and musicians. she is constantly working towards learning and teaching new ways to express oneself through 21st Century media. most recently she worked for SIFF (Seattle international film festival) as a part of the marketing & pr team for their 2015 festival.

      Audrey is a filmmaker from Seattle, WA who attends New York university's film and television program at Tisch school of the arts in NYC.

      Connor Grant Lyons

      Choreographer 

      Connor shares the same home as Rev. Yolanda coming from Florence, Alabama. He met Yolanda in NYC where she has been a spiritual mentor for him. Connor started dancing and choreographing in high school and continued to do so studying theater at Pepperdine and Musical Theater and Film at The New York Film Academy. He has also choreographed for the Brooklyn based sketch comedy group "The Shorts Show/Brooklyn's Worst" and work studies at both Alvin Ailey Extension and Peridance Capezio Center. Connor is now a working dancer, actor, singer and yoga instructor in the city and is thrilled to be working on the Let Go Of Grievances video. 

       

      Julia Kupiec

      Director of Photography

      Julia Kupiec is an NYC based cinematographer currently studying undergraduate film and television production at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts. Originally from Santa Barbara, California, Julia focuses on commercial and narrative productions. She has shot a wide spectrum of projects, from high end fashion campaigns to documentaries, and everything in-between. Julia is a working member on the photo and video production team for Fusion Film Festival. Recently, her work as a director and cinematographer was awarded in the Santa Barbara International Film Festival. Julia hopes to continue her career as a collaborative film maker, creating content with individuals, musicians, companies and organizations.

      The Challenge. 

      • To make sure that a professional product is made and delivered we have teamed up with Audrey Elizabeth Thomas, a successful film maker who has worked on many projects, that are amazing. her talent at managing tight budgets with top talent will make sure we stay on budget and deliver a beautiful video.

      If you are unable to contribute!

      • Often the biggest hurdle to any campaign is getting the message out, so if you are able to share this campaign with friends you are helping us in a huge way. 
      • Use the Indiegogo share buttons, and tell as many of your friends as possible, the more people we reach and the more people that contribute even a few dollars, then we can reach our goal and make a beautiful video.

To make sure that a professional product is made and delivered we have teamed up with Audrey Elizabeth Thomas, a successful film maker who has worked on many projects, that are amazing. her talent at managing tight budgets with top talent will make sure we stay on budget and deliver a beautiful video.

Often the biggest hurdle to any campaign is getting the message out, so if you are able to share this campaign with friends you are helping us in a huge way. 
Use the Indiegogo share buttons, and tell as many of your friends as possible, the more people we reach and the more people that contribute even a few dollars, then we can reach our goal and make a beautiful video.

story:
The Short of It... 

 

  • I am Jennifer. A 40 year old mom that dyes for a living and loves to sing.
  • I am seizing this chance to do what I have dreamed of, for as long as I can remember; recording an album.
  • With your help, this dream can become a reality that I can share with everyone who'll listen.

 

My project requires at least $1000. That budget will cover the initial cost of recording and producing a full length, gospel/blues album.

My sound/voice is not typical, and finds it's comfort in the blues realm.

Whatever funds I gather will go toward this project. If my goal is not met, I wont give up on this dream. I will use them to further this project, no matter what.

While I may not have the greatest voice in the world, my music comes from my heart. My desire to give back what was given to me is overwhelming. God is in this.  

Please Share!

Help me reach my goal and my lifelong dream!! I promise to do my best!!

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for taking the time to visit our Indiegogo page.

We are a small but very passionate street legal Drag Racing team from Wolverhampton, England, that has successfully competed around the world before. If you can find the time to watch our video you'll see how our hard work and determination made Red Victor 3 the Worlds Fastest Street legal Car.  This success ignited American interest, and the title finally went stateside in 2014. We want to throw everything at regaining this title, and offer a real feel good project that the British people can get behind!

What We Need & What You Get

To have a serious shot at reclaiming the title as the Worlds Fastest Street Car we need to raise £50,000.

After losing the record to Larry Larsen, We were able to raise funds through our Facebook page and the creation of the Red Victor 5 Second Members Club, to fund our first package of upgrades to Red Victor. That work has been completed, and we made our first shake-down passes in May this year.  This new setup was a giant step forward for us and we ran the 1/4 mile in 6.37 seconds @ 234mph setting new personal bests for the car. This equates to 0-60mph in 1 second, and 0-234mph in 6.3 seconds!

Now we want to unleash the full potential of Red Victor in Bahrain, and not only reclaim the record but to smash it!

The dull reality is that the task of going fast costs a lot of money.  The money we are looking to raise will let us:

  • Ship the car to Bahrain,
  • Relocate the team for 5 meetings,
  • Get a significant spares package,
  • Fund fuel, tyres, oil and spark plugs for the hungry engine
  • and to have a little in reserve in case we need to run any repairs!

Your money is hard earned: We know and respect that.  We promise it will be spent wisely, and for perks such as the Full Membership you'll even see first hand what your money has sponsored.  

Our perks are unique, in some cases complete one-offs, and above all else they are fun!  

The Impact

You may have noticed we carried out our shakedown test in the UK, but now wish to race in Bahrain.  Whilst the test was a definite success for us, it also highlighted how the British race calendar, the track we have to race on, and the weather reduces our window of opportunity.

To make the best use of our track time, we need to run at a location that offers us the greatest chance of success, and without the risks of the British weather.  Which is why we want to take Red Victor to the Kingdom of Bahrain.

Bahrain offers a predictable climate, has a phenomenal track which is prepared to the highest standards, and in the winter months is home to a wealth of drag racing expertise that is already geared up to support us.  When you factor in that our Head Tuner, Shane Tecklenburg, already has experience with other teams out there, you can see how it is the logical next step for us!

Bahrain also has a convenient race calendar which gives us five race meetings over five months. This therefore also dictates the deadline of the campaign as the first race date is in November, with the car needing to be shipped in October!

It certainly won’t be an easy or straightforward challenge, and we expect that unleashing over 4000bhp is going to result is some troubles and breakages.  We’re planning solutions for every scenario, right down to fast track routes for freighting parts from the USA.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate it's not always possible to contribute, that is fine! Even if you don't then we hope you will follow our journey to recapture the street legal 1/4 mile record from the USA.  

You could help us by telling all your friends and family and share like crazy across your social media pages, getting our story and our goals out to other like minded people.....

Thank you for taking time out of your day to look at our project!

story:
As a response to the ongoing global shift to the political right,  we've re-launched Folk Against Fascism. We want to celebrate our beautifully diverse society, and state firmly that British folk music and culture belongs to all who live here, regardless of where they come from. We acknowledge that the UK's strength lies in its pluralism, and we want to stand with our neighbours and friends of all cultures and orientations, even as the political climate makes them feel unwelcome and unsafe. We also look forward to using traditional music as a way of exploring relationships and building bridges between the many communities resident in the UK. 

FAF is a campaign about visibility. We're producing lovely things for you to use and wear to show your support for a folk community that is open and welcoming, and which rejects insularity and division. You can also create your own FAF events that are relevant to the issues in your own community. Use FAF as an opportunity to reach out, be positive, and celebrate the diversity that makes us stronger. PLEASE NOTE: the images in our gallery are purely for illustrative purposes at this time. Supporters will be contacted on the close of the campaign and offered a range of t-shirt colour combinations and designs.

The money we raise through crowdfunding will be used to produce more merch, leaflets, buy advertising space, and produce events. It will also be used to cover the minimal administrative costs involved in running the campaign.
story_txt:
As a response to the ongoing global shift to the political right,  we've re-launched Folk Against Fascism. We want to celebrate our beautifully diverse society, and state firmly that British folk music and culture belongs to all who live here, regardless of where they come from. We acknowledge that the UK's strength lies in its pluralism, and we want to stand with our neighbours and friends of all cultures and orientations, even as the political climate makes them feel unwelcome and unsafe. We also look forward to using traditional music as a way of exploring relationships and building bridges between the many communities resident in the UK. 
FAF is a campaign about visibility. We're producing lovely things for you to use and wear to show your support for a folk community that is open and welcoming, and which rejects insularity and division. You can also create your own FAF events that are relevant to the issues in your own community. Use FAF as an opportunity to reach out, be positive, and celebrate the diversity that makes us stronger. PLEASE NOTE: the images in our gallery are purely for illustrative purposes at this time. Supporters will be contacted on the close of the campaign and offered a range of t-shirt colour combinations and designs.
The money we raise through crowdfunding will be used to produce more merch, leaflets, buy advertising space, and produce events. It will also be used to cover the minimal administrative costs involved in running the campaign.

story:
MASSIMO KYO DI NOCERA BIOGRAPHY

When I was a child I was feeling the Music as something higher and softer that, at the same time, could be part of my daily life and it could be with me in the ordinary activities, something accessible in every moment. I started my path of listening, studying and experimenting, passing through the channels that were available for me in that moment – in a friend’s garage, a guitar teacher from the parish church, and local concerts. During this growth I realized that the "Musical World" was polluted from a twisted thought of the society that influences a big part of the music business. I come away from it and I spent a period of loneliness venturing to the meditation, not knowing that the meditation itself would bring me back the Music and the Life. Now, I simply do the same things as ever, but with a different quality. I cannot find any better words than saying that my vision has been cleaned up: the mirror is the same, but the dust and the smudges that were darkening the image are gone away. I use the Music to dance and reconnect to myself and to the earth. I let myself go in the listening and I flow in the vast spaces that the Music brings to me. I spend many moments even listening to the Nature, which gives me the Infinity. And when I play and sing, my notes are like rays pursuing that Infinity.

website: http://coda-della-luna.blogspot.it/

story:
Natty Staggs Music Launch!

Hello I am Natty Staggs.  I am a multi-faceted, multi-dimensional, multi-media artist! Song, dance, costume, environment, and expression are all intertwined and interwoven in me. I have spent most of my adult life engaged in collaborative artistic endeavors.

 

From fashion, fiber arts, crafts and costumes, to theater, dance and music, I've gathered up many tools in my toolkit, and I look forward to an opportunity to apply my skills to a project that has, until now, been only a dream....

+ Debut Studio EP- HOT LITTLE HANDS +

&

+A Spectacularly Artful Music Video for the Song "SHINE"+

 

The MUSIC

After several years performing  and numerous requests for recordings of my songs, I am ready to go into the studio to make it so!

I've teamed up with a talented and dedicated producer/engineer, Chris Bigley "aka Biggs"(Stray Pines Studios) to weave my writings into beautiful instrumental compositions that will honor their essence and simplicity.

Biggs and I have already begun our work together, and have released a single,

"Astonishing" that you can listen to here.

We plan to get back into the studio as soon as we can.  With adequate funding, we can hire talented professional studio musicians, and  spend the time it takes to craft an excellent record. 

We aim for a  release in the Spring of 2017. 

 

THE VIDEO

The vision for the video is to create and film

a beautifully crafted artistic realm to accompany the song, "Shine". 

The video work with videographer Ryan Ao will add a rich new visual dimension to the songs, which, I believe, has always been their destiny.

Imagine a  stunning theatrical set with a painted proscenium arch and richly dyed and draped silk. 

Dozens of illuminated twig lanterns hang suspended, each little light a star in the darkening sky. We are outdoors, set in a stunning twilight forest, red rock desert, or against an expansive clear horizon at sunset. Let me show you what I mean when I sing, "You got the shine".....

I am in the frame with my band, playing, as it changes locations, from forest, to desert, perhaps to a special spot here in the city. Things appear and disappear, they brighten and fade, each dynamic of the tune with its own visual accompaniment. 

An ensemble of masked characters in flowing costumes, moving in perfect unison, like a flock of birds or a school of fish, move in close to show us the power of their collective life force through their eyes, hands and feet, through their dance. We watch in wonder as the scene continues to unfold.....

Let us continue this scene together!

A CREATIVE WORKSHOP SERIES with Natty

 

I delight in my ability to bring people together for creative endeavors! To make all the elements of this video vision, I will engage those who want to learn techniques like fabric dyeing, scene painting, lantern making, and mask making. 

I will use the numerous artistic management skills I have gathered in the last decade and put it all together into a series of community workshops, where I teach the techniques of building scenery and costumes to anyone who wants to learn! Just like in an academic setting, I will utilize the energy of the group to build the scenic and costume components for the video.  

Participants will enjoy the experience of creating something big and beautiful with a pro artist, all the while learning the skills to do more!

 I believe that the process of  involving lots of people in the creation of this video will imbue it with a vibrant, luminous energy, which will in turn inspire those who watch it to go out, connect, and do the things they love to do. This is ultimately what I have received from other inspiring creators, and I simply want to pass it along!

 

The Perks

I've had a blast thinking up creative ways to reward your contribution. It will be even more of a pleasure to deliver these rewards!

As a thank you for your generous donations you can receive:

-A digital download of the EP-  "HOT LITTLE HANDS"

-A CD with limited edition, one-of-a kind artwork from Natty

-A  beautiful handmade paper lantern, built in our workshop and featured in the video, each lantern a visual representation of an individual supporter

-A custom surprise singing telegram, delivered by Natty in person, to any doorstep in Portland or Seattle (other locales are also possible)

-Guaranteed Spots in the Creative Workshop Series- Fiber Art, Scenic Painting, Mask Making, Lantern Making, and More!

-A private show in your home or at your special event

-An ALL-OUT art party, complete with decor, design, performance, and photography

-Creative and collaborative input on the EP and video

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a breakdown of the estimated costs of this project:

 

For the EP, 5-6 songs :$4,900

  • Producing, Engineering, Mixing, Mastering $3500
  • Printing CDs $400
  • Making Merchandise+Rewards $500
  • Delivering Rewards $500

Video and Workshop Costs: $4,300

  • Videography on Location, Equipment Rentals, and Audio Recording $2500
  • Materials Cost for the Video Scenery, Props, Costumes $800
  • Location and Workshop Rentals $600
  • Workshop Expenses for Volunteers and Team $400

Processing Fees: 10% of amount raised

  • Indiegogo charges 5%
  • 3-5% credit card processing fees

The Impact

I know I am alive to generate these creations and expressions, and your support means I can do it with ease and a larger impact than I could accomplish on my own. It means I can continue to share what is so graciously given to me. I consider this my greatest responsibility in life.

2016 has brought a space of retreat and deep reflection on how to serve with my gifts of creativity. I am inspired by so many others around me doing the same, making big decisions to step up and engage more fully with life.I have been writing, planning, and dreaming, and I am ready to share many loving messages through song and visual art, made by many hands in service to love, beauty, and community.

Through all the challenges of our times, I continue my work with a renewed enthusiasm for what is possible, always reaching a little beyond my level of comfort, because this is where growth occurs. It is far from easy, but absolutely worthwhile.

You can contribute to this campaign knowing that you have given a truly dedicated and hardworking artist the resources, time and space to create in a big way. 

If you are inspired by this project but unable to contribute financially, I encourage you share this campaign with your own social networks. This is tremendously valuable too! If you are eager to get involved, I would love to hear from you and I'll bet we can find a way to include you in the success of completing this project. Every single contribution is appreciated.

Thank You for your generous support!

With Love,

Natty Staggs

story:
Family of God Story

    There was a long period of time where I settled… I thought that I was never going to write and produce another album again. And I came to terms with that because I honestly wasn’t sure if I wanted to pour my heart out like that again. It’s much more comfortable writing songs and having other people sing them. But, I continued to write because it’s always been my passion and my offering to God. And as I kept writing I really felt the Lord’s leading and guidance to record again. Out of that, this collection of songs that I’m calling “Family of God” was born. 
    The majority of these songs were written from conversations I’ve had with people in my church and the many different circumstances that they are in. I believe this is one of the main reasons I have felt lead by the Lord to release these songs. Even starting with the title track, it was written as I was thinking about a couple in my church who is currently going through the adoption process. That got me thinking about how amazing it is that we have been invited into God’s family. There’s a song titled “Satisfied In You” that was written with a couple men in my life group, and as we talked about what was going on in our church, we realized the magnitude in which we all try and satisfy our hearts and souls and the need for love with insubstantial things. Yet, all we need to be satisfied is the love from our God.
    Another set of songs were written about my own family. I’m a year into my marriage and songs were born out of that transition and joy. Songs about how to rely on God in my marriage. Trusting that He’s in control and that He’s sovereign.
    With any family, we have victories and struggles. And we are forced to deal with these realities that I believe God has allowed us to go through. With the Family of God, I have wrestled heavily with questions filled with doubt and unworthiness. Appropriate questions about love and faith. Some with answers. And sometimes the only answer I can give is to surrender and sing, “God I trust You.” I sing about these thoughts throughout this album.
    It’s been quite the journey in my head and in my heart to finally realize that God is really guiding this process to release these songs. I have full confidence that He will provide all that I will need to release this album. My hope is that you would partner with me in what our God is doing. I ask that you would ceaselessly pray for me and this album. Pray that my heart would be protected from earthly desires. I would love to write worship music for other artists as a full time job, but my aim here is to just to simply follow the Lord’s leading. Please pray for me and my wife as this will take away some of our time together. I can’t neglect my responsibilities and I need to be provide for my family. Though writing songs is my passion, my wife comes before music. I know that the amount of money I am trying to raise may seem a little daunting, but I with full faith believe that money is no obstacle for our God, nor anything else for that matter. Below I will provide the information on where each dollar is needed. Please ask any questions. I try to be a man of full transparency.
    Would you please pray and consider what you could give to this project.
    Thank you for taking the time to hear what the Lord is doing in my life. I’m excited. Thanks!

So, 13K? Where's it all going?

I am basing this estimate off of 13 tracks. Some are hard costs, and others are estimates and ranges. A percentage of what gets raised will be paid to indiegogo.
Recording & Mixing ($600 per song) = $7,800
Musicians = 2,900 (This is at it's minimum. I would love to pay the musicians I have lined up closer to what they are actually worth.)
Online Distribution = $30
Physical CDs (500cds) = $1,200
Mastering = $600
Advertisement = ???

Total: $12,530

Again, if you have questions or would like to talk about anything relating to the project please email me at info@isaiahbarker.com

story:
Indiegogo Is Where Low Country Hill Started

A remarkable thing happened to me three years ago.  With inexplicable courage, I decided to test my budding passion for songwriting by making a record.  I had some inkling that I would be in for a wild ride but could never have predicted both the rigour and joy that came with working with a producer, seasoned musicians and later performing in front of audiences.

In order to go "above ground," I launched an Indiegogo campaign to fund my project. And to my jaw-dropping astonishment, 135 generous souls showed their belief in my artistic goal by contributing $8660 to the campaign!  That groundswell of support brought tonnes of energy to my first solo recording experience.  And without overstating the case, I'd say that making the record was one of the most creatively inspiring and joyful experiences of my life.

 

What Supporters Helped Accomplish

Thanks to the backing of my community of support, I was able make a record of artistic consequence with talented producer and musician, Dave King.  One music blogger called the record "a provocative experimentation in sound and shape, featuring sonic sculptures with a sense of experimentation but grounded with heart and soul, and evoking the subdued comforts of a warm abode amidst a cold, punishing but beautiful landscape" (Kent Heberling, Those Who Dig).  It was a  privilege to co-create with musical family and friends on the project.  I was also overjoyed to work with Pat Sansone from Wilco and Bill Dillon (Joni Mitchell, Peter Gabriel) who brought incredible artistry to their performances.   Both musicians are musical icons to me so I count myself blessed to have made music with them.  Lucky me!

The record received critical praise and was nominated for a 2015 Hamilton Music Award in the Roots/Solo category.  Low Country Hill was also a Hamilton regional finalist in CBC Searchlight 2015.  The favourable reception of the record also enabled me to perform over 50 concerts throughout Ontario and beyond.  I welcomed the challenge of translating the nuanced, expansive full-band sound on record into intimate, solo performances.  An added perk to performing was meeting so many music-loving, open-minded people, especially off the beaten path.  Some bookings even took me down logging roads and through May snow storms.  

 

What's Next?

I'm sure it's no secret to you that mixing art and commerce successfully is a long shot.  No doubt I've felt the bump and grind of that dance in the last few years of promoting my debut record.  Yet, I feel that Low Country Hill has some unfinished artistic business and making another record is key to following that curiosity.  

It will cost about $12,000 to make this new recording.  That's a lot of money.  But it quickly gets put to good use for studio, producer and musician fees, mixing and mastering costs as well as marketing and promotion.  I am asking you to help raise $8000 of that amount with your EP pre-order contribution (see "Perks" for pre-order contribution amounts).  Fingers crossed that I'll have some success with an application for an artist development grant; the same goes for landing a few bookings in the new year.  Both of these revenue streams will also be of help in funding the project.

If we do not achieve the goal of raising $8000, I want to assure you that I will stretch your contributions to make a compelling record that still reaches for ambitious, artistic goals.  I want to make you proud to be part of this adventure.

If you have already supported me in the first Indiegogo campaign, I am very grateful to you for helping me get to this point of my artistic development. I am mindful that it's a big ask to request your support once more. So, if you do consider backing me a second time, I can only say thank you again and again for believing in my work.  If you came to enjoy Low Country Hill through live performances or listening to the record, I hope you will consider backing my campaign for the first time.

Thanks for giving this your energy and thought.  I look forward to sharing the music with you in the new year and sincerely hope it resonates with you. 

 

With appreciation,

Paul

It will cost about $12,000 to make this new recording.  That's a lot of money.  But it quickly gets put to good use for studio, producer and musician fees, mixing and mastering costs as well as marketing and promotion.  I am asking you to help raise $8000 of that amount with your EP pre-order contribution (see "Perks" for pre-order contribution amounts).  Fingers crossed that I'll have some success with an application for an artist development grant; the same goes for landing a few bookings in the new year.  Both of these revenue streams will also be of help in funding the project.
If we do not achieve the goal of raising $8000, I want to assure you that I will stretch your contributions to make a compelling record that still reaches for ambitious, artistic goals.  I want to make you proud to be part of this adventure.
If you have already supported me in the first Indiegogo campaign, I am very grateful to you for helping me get to this point of my artistic development. I am mindful that it's a big ask to request your support once more. So, if you do consider backing me a second time, I can only say thank you again and again for believing in my work.  If you came to enjoy Low Country Hill through live performances or listening to the record, I hope you will consider backing my campaign for the first time.
Thanks for giving this your energy and thought.  I look forward to sharing the music with you in the new year and sincerely hope it resonates with you. 
 
With appreciation,
Paul

story:
Short Summary

Hello, 

My name is John Curry. I am a musician from Houston, TX.  My musical story starts when I was first around 4 years old learning the piano and singing as much as I possibly could. That eventually evolved and I began to play the guitar. I never gave much thought that music would take me anywhere but boy was I wrong. I signed my first record deal with a rock band from Houston called goneblind. We thought we had hit the big time but we were in for a rude awakening. After a bad deal, in which the label dropped us without even releasing our record, we were left to find ourselves struggling once again. We, as a band, were later picked up by Scott Stapp (Creed) to play the roles of writing, recording, and touring artists. Once again things fell apart and I began to resent music so much that I quit playing for years. After my life almost completely falling apart, I realized I was doing all of it for the wrong reasons! I started searching myself and really paying attention to what was going on around me. I decided to try to make a change. Make a change through music. I want to speak to people who feel like all hope is lost and relay the message that "We can all truly change and make a difference" and that we are all "Still the Same".

What We Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise $5000.00 try continue with the "Still the Same" project. I have already spent around $6000 and have run out of funds to continue to promote my message and record and release more songs and videos. 

Through the money that has already been spent the song has been added to more than 70 radio stations across the country and the video has been seen all across the world. I have also recieved 11 different licensing deals with MTV, Discovery Channel, TLC, OWN, A&E, and NASCAR.

The $5000.00 will be spent as follows:

$1,300 left for radio promotions team Tinderbox Music

$800 for the company that obtained the licensing agreements

$1500 for recording, mixing, and mastering of the new song "Stand With Me"

$1000 for shooting the new video for "Stand With Me"

$400 for duplication of CD's

The perks are as follows:

$25 Donation - Signed copy of the two song CD

$50 Donation - Signed copy of the two song CD and two song DVD

$100 Donation - Signed copy of the two song CD, signed copy of the two song DVD, signed limited edition "Still the Same" T-shirt, and a meet and greet at a show of your choice

$500+ Donation - All of the perks above as well as a three hour private party acoustic concert at your home. (This does not include travel costs if the travel is more than 150 miles)

The Impact

Houston Musician’s Song on Race…A View from the

Most Diverse American City

Houston, TX, : Local singer/songwriter John Vincent Curry, living in the most diverse city in the country, has released a new song and music video called "Still the Same" to inspire positive change in behavior and discussions on race. Tensions are high across the country with racial disparities in the criminal justice system. Shooting deaths of law enforcement spiked 78% in the first half of 2016 vs year ago with the killing of eight officers in Dallas and BatonRouge. In addition, the current presidential campaign has unleashed anger about race andimmigration. Americans are saying things about one another and to one another that have previouslybeen considered out of bounds.“We should be setting an example for the rest of the world and instead we are so far away from what America should stand for. We are all human and no matter our race or culture, the core of a person isthe same,” said John Curry.John Curry grew up in Lafayette, LA and while in high school he remembers the rhetoric and racialtension when David Duke, a former leader of the Knights of the Ku Klux Klan, was running for governor. While Duke largely avoided explicit racial campaigning, he appealed to the frustrations and resentments of white voters. To Curry, the discourse during the campaign seemed regressive and out of touch. “It’s not the color of a man that defines him… it’s the actions in which he leads his life,” states John Curry. Since 1997, John Curry has made his home in Houston. Curry is currently the lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist for the Houston band, Hounds of Jezebel. From 1999 – 2007, he was a member of the band goneblind, when they landed a recording deal with RoadRunner Records and toured nationally. The band garnered the attention of national recording artist, Scott Stapp, the lead vocalist of Creed, and was recruited to record and tour with Stapp. Still the Same song and video was produced by former goneblind/ Scott Stapp bassist, Mitch Burman who has operated music venues for 20 years in Houston and is an owner of Heights Guitar Tech. As a Caucasian man residing in Houston, Curry has been a part of the big diversity shifts. As of 2010, Houston metropolitan area is the most racially/ethnically diverse large in the nation, narrowly surpassing the New York metropolitan area, according to the Kinder Institute for Urban Research. The Anglo population represents a declining share of the Houston metropolitan area. In 1990, Anglos were more than half the population (57.9 percent), but by 2000 they decreased to slightly less than half the total population (48.2 percent), and by 2010 they were only 39.7 percent of the metropolitan population. At current rates of population change, Latinos are poised to become the Houston region’s largest racial/ethnic group. Among the five most populous metropolitan areas in Texas, Houston stands out for having no racial/ethnic majority and nearly equal percentages of the two largest race/ethnic groups (Latinos and Anglos). Curry is married and lives with his wife Samantha and their teenage son. They decided early on to raise their son in the city so that he could experience Houston’s tremendous racial diversity and the many cultures that knit the city together. The beat of the city suits John Curry. Houston’s feeling was squarely captured in the non-partisan mayoral election when African American candidate, Sylvester Turner, used the slogan “We’re All in this Together” and was elected in 2015. Still The Same, a message rooted in Houston, hopes to bring the country together.

Still the Same was recorded at Digital Warehaus Productions with engineer, Stephen Finley. It was mixed by multi-platinum producer, songwriter, John Kurzweg, best known for his work with Grammy artist band, Creed. The video was shot and edited by Amir Valinia, Director / Producer and President of AV1 Productions, and Jerry Lynch provided stage production, lighting and sound.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that not everyone has the ability to contribute monetarily but there are many ways that you can help. Be proactive in your community. Volunteer your time, whether it be at a physical place or bring sack lunches to the homeless. Educate yourself on what's going on not only in your community but around the world. Be nice and courteous to people. Smile!

story:
Help Fund Cities

Cities is trying to get funding to finish the recording process on the EP "Made Up Home". CD's, shirts, and other merch. As well as finishing the final productions for the first music video "I Don't Belong Here".

What Cities Needs

Breakdown with more details:

  • Finish the recording process on the EP "Made Up Home".
  • CD's, shirts, and other merch.
  • Finishing the final productions for the first music video "I Don't Belong Here".

What You Get:

Breakdown with more details:

$5 = EP Pre-Release (digital download only)

$10 = EP with Handwritten Lyrics.

$15 = EP with a Skype Call from Cities.

$20 = EP, Skype Call and a limited edition 11X17 poster.

$25 = EP, Skype call and limited edition Shirt

THE WORKS: $50

  • Pre-Release download of the EP
  • A Physical copy of the EP
  • Handwritten Lyrics
  • Skype Call
  • Limited edition Poster
  • Limited edition Shirt

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you are not able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about Cities campaign.

story:
Who are we?

We are two people who love the Lord, have a passion for music, travel, and reaching as many people we can.  We have each been writing constantly for the past 2 years and when we met we realized that together we complement each others voices and style of playability. Our heart is to share what The Lord has done in each of our lives sharing hope, purpose and destiny.

We have decided to be called The Undefined. The reason for this you may ask is that we are not defined by this world we are defined by the Lord and only the Lord! not labels of Christianity, Messianic Judaism , or anything else, only that we would be known as lovers of the Lord God Yeshua Jesus!

Show Me The Money! 

Where is the money your donating going here is a dollar amount for everything we will need to finish this project.

$1,500 is going to recording the album and mixing.

$500 is going to mastering the album .

$1,000 is going to a music video with Nick Falangas

 https://vimeo.com/tag:falangas+productions.

$1,000 is going to printing the album ,marketing and merchandise.

Risks & Challenges

This process has been long from recording with another name and losing tracks to loosing funding but we have got back up and still are trekking forward to achieve the goal at hand and finish this album and release it to the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is not the only help we ask for, we understand in the time we are living in money is not abundant. So for those of you who are unable to support financially but would like to help you can do so by posting this campaign on your Facebook, twitter, Snap chat , Instagram. or anything you have or want to post it on.

Thank You So Much 

Last but not least we wanna say thank you so much for helping and supporting whether with a post or money, thank you for helping our dream come true!!

~Mark and Kaily

story:
To Put Things Simply

So the purpose of this is to:

  • Get some Podcasting Equipment or Studio Time.
  • Educate Bearded Folks on how to better care for their skin and beard.
  • Reverse some negative stigma that some bearded people receive on a daily basis.
  • Make Beards Even More Awesome!

So help us keep your beard and everyone else's in the best condition and have something different to listen to at the same time!


My current small business Beard Lab is all about Beard Care and getting the best Beard Care out there so once I get this running I can fund the rest eventually. I am not all about getting profit, to be honest I just want to help other bearded folks.


I for one am sick and tired of some of the negativity bearded folks receive. I mean some of my extended family still do the whole why don't you have a shave thing and its just rubbish to hear that and I want to change minds and stop the beard hate.

What We Need & What You Get

There are a variety of things we may need to purchase such as:

  • A decent dynamic microphone or two possibly.
  • A portable mixing desk with XLR inputs and USB outputs.
  • Advertising to ensure the right people actually get to listen to the Podcast.
  • Maybe we could get studio time instead of equipment but that will depend on the funds we receive.


You in return will firstly get a nice new Podcast to listen to and a variety of awesome (mostly beard related) perks.

The Outcome

The potential outcome of your help could be that:

  • Beards become a thing that isn't shamed (which I experience).
  • Beards start looking even more awesome.
  • People get a new podcast to listen to.

Risks & Challenges

So things that could potentially be risks are:

  • Lack of equipment.
  • No studio time available.
  • No quiet space due to children...

To overcome these problems I will ensure I find that best equipment I can buy through any friends in the local music tech industry. In regard to the kids I just have to be extra nice to my lovely GF (ahem).

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Follow my company Social Media profile and share some posts.
  • Tell any bearded buddies.

And that's all there is to it.


I can't wait to get started.

This is going to be hard work to set up but very fun I'm sure.


Thanks a lot for reading!

story:
Hi, I am Brittany Bordella. A multi- instrumentalist/producer/writer/vocalist and philosophical individual.

Im ready to take the next step in my music career and release a full length album!
The only hold up is lack of funds for the gear and space to complete the project.
I have been a hard working musician since I was a youngin' and I need a boost from supporters to get  to the next level of success.  
Be apart of the evolution of music!

With a combination of dark orchestral electronics, industrial metal, heavy and shredding guitar leads, catchy riffs and sultry vocals the world of music can evolve with a musician like myself funded properly.

I want to change the world! I have a lot to say and want to be heard through my unique music and style of writing.

I also plan to take the stage with a live band full of theatrics upon releasing the new album. With the help of crowd funding of course.

You can check out my most recent work all over social media.

The new sound is going to be a much bigger, fuller, heavier sound with much more inspiring lyrics and anthems!

Music is my gift to the world and I need it to be heard.

Help my talent not go to waste!

The proceeds will be going toward much needed equipment. Over the years much of my gear was sold due to hard times to pay bills and survival.  Barely getting by working part time in music retail doesn't leave any room to fund a music career.

We're talking production software, studio time, computer upgrades, live gear and campaign ads.  Pricey stuff!

With all of this the project can be brought to life within no time and would change the life of a musician that has not and will not ever give up on her dreams!

Thanks for all the support!

Always feel free to get in touch!

Xoxo

-|3rittany |3ordella

story:
Short Summary

My name is Keith Morrison.  I've run a professional recording studio "Wee Studio" in Stornoway on the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland for 9 years.

This campaign is to film 60 traditional Scottish and Irish tunes at a slow pace so instrumentalists can slowly play along to learn the tune.

Not only will this be a LOT of fun to learn.  You will get a blast out of performing the same tunes with others.  It also enhances the local music scene and culture.  Which in turn will be fantastic for tourism, well being and the community

What We Need & What You Get

We need £1080 funding in total.  This covers:

-Studio Recording Time (Audio and Video)

-Post Production (Audio and Video)

-Performer/Tutor Fees

-Organisation and Delivery fees.

All of those videos will be uploaded onto YouTube to be easily streamed.  Also if you pledge £10 you get to download the video files to save and if you pledge £20 you get the video files and the sheet music to play along to.

If only a portion of the needed funds are raised we will be able to film a smaller number of tunes.

story:
The moment has come.

After an absence of 10 years from writing and recording, I am ready to create something new. The fire, buried and forgotten inside me for so long, is ready to burst from its decade-long prison.

Everything I see, I hear, I touch is a new inspiration; every minute it transforms tunes, accords and energies like puzzle pieces into a new song which is just about to come to life. Exciting, isn’t it?

With your help it can be the real thing. I am embarking on a project to re-build my own professional musical environment, my world of creativity, where I can complete and record my songs – all this can be a reality with your kind contribution.

 

The goal is not fame and it's not about the ego either. It’s all about Music. Period.

I can already hear the songs inspired by my life experience of the past decade and I am seeking your support to enable them to be heard by others… and most importantly by You. We all have different challenges, but who knows? Maybe you will identify yourself with one or two of my new songs.


It’s challenging to take yourself to the next level without help. So If you love music as much as I do, I hope you can make a donation.  Thank you for your support.

 

Some notes about the perks.

  • A digital copy of the songs recorded will be given to all supporters irrelevant of the level of the contribution - be a tiny shiny coin or a banknote with a couple of zeros on it. Although the initial goal is set at 6k, the more you can donate the more the project can evolve; more funds would only allow me to decrease the distance to a new horizon of tones. How cool could that be? (The estimated total costs sum up to 15k, and upon request a detailed cost breakdown will be provided to any supporters).
  • Furthermore, each supporter's name will be written on the "Wall of Name" in my yet to be made home recording studio with a font size equal with the amount donated. (E.g. Andy is backing the project with 50 $, so his name will be written with 50 font size.) Due to the limitations of the wall from 500 $ upwards each supporter will have a personalised engraved plate on the wall instead. :-)

story:
Hi everyone,

My name is Dan Korn. I'm an artist based in London, but I'm often on the road. Wherever I am, art and music are at the centre of my life.

I am very lucky to have a band comprising me (vocals / guitar), Joe Sharp (vocals / bass), Bob Turley (lead guitar) and Jamie Shaw (drums).

----------

----------

In addition to these characters, there will be guest appearances on the album by other fine musicians, singers and artists!

We have been working very hard on our new material and we are thrilled about the direction we find ourselves travelling in. It has involved a lot of time and effort and every second has been worth it. We are now ready and raring to go forward with this new album.

The project will not be cheap. By paying for what we are offering in advance, you can really make a difference and help make this dream a reality.

----------

----------

Where will the money go?

All of the money raised will go towards the following:

  • Studio recording
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • CD and vinyl manufacture
  • PR

In reality, this will add up to more than £3000, but this amount will be enough to enable us to realise the project.

As well as buying the album on CD and vinyl, there are a whole host of other perks for you to pick from. For instance, you can buy a book of lyrics, handwritten and signed by Dan, or you can have us play in a location of your choosing!

----------

----------

Here's one we made earlier...

In 2015, we released our debut LP, Of The Sea. This was partially made possible by crowdfunding. We are very proud of the result, which you can listen to HERE.

----------

----------

Challenges

One of the things we learned from our first album is not to rush things. When you work on something very closely, sometimes you need to take a step back, before returning later with fresh ears. That is why we will not be imposing a strict deadline on ourselves. It will be ready when it's ready!

You can track the progress of the campaign on our Facebook page.

This project will be a success because we are a band of good people, talented musicians and inspired creators (if we do say so ourselves).

----------

----------

Other Ways You Can Help

Whatever you are able to contribute will mean a lot to us. You can also help massively by sharing this project with others. On this website, there are a number of tools to help you do this. Spreading the word is vital and will be hugely appreciated!

----------

 
www.dankorn.co.uk

story:
Hello, my name is Gareth. I work for Carousel in Brighton, a charity that supports learning disabled artists.

I first met Daniel Wakeford in 2011, by which time he had been working with Carousel for a couple of years. He already knew that he wanted to make music the focus of his life, and that one day he would become a ‘famous pop star and a legend’.

Daniel has come a very long way since that first meeting; working with his song writing partner, Tom Cook, he has written well over a hundred songs, ten of which were recorded for his album last year The Songs Of Gigs.  He represented the UK at the Song For Europe in Sweden in 2013 and last year Daniel completed a nine-date tour of the UK. The tour gained Daniel new exposure in mainstream media including interviews for two national papers and led to him being called ‘a legend and an inspiration’ by BBC Radio’s 6Music’s Marc Riley.

But Daniel’s music is a new discovery for many of his fans. In January 2017, his fourth appearance on Channel 4’s The Undateables featured Daniel going on tour and showcased his track Playboy Girls. The response was immediate and overwhelming. By the beginning of March, Daniel’s Facebook page had over 40,000 fans, he had accumulated over 125,000 plays on Spotify and Playboy Girls had topped the Spotify UK Viral Chart.

It is perfect timing for Daniel to be propelled in to the next stage of his career; he has the songs, the talent, the fans and certainly the potential to go all the way. This hike in popularity has happened very quickly. We’ve had many gig offers and requests from promoters and fans right around the UK. Carousel has been able to help Daniel make some of these opportunities happen by allocating funds from our core funding, but we can’t help Daniel to do all he wants to do without additional support.

That’s where we hope Daniel’s fans can help out…

Touring is an expensive feat for any artist to undertake. Costs are massively increased when supporting artists who have additional needs and who are vulnerable adults. Additional planning time, extra care support while on the road and longer, less gruelling schedules are just some of the things that we need to take in to account to ensure touring works for Daniel.

An average show costs £1,525.

Currently Daniel has committed to 5 shows, 3 of which have sold out at 200 capacity venues. The average ticket price has been £8. We’ve been working very closely with promoters and have been able to strike favourable fees, but once all expenses for venues have been factored in, we are still doing each show at a loss.

I believe that Daniel has already made a massive impact in challenging people’s expectations of people who have a learning disability, but at his live shows, audiences experience first-hand what is so inspiring about Daniel. Sure - he is a lovely, jolly and hugely charismatic individual – but on stage, he becomes a professional, a leader, the man in control of an entire room. He is in his element.

If we reach our £15,000 target, it will enable Daniel to perform ten gigs, in new places, to his new fans and allow him to show the UK what a talent they have in Daniel.

But this is just the start of the journey; if we raise more than our target, Daniel has lots of plans that we can help make real – a music video for Playboy Girls is top of the list - closely followed by a push for Eurovision stardom!

So please, have a look over the fantastic perks on offer and give if you can. If you can’t, there are plenty of other ways to support Daniel – follow his progress online by liking his Facebook page, listen to his album, tell your friends and come to a gig!

Whatever you do, you’ll know you were on board at the beginning of the journey.

story:
We have created the “Coyote Music Den” -- Pickin' Porch, Listening Room, Lesson Studio & Word Space where locals and visitors of all ages can gather to sing and play music, take music lessons, explore writing and listen to live music performances in an intimate “house concert” setting; located in the historic Community Square, the heart of the village, Ocracoke Island, North Carolina.

“I love what you’re doing … I LOVE WHAT YOU’RE DOING!” 

WHY US?
We are "Coyote" - Marcy and Lou, a married performing, songwriting duo.  Both are lifelong musicians, we moved to Ocracoke in 2001 and have been collaborating, writing, teaching and performing here ever since.  From 2008-2014 we toured nationally with folk band Molasses Creek, also from the island. 

Marcy has a Marketing/Management B.A. from Radford University and worked in the music business on the other side of the desk before teaching kids at church and stepping onstage.  Lou is a graduate of the Berklee School of Music and has been teaching and performing since his heavy metal college days.  We both are formally trained musicians, play multiple of instruments, enjoy a colorful array of musical genres and write our own songs.

(Ocrafolk Festival by Ann Ehringhaus)

MUSIC, MUSIC, MUSIC
The front Pickin' Porch is a vibrant gathering place and spontaneous music is already happening just in the first few days we've had the keys.  Along with our planned show calendar of live music shows, we will have workshops,
master music classes, present other artists, host art events and more in the
Listening Room (about 40 seats). 

TEACHING
Students of all ages (local and visiting) are invited to come learn and collaborate in hopes that we can contribute to our vibrant Ocracoke musical culture and help Ocracoke music endure the electronic age and span the generations.  Lou will immediately begin teaching his current roster of students and plans to explore ways to partner with the Ocracoke School (about 150 kids, pre-K through 12th grades), perhaps through the After School Program, along with island non-profits like Ocracoke Alive and the Youth Center to create music learning opportunities.  Lou also provides lessons via Skype to students anywhere in the world.  To the kids around here, he is simply the beloved "Mr. Lou!"

WRITING
There are two rooms upstairs.  One is Lou’s Teaching Studio, the other a Word Space for Marcy who is in the processing of writing two books and a batch of new songs for Coyote.  We plan to have "word nights" for all ages where sharing can happen; songwriting workshops, storytelling events and other literary gatherings.

TOURIST DESTINATION
Ocracoke Island is a vacation destination on the Outer Banks of North Carolina.  The only way to get here is by public ferry or private boat/plane.  This region is rich with tales of pirates, hurricanes and characters of all sort.  Music figures large in the local history.  Ocracoke is especially known as having been where Blackbeard the pirate lost his head.  Thousands of visitors arrive each week looking for things to do and community connection.  The thriving music culture here attracts and entertains many of our visitors, for some it's the reason they come here. 

(Community Square, photo by Bill Birkemeier)

HOW A DREAM BECOMES REALITY
Having resigned from Molasses Creek last year to pursue other projects, we dreamed about doing what we love most – sharing a variety of music with a bunch of different musicians.  This summer (2015) we debuted a weekly show called "Coyote Plus One” - an evening of well-crafted spontaneity with a different guest every week.  The show was hard-earned blessed magic and successful on every level.  Our venue, the Community Center, became unavailable to us due to a policy change, so we began the search for a location and found it.  We have leased the suddenly (and miraculously) available William Ellis Williams house (c. 1900) in the historic Community Square, the heart of the Ocracoke Village on Silver Lake harbor, to be the home of our artistic life.  We’re making a place where we can do what we were born to do - collaborate, teach and share music with others.

PLANNED PROGRAMMING for 2016
Coyote Music Den will present at least two shows for the Summer 2016 season:

  • "Coyote Plus One" on Tuesdays (click here for season recap)
  • "Martin Garrish & Friends" on Fridays, which will include island native Aaron Caswell, one of the next generation of Ocracoke musicians.
  • A Saturday Matinee:  we are contemplating a matinee on Saturdays during the "shoulder seasons" of early Spring and late Fall with a special show that would feature Martin Garrish, an island treasure.

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING (about the Coyote Plus One show):

     "You have come upon the most wonderful thing to offer the island and
       the musicians!"

     "You were amazing and one of the highlights of my trip.  A real treat,
       thank you for a memorable night.  A perfect end to a wonderful trip!!!"

     "I had a ball. All of you seemed to be having a powerfully wonder time. 
      I loved it and look forward to more.  Thanks for your wonderful music."

BROADCAST LIVE ON THE WEB

We will broadcast shows live stream on our Concert Window channel.  We introduced this for this summer of “Coyote Plus One” with enthusiastic result, building a strong and growing web audience.  Web broadcast tickets are $1.00.  The technology we used was only a few weeks old when we started, it is a fabulous thing.  There are highlight films on our website.

      "I love this idea and don't miss these concerts on Tuesday nights for anything. 
      This is so great and is the next best thing to being in Ocracoke."

      "We wish we were there with you all, but love watching you every Tuesday
       night from the Midwest!!"

      "If I can't be there, this is the next best thing!! Love from Baltimore!!"

      "Loved the video feed. Almost felt like we were there!

      "I feel like I'm back in Ocracoke for only $1 ... !!"



INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN BREAKDOWN
Initial One-Time Expenses:
Furnishings, Office Supplies       1,250
Graphic Design                                  500
JamHub (headphone based)        300
T-Shirts  (first short run)               500 
Logo Create/Building Signage  1,750
"Square" Box Office/Register       750
Web Camera (fixed)                           50
Chairs (40 folding)                           800
Curtains/Shades                              500
Stage Lighting                                 1,200
Stage Sound                                   2,500
Sound/Light, Consult/Install       500
Total One-Time Expenses    10,600

Operating Expenses Dec-May:
Rent                                                    6,000
Advertising                                           475
Utilities/Exp                                        900
WiFi/Phone                                         600
Insurance                                             600
Total Operating Expenses       8,575

Total Indiegogo Campaign  = $19,175

Funds that are raised, whether we reach our goal or not, will be used for initial startup and operating expenses to help us ramp-up this winter until May when full operations will begin.  Musical instruction will begin immediately.  We will start Tuesday Night Open Jams next week.  In early Spring the scheduled shows will begin and then we will be rolling on our own and into the future.  

PERKS
Created just for you ... we have designed unique PERKS!  We had fun coming up with creative ways to say thank you.  We invite you to buy more than one!

PART OF A BIGGER VISION
All of our talents, experience and dreams are wrapped into this project.  Everything we've ever done has prepared us for this.  The Community Square is owned and operated by the Ocracoke Foundation.  They are thrilled to have a musical element in the Square that will attract locals and visitors in such a magical way.  The ultimate plan for the Community Square project is that as debt service is reduced and eventually eliminated, the Ocracoke Foundation will ensure that the income from the Community Square will become a permanent endowment for the Ocracoke community, and the property will be protected in perpetuity.  We are delighted to be a part of such a wonderful vision - a permanent community endowment!

WITH A LITTLE HELP FROM OUR FRIENDS
The best thing you can do to help is to spread the word in every way you can.  There are Indiegogo Share Tools that can help you make noise about our campaign.

(Lou, Marcy and Martin at the first Coyote Plus One show May 2015
by Sundae Horn, click here for article written about this wonderful moment!)

LEAP OF FAITH
Taking on the stewardship and expense of a physical location is a huge leap of faith for us financially, but we are not afraid; we are informed by our years of experience, the solid success of Coyote's music, our musical partnership with Martin Garrish and the support of our community.  This concept has a life of its own already, we're just trying to hang on to its tail.  Our music, teaching and writing, along with our connection to community, is tried and true.  It DOES take a village and we are, gratefully, at the heart of this one.  This ... is love.

Please visit, in person or on a web broadcast, there will be music and an open door waiting for you.
We are grateful for your support!

Thank You,
Marcy and Louie
