our own and into the future.  
PERKSCreated just for you ... we have designed unique PERKS!  We had fun coming up with creative ways to say thank you.  We invite you to buy more than one!
PART OF A BIGGER VISIONAll of our talents, experience and dreams are wrapped into this project.  Everything we've ever done has prepared us for this. 
 The Community Square is owned and operated by the Ocracoke Foundation. 
 They are thrilled to have a musical element in the Square that will 
attract locals and visitors in such a magical way.  The ultimate plan for the Community Square project is that as debt service is reduced and 
eventually eliminated, the Ocracoke 
Foundation will ensure that the income from the Community Square will 
become a permanent endowment for the Ocracoke community, and the property will be protected in perpetuity.  We are 
delighted to be a part of such a wonderful vision - a permanent community endowment!WITH A LITTLE HELP FROM OUR FRIENDSThe best thing you can do to help is to spread the word in every way you can.  There are Indiegogo Share Tools that can help you make noise about our campaign.
(Lou, Marcy and Martin at the first Coyote Plus One show May 2015 by Sundae Horn, click here for article written about this wonderful moment!)LEAP OF FAITHTaking on the stewardship and expense of a physical location
 is a huge leap of faith for us financially, but we are not afraid; we 
are informed by our years of experience, the solid success of Coyote's 
music, our musical partnership with 
Martin Garrish and the support of our community.  This concept has a
 life of its own already, we're just trying to hang on to its tail.  Our music, teaching and writing, along with our connection to community, is tried and true.  It DOES take a village and we are, gratefully, at the heart of this one.  This ... is love.Please visit, in person or on a web broadcast, there will be music and an open door waiting for you.
We are grateful for your support!Thank You,Marcy and Louie

story:
EXCITING WORLD PREMIERE

Musica Marin is presenting the world premiere of two new songs by one of opera's most exciting young composers, Clint Borzoni. These texts of these songs were selected by and written for baritone Marco Vassalli, a rising star on the European opera scene. He will perform this in San Francisco on January 22 and 24, which will mark his long awaited U.S. debut.

Marco has chosen Hermann Hesse's Stufen and Hilde Domin's Margere Kost. The composer and singer, who live on opposite sides of the Atlantic Ocean have been collaborating over social media platforms to create the songs. The songs will be written for String Quartet and Baritone.

Musica Marin a non-profit organization whose purpose is to promote, support and inspire classical music by presenting unique world-class concerts in small sensory-rich environments.

Why this matters and what's in it for you!

Your support helps keep classical music and the vocal arts alive and thriving. In an age when opera is getting increasingly cost prohibitive, the art of song becomes ever more important. Very little has been written in the history of music for String Quartet and Baritone, with Samuel Barber's Dover Beach being one of the rare exceptions.

Even if you can't attend, there are plenty of great benefits, including:
  • Having a song dedicated to your or someone else
  • A page from the composer's notebook from one of the songs
  • Copies of VIAGGIO D'AMORE, Marco's beautifully sung CD of Italian songs

For those in Northern California, we have more exciting benefits, including:

  • A private reception with the artists at a private home at San Francisco's iconic corner of Haight & Ashbury
  • A private dinner with the artists
  • The chance to attend a private rehearsal
  • A musical journey on San Francisco Bay aboard a private yacht

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, there are plenty of ways that you can help:

  • Help spread the word on social media, especially on Twitter and Facebook
  • Email your friends and tell them about this exciting project

story:
The Spitting Pips...
We are a 5 piece alternative rock band from Rhyl, North Wales.
Over the last year we have released two EPs, been featured on BBC radio, played shows all over the UK and signed to Ugly Man Records & KJM Management.
We are heading back into the studio this November to record our next EP titled; 'Scribble Dome'

Why we are asking for your help...
We are currently arranging a massive UK and EU tour for maximum exposure, all our and the labels money is going towards funding this tour and a new van for us to travel in.
Any help towards our new recording, even the smallest donation would help massively and help us take the next step in our career.
Our family, friends & fans have been so supportive with everything we have done so far, words can not express how grateful we are.

What you will get...
Every person that helps us achieve our next goal will receive a copy of the 'Scribble Dome' EP

Thank You & Love From
The Pips.

story:
Short info about me

I am a multi-instrumentalist musician and composer and I don’t belong to any specific genre for I find it much more interesting to explore the rich variety of music possibilities. Roughly saying, my music is an alternative EDM: kicking mixture of psychedelic breaks, ethnic beats, shamanic mysticism and hyper speed electronic flashes. I fuse various sonic vibes into one large and motley musical canvas: traditional ethnic instruments with modern synthesizers, live guitars with shaman throat singing, jew harps and diverse world percussion and I play everything live (not simultaneously of course, I am not Shiva).

I play guitar for 20 years already and since my journey to Altai in 2008 I practice throat singing which is the famous in Tibetan and Tuvan versions. In 2011 in my study was continued in Himalaya, in the main location of Tibetan refuges where the current headquarter of Dalai Lama is situated – Himachal Pradesh. Lessons on the throat singing are available on the list of gigs and are unique in Israel (surprise me if I’m wrong))).    

My art is quite far away from the regular mundane reality with no lyrics or tunes that tend to stay firmly in it. I suppose that it is much closer to symbolic shaman journey, a passionate desire to break on through to the other side, into oblivion while paradoxically staying in the momentum – feel the rhythms of the moving frequencies within the body. Those are not a pathetic or pretentious words, for they come from the Arthur Schopenhauer’s notion of music as the most abstract form of art.

 

Links to my art

Everyone can grab my first album Anima Fuga (2013) from the internet for free or support buy/support it on my bandcamp page.

Official site: http://radjan.space

http://www.ektoplazm.com/free-music/ra-djan-anima-fuga

http://radjan.bandcamp.com/

And everyone can play a crazy 2D Arcanoid space shooter game with my music on board:

http://store.steampowered.com/app/625160/Scroll...

 

Brief description of the album to come

My second album will be a bit different from the first one, more hardcore. On my first album I wrote lots of different melodies and progressive arrangements at the expense of sound synthesis, effects and timbre. Now I tried to preserve a balance between those elements if one can claim such an unobvious thing. It still has a tribal essence with shamanic overtone chants, much more metal and speed. Tribal drum’n’bass and breakbeat would be close to define it from the primitive starting point.

Because most of the recording and mixing stage is done in my ghetto style home studio the amount I need is much less than the amount the most bands are pledging.

 

Huge respect for all you friend and hope for your support and sharing this project can work even better than the money!

P.S. The album will be released regardless the amount I’ll rise.

story:
Hello!

 

My name is Doro and I have a band called My Favourite Things. It started out me writing my own songs after playing in bands for many years. I had just come to New York and went through many big changes at the same time - and the loss of very close family members... but writing songs was a great way for me to deal with it. After the first record was done, I put a band together and since then, we have been playing live all over New York City and a bit in Germany, as well! Now the third album is finally finished - I only need to get the money together for the mastering and production cost of making CDs or Vinyl.

All the songs come from a truly deep and authentic place, and my band mates help me create the musical outcome of this! I am really proud of this one because it sounds really good. The first album, I recorded in my bedroom with a laptop and a SM 58 microphone. The drums, I recorded in my friends kitchen with 2 microphones! On the second album, things started sounding much better because I had learned to be a better recording and mixing engineer at that point- drums were recorded with 4 microphones! Now on this album, we went to my friend and occasional bass player Jonathan Granoff's studio in Brooklyn, and recorded the drums with 9 microphones and all sorts of fancy equipment! Besides, my drummer Yoshio Kobayashi is an amazing drummer and many of those songs we've been playing live, so we all had a feel for it when we recorded them. 

I mixed and polished everything, and now it is so close to being finished and released to the public, only we need to go to the mastering studio, which will cost $1000 for this 12 song and 53 minute album! The mastering will be done by the amazing Alan Douches at WestWestSide Studios upstate New York. He had mastered the previous records "rarara" and "tomorrow's far away" as well, and did an excellent job - he is a true master, no pun intended! :) 

Still, many songs deal with loss of people in my life - I hope it can be helpful to other people that go through a similar time. But there are also joyful songs about life, love, friendship and the seasons, so please join in and sing along!

I have tried to find a record label who would be interested in putting it out, that could hopefully pay for the mastering, but unfortunately, no record label said yay! But when we play live, and when I play the mixes to our friends and fans, people like it and keep encouraging me to follow through and finish it on my own. Finishing a record is always an important thing, it feels like the next stage of some kind. It's like giving birth to your creative ideas, and releasing it to the world, like a mama bird releasing its little birdies! So I can move and start working on the next record! 

 

The finances

Mastering will be $1000, if I make 100 CDs via CDbaby, thats about $300. Making vinyl, which would be amazing, would cost around $1800. The cost of PR for a record is tricky - it starts at $1000 and the sky is the limit - or, in a more down to earth music world, probably between $1000 and $5000. 

Obviously, we take what we get and will be grateful and happy for any amount. The first and foremost will be the mastering. If there's not enough money now, there will be a digital release. Then the next expense should probably be the PR, so whatever stays left will be invested in that, and if there is money left after the minimum PR campaign, CDs and Vinyl shall be pressed and spread around!

 

What will you get in return? 

First of all, the knowledge that you helped and supported me! Also, the more you choose to donate, the bigger and better the reward you get! From receiving a digital release or signed copy of the CD, to having me/us play a private concert in your home! If you are unable to donate, maybe you can share this page and we will send you gratitude and love back through the ether! You can send me a message at doro@dorotheatachler.com if you have any questions, or if you want to sign up to our mailing list!

 

So that's all, THANK YOU for listening, reading, and staying with me. We will keep you posted on social media like facebook etc, so follow us there and stay posted if you like! 

Much love from 

Doro and My Favourite Things

story:
We are Dead Eyes Always Dreaming!

As you see, we are creating a crushing new full-length album, and want to get it to the fans as soon as possible. The album will contain 14 tracks, and will be our longest and most expensive effort yet. We would never threaten you with not getting a product because no one contributed, but this will help get out that effort quicker. Everyone knows this is an expensive business, so help bring something that we can all enjoy together!

What We Need & What You Get

  • All proceeds go to creating the album, marketing, new merchandise, physicals of albums, and vinyl

Risks & Challenges

Longer time frame of YOU getting more new music, merch, and seeing us tour!

Either way it will happen, but you can be the factor on how soon it will happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

 Feel free to spread the word around! Via social media or word of mouth!

story:
Toni Bergins

Hi!  I'm Toni.  I'm a dancer, singer-songwriter, workshop facilitator, founder of JourneyDance™ and creator of the Embodied Transformations Method for personal growth and development.  For the last 20+ years I have used movement and expression to help people get out of their minds and into their bodies and move into a new story.  My goal has been to create a wave of inspiration where people learn to love themselves, connect with their joy and find their personal power! 

As I work with people, I find such a range of sadness and joy in the world.  I have started using songwriting and singing to release my own emotions and connect with people's stories.  Almost every song on this upcoming debut album was written in response to emotions I needed to express.  My title track Never Too Late was written to inspire those who feel they have lost their dreams, or that the pain of their past holds them back from fully living.

Two years ago I began sharing my music publicly during workshops and at open mic events.  I got some wonderfully positive responses and someone generously introduced me to my producer Jason Samonik.   We immediately clicked and became writing and musical partners.  He took my folky guitar songs and my piano ballads and turned them into epic musical pieces.

It's been a challenging process to uplevel my work and jump deeper into sharing my voice and message. For me, the voice is my most vulnerable place to share myself.  I'm pushing myself to my edge recording these songs, performing them and deciding to share them with the public.

This campaign is to help raise money for producing and completing this long-awaited project.  It's been a labor of love!  I just finished writing the last song for the album, Made From Love, about how my divorce impacted my sons.  I know many people will relate to it.  With your help, I can get these messages out into the mainstream!

What We Need & What You Get

Recording and production is a costly yet totally worthwhile venture.  I've loved every minute of it!  I've also spent a ton of my own personal money on this labor of love and I now need to raise funds to continue paying my producer to bring these songs to life on my first album.

You can probably tell I love connecting with people.  Your donation means so much to me because you will become a part of this project and getting it out to the world!!  I've created a bunch of perks as my way of saying thank you for your generous contributions.  There are even a few perks where we can connect directly, like songwriting workshops.

The goal I selected will allow me to complete a full CD of 11 songs.  If I don't reach my full goal, I will use the funds I do raise to work on as many tracks as I can and release them as singles.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute financially, your support means so much to me.  This is such an emotional journey and every person's energetic contribution helps the momentum of this project.  Please consider:

  • Sharing this campaign with friends and others who might be moved by this music!
  • Looking for my songs and videos on Spotify, iTunes and YouTube!

story:
About Us, and Why This Matters So Much

I run the DMT Tapes FL digital album archive, a collection of albums and artists that have come together to preserve an important piece of the vaporwave (and assoc. genres) community. The vaporwave scene began informally in 2010 and DMT Tapes FL has been proud to enter that rich genre history in late 2014; to this day, we are approaching 500 albums, and by the time the event of this campaign begins, we will be several dozen albums past that.

Preserving two things have always been important to our mission at DMT-FL: the first is to uphold the right for our entire roster to be preserved and archived, enjoyed by all who enjoy the pursuit of musical discovery; the second is to be a safe keep for artists wishing to have their music be a part of something larger than its individual release. Bringing together the fanbases of hundreds of vaporwave & electronic artists has been a proven success across the middle and late 2010s, and when Vaporwave is Alive, pt. 1 occurred in January of 2016, it created a resonant effect on our listenership that has not stopped in the 2+ years since.

I wish to conduct a sequel to this event, one of extreme magnitude that has benefited all artists on the label both past, participating, and future. In addition to having this exposure boost for all releasing artists, I would love to pay each artist an equal fee via Paypal as a thanks for meeting the deadline of such a time-intensive event.

What We Need & What You Get

I have seen it many releases come onto DMT Tapes FL that has received loads of listenership, but those who contributed funds were so low that there could be $3 across 3+ years. The model of promoting and supporting free listenership has led to DMT-FL having a 98% $0 download rate. This IndieGoGo would supplicate funds up-front, so that rather than waiting and hoping that each album gets equally supported (which doesn't ever happen), we have the ability to pay all artists on the release day. If an artist never makes the money in contributions back, it will not matter, as they will be happily paid within the very same few minutes after an album will go live.

I have come up with $625 based on the estimate of there being roughly 30 releasing artists; the $25 over 600 is to off-set the 5% IndieGoGo campaign fee. I would like to pay artists as close to $20 apiece, over if we happen to go over our goal and under only if we fail. I will see to it that every artist gets at least $10 in this event even if we fall short by some several hundred.

The perks are cheesy. We've always been digital-based because many of us lack the physicality, aptitude or ability to do things outside the computer-based realm. Nevertheless, I hope those of you who opt for the things we've come up with are able to enjoy them for what they're worth.

Only Contribute If You Both Can AND Wish

If you love vaporwave music, if you love some or any or all of the hundreds of DMT Tapes FL artists you've met in 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018, and if you hope to see an continuance of artists feeling like it is worth it to participate in widescale events that test the limits of their artistic fortitude, this is exactly the campaign for you to support. Vaporwave music has a rich history that will be remembered for generations to come, and this event will be remembered as an important cog in the machine of its being. Please consider being a part of its likeness today.

Potential Impact

The first Vaporwave is Alive, pt. 1 was conducted across the entire month of January 2016. In November of the same year, YouTube creator and world-record holder  for subscribers (both then and now) PewDiePie discovered our content and the music that came out during this event. He proceeded to plug and link his 50 million subscribers to our pages, flooding our downloads and plays stats in a way that they still look minorly effected 2+ years later. Albums from the last Vaporwave is Alive period also attracted the attention & support of major players such as The Needle Drop, historic vaporwave label Ailanthus Recordings.

Conducting a sequel to an event that enriched this label so much is the most rational and necessary action I can take for bettering the position of every album & artist who has released on DMT Tapes FL. By contributing to us here, you are now a part of that esteemed history.

Artist Eligibility & Selection

Any and all artists who have a correspondent relationship with a member of DMT Tapes FL administration (e.g. any releasing artist on the label, artists/people who have reached out on social media to our channels in the past, etc.) will be eligible to apply for the July 2018 festival. I would love to bend time and space to create a day in July for every artist, but we are limited to 31 days. If we exceed this number in terms of eligible interested artists, we will have to determine by random draw which artists have been accepted. Please understand that this is the fairest way to accommodate what might be hundreds of artists who may be interested. It is also to be noted that a few artists have been guaranteed spots prior to this event being confirmed as happening, so the random draw will be around 25 people. Those who don't get into for July 2018 will be allowed to release in June or August; EVERY artist who asks to be in will get to release for DMT-FL as long as they are okay with accepting a consolation release date in the case of us running out of days.

Due to the nature of this campaign, albums coming out in months other than July cannot presently be paid upfront for. We know that our network understands this (hence the need for a crowdfund at all).

 

Ways to Help Without Spending a Single Cent

Listen to the music, tell the artists on social media that they're doing amazing work, make a playlist of your favorite songs and share it with friends or family or your social network, share the link to this campaign, or simply enjoy a nostalgic memory about how much music means to you. The spirit of what we're doing at DMT Tapes FL is larger than simply listening to what we have to offer. We hope you bring the joy and love of music into your life everywhere you go.
story_txt:
About Us, and Why This Matters So Much
I run the DMT Tapes FL digital album archive, a collection of albums and artists that have come together to preserve an important piece of the vaporwave (and assoc. genres) community. The vaporwave scene began informally in 2010 and DMT Tapes FL has been proud to enter that rich genre history in late 2014; to this day, we are approaching 500 albums, and by the time the event of this campaign begins, we will be several dozen albums past that.
Preserving two things have always been important to our mission at DMT-FL: the first is to uphold the right for our entire roster to be preserved and archived, enjoyed by all who enjoy the pursuit of musical discovery; the second is to be a safe keep for artists wishing to have their music be a part of something larger than its individual release. Bringing together the fanbases of hundreds of vaporwave & electronic artists has been a proven success across the middle and late 2010s, and when Vaporwave is Alive, pt. 1 occurred in January of 2016, it created a resonant effect on our listenership that has not stopped in the 2+ years since.
I wish to conduct a sequel to this event, one of extreme magnitude that has benefited all artists on the label both past, participating, and future. In addition to having this exposure boost for all releasing artists, I would love to pay each artist an equal fee via Paypal as a thanks for meeting the deadline of such a time-intensive event.

What We Need & What You Get
I have seen it many releases come onto DMT Tapes FL that has received loads of listenership, but those who contributed funds were so low that there could be $3 across 3+ years. The model of promoting and supporting free listenership has led to DMT-FL having a 98% $0 download rate. This IndieGoGo would supplicate funds up-front, so that rather than waiting and hoping that each album gets equally supported (which doesn't ever happen), we have the ability to pay all artists on the release day. If an artist never makes the money in contributions back, it will not matter, as they will be happily paid within the very same few minutes after an album will go live.
I have come up with $625 based on the estimate of there being roughly 30 releasing artists; the $25 over 600 is to off-set the 5% IndieGoGo campaign fee. I would like to pay artists as close to $20 apiece, over if we happen to go over our goal and under only if we fail. I will see to it that every artist gets at least $10 in this event even if we fall short by some several hundred.
The perks are cheesy. We've always been digital-based because many of us lack the physicality, aptitude or ability to do things outside the computer-based realm. Nevertheless, I hope those of you who opt for the things we've come up with are able to enjoy them for what they're worth.

Only Contribute If You Both Can AND Wish
If you love vaporwave music, if you love some or any or all of the hundreds of DMT Tapes FL artists you've met in 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018, and if you hope to see an continuance of artists feeling like it is worth it to participate in widescale events that test the limits of their artistic fortitude, this is exactly the campaign for you to support. Vaporwave music has a rich history that will be remembered for generations to come, and this event will be remembered as an important cog in the machine of its being. Please consider being a part of its likeness today.
Potential Impact
The first Vaporwave is Alive, pt. 1 was conducted across the entire month of January 2016. In November of the same year, YouTube creator and world-record holder  for subscribers (both then and now) PewDiePie discovered our content and the music that came out during this event. He proceeded to plug and link his 50 million subscribers to our pages, flooding our downloads and plays stats in a way that they still look minorly effected 2+ years later. Albums from the last Vaporwave is Alive period also attracted the attention & support of major players such as The Needle Drop, historic vaporwave label Ailanthus Recordings.
Conducting a sequel to an event that enriched this label so much is the most rational and necessary action I can take for bettering the position of every album & artist who has released on DMT Tapes FL. By contributing to us here, you are now a part of that esteemed history.
Artist Eligibility & SelectionAny and all artists who have a correspondent relationship with a member of DMT Tapes FL administration (e.g. any releasing artist on the label, artists/people who have reached out on social media to our channels in the past, etc.) will be eligible to apply for the July 2018 festival. I would love to bend time and space to create a day in July for every artist, but we are limited to 31 days. If we exceed this number in terms of eligible interested artists, we will have to determine by random draw which artists have been accepted. Please understand that this is the fairest way to accommodate what might be hundreds of artists who may be interested. It is also to be noted that a few artists have been guaranteed spots prior to this event being confirmed as happening, so the random draw will be around 25 people. Those who don't get into for July 2018 will be allowed to release in June or August; EVERY artist who asks to be in will get to release for DMT-FL as long as they are okay with accepting a consolation release date in the case of us running out of days.Due to the nature of this campaign, albums coming out in months other than July cannot presently be paid upfront for. We know that our network understands this (hence the need for a crowdfund at all). 
Ways to Help Without Spending a Single CentListen to the music, tell the artists on social media that they're doing amazing work, make a playlist of your favorite songs and share it with friends or family or your social network, share the link to this campaign, or simply enjoy a nostalgic memory about how much music means to you. The spirit of what we're doing at DMT Tapes FL is larger than simply listening to what we have to offer. We hope you bring the joy and love of music into your life everywhere you go.

story:
¿Quiénes somos?

Electric Mistakes es un power duo de rock alternativo, formado en el 2013 en la ciudad de Bogotá por Juan Hernández y Laura Perilla. En su trayectoria han llegado a tocar en algunos de los festivales más importantes del país, tales como el Festival Hermoso Ruido 2015 y el Festival Estéreo Picnic 2016. Fueron teloneros de Kaiser Chiefs en Bogotá.
Su primer disco Chavela, ha sido reconocido por diferentes medios como una de las grabaciones mas relevantes del año 2016 en la escena independiente Colombiana, siendo nominados en dos categorías a los premios Shock 2016. En el 2017 realizaron la gira nacional ‘Lejos de Casa’ visitando la Costa Caribe y el oriente Antioqueño, además fueron parte de Picnic Sessions, El Toque del Sábado, El Circo del Cónsul y el Festival Hermoso Ruido 2017. 
Comenzaron el 2018 con su participación en el Festival Centro y abrieron el concierto de El Mató un Policia Motorizado en Bogotá.

¿Para qué?

Vicente será nuestro segundo disco y estamos reuniendo los fondos para grabarlo, el material ya está listo para entrar a estudio y sólo necesitamos la ayuda de todos para lograrlo. Todas las recompensas que creamos giran al rededor de nuestra música y lo que hacemos pero están creadas para todos ustedes, hay artículos que serán edición limitada y únicamente se podrán adquirir a través de esta campaña.

¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos reunir 4.000 dólares, si no lo logramos todo lo recaudado irá a la financiación del disco, no importa la cantidad que sea.

¿Cómo puedes ayudar?

Comparte esta campaña de tus redes sociales e invita a tus amigos a que participen, estamos seguros que hay más gente como tu que quiere oír nuestra música. Recuerda que sólo tenemos 60 días para lograr la meta.

story:
AVEC GO4MUZIK DÉCOUVREZ LE 1er RÉSEAU SOCIAL COLLABORATIF DE MISE EN RELATION ENTRE ARTISTES ET PROFESSIONNELS DE LA MUSIQUE.

«Bonjour à tous, je m’appelle Eric Clermontet et je suis passionné de musique et de digital. Vous avez peut-être vu mon nom apparaître sur quelques pochettes de disques des années 80/90, à l’époque où j’étais UNO et je réalisais et produisais des albums comme "Osez Joséphine" d'Alain Bashung, et ceux de Stephan Eicher, Mory Kante, Luna Parker, Jean-Louis Aubert, Bill Deraime, Viktor Lazlo et bien d’autres ! 

C’est pour créer des histoires digitales, qu’en 2008 j’ai fondé E2C2, une agence de storytelling digitale pionnière des réseaux sociaux d’entreprise et professionnels et ce n'est qu'en 2015 que grâce aux demandes de mes amis musiciens et professionnels de la production musicale que je pouvais enfin associer mes 2 grandes passions, la création musicale et le digital en un seul et même projet :


QU’EST-CE QUE GO4MUZIK?

Aujourd'hui, un projet musical c'est bien plus que de la musique.

Ce sont des musiciens et des professionnels avec qui collaborer pour créer une œuvre qu'on n'aurait pu finaliser tout seul. Ce sont aussi des auteurs, des compositeurs, des interprètes, des managers, des éditeurs, des tourneurs, des managers, des avocats, des techniciens qui vous aideront à mener à bien votre projet…

Et enfin, un projet musical c'est un public, une communauté dont les attentes doivent être nourries par des créations de qualité !

GO4MUZIK est une plateforme collaborative qui permet aux artistes de solliciter une communauté de professionnels passionnés qui proposent leurs compétences: c’est également un réseau social qui permettra aux professionnels de se connecter entre eux et de trouver des opportunités de travail grâce à leur expérience et à leur réputation


COMMENT ÇA FONCTIONNE ?

GO4MUZIK est une application qui créé un cadre professionnel de mise en relation

  • Pour les Artistes en recherche de collaborations professionnelles et/ou de prestations
  • Pour les Professionnels en recherche d’opportunités de collaboration
  • Pour les Pros et les Artistes une mise en relation sécurisée avec les prestataires de services de l’industrie musicale (avocats, manager, tourneur, salle de spectacle, etc...)

RETROUVEZ NOS PARRAINS* SUR GO4MUZIK
ils sont notre source d’inspiration et sans leur soutien actif rien n’est  possible

* Hubert, tu nous manques, on penses à toi très fort

OSEZ, OSEZ

 

OK ! MAIS POURQUOI JE DEVRAI M’ABONNER A GO4MUZIC ?


En image parce que ça raconte l'histoire plus efficacement pour les créateurs/créatifs

Et pour les professionnels




POUR QUI ?



POUR QUOI FAIRE* ?

* Quelques exemples



MERCI A VOUS !

Nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour concrétiser ce projet !

Lisez ce qui suit  pour voir comment. !


NOS OBJECTIFS

En créant GO4MUZIK pour le public nos objectifs sont :

  • De créer un réseau social professionnel de la musique
  • De proposer aux créateurs une offre de services de professionnels dont la réputation est validée et commentée par la communauté
  • De permettre aux professionnels de se connecter et de trouver les meilleures opportunités de collaboration
  • D’agréger et de présenter l’offre créative musicale à l’industrie musicale dans sa globalité
  • De permettre aux éditeurs et diffuseurs audio-visuels de solliciter de nouveaux talents par de concours et des appels à candidature
  • De rompre l’isolement des créatifs en les connectant aux meilleurs professionnels et aux meilleures pratiques
  • De sécuriser les offres entre artiste et prestataires

Nous pensons que GO4MUZIK peut créer la révolution digitale que tous les professionnels attendent pour développer leurs activités musicales - et nous n’avons jamais été aussi prêts de faire de cette révolution une réalité.



CE DONT NOUS AVONS BESOIN ET CE QUE VOUS POUVEZ FAIRE POUR NOUS AIDER

Notre idéal de financement est de 150 000 €.

Néanmoins, conscients du caractère incertain de la démarche, nous avons prévu de pouvoir faire progresser le projet même si nous collectons moins, cela prendra juste plus de temps, de négociations et plus de chance… 

(note: nous saurons aussi faire avec plus que l’objectif…)


SOUTIENS AMICAUX, AVANTAGES, CONTREPARTIES ET PRÉVENTE

Vous pouvez soutenir ce projet de 2 façon différentes :

  • SOUTIENS AMICAUX & PRÉVENTE - LOVE MONEY
  • PARRAINAGE, SPONSORING -  INVESTISSEMENT

COMMENT LES FINANCEMENTS SERONT-ILS UTILISÉS? 

Vous pouvez soutenir ce projet de 2 façon différentes :


La phase I se terminera en juin

LE LANCEMENT EST PREVU POUR LE 1ER JUILLET 2016

La phase II est la phase d’exploitation de juillet à décembre 2016.


NOUS SOMMES PRÊT À RELEVER LE DÉFI !

Pour préparer ce projet, nous avons déjà en place :

  • Une équipe d'experts chez GO4MUZIK, qui peut gérer le développement de la démo, créer et concevoir l'interface du logiciel et la gérer.
  • Un cumul de plus de 300 années d'expériences partagées dans le numérique, les plateformes collaboratives, la gestion communautaire, la gamification, le social media et la musique.
  • Un réseau de partenaires spécialisés
  • Des parrains et membres fondateurs de choc!


A QUEL PRIX ?

VOUS ÊTES UN ARTISTE

GO4MUZIK permet à tout le monde de déposer des annonces GRATUITEMENT du moment qu’elles ont un rapport avec l’industrie musicale. 

Que vous cherchiez un manager, un tourneur, un bar où jouer vos morceaux, un avocat spécialisé en contrat d’édition, un éditeur, une maison de disque ou un distributeur, un mixeur ou un parolier pour vos chansons, un réalisateurs pour votre groupe, un arrangeur pour votre chorale… 

enfin bon on arrête là car vous avez compris et on pourrait continuer comme cela pendant des heures ! 

Tout ce qu’il faut retenir c’est que TOUS LES PROFESSIONNELS sont sur  GO4MUZIK prêt à répondre à vos besoins et vos envies créatives ! 

Et une dernière fois au cas ou vous n'auriez pas encore compris : le dépôt d'annonce est TOUJOURS GRATUIT !


A QUEL PRIX ?

VOUS ÊTES UN PROFESSIONNEL

Si vous êtes professionnel... (par professionnel on entend quelqu'un qui a fait de la musique son activité principale et qui a une expérience qui lui permet de revendiquer ce status ) et que vous recherchez des opportunités d’exprimer vos talents avec des artistes qui recherchent vos compétences, il faudra vous abonner! 

Pas de panique le premier abonnement STARTER est de 9,99€ pour un mois SANS ENGAGEMENT ! 

L’abonnement PRO ANNUEL (réglé d'avance) est à SEULEMENT 20€ par mois et vous pouvez passer des annonces pour offrir vos services et répondre à toutes les annonces en ILLIMITÉ !!!

Et une dernière fois au cas ou vous n'auriez pas encore compris : le dépôt d'annonce est  TOUJOURS GRATUIT !


DES QUESTIONS ?

Y a-t-il d'autres questions ? Dites-nous ce que vous pensez de GO4MUZIK, donnez-vous votre ressenti sur ce projet, cela nous permettra de le rendre meilleur!

MERCI DE VOTRE INTÉRÊT POUR GO4MUZIK!

Même si vous ne pouvez pas participer à notre campagne de dons aujourd'hui, vous pouvez toujours nous aider en la partageant avec vos amis et votre famille.

Hey! Ho! Lets Go! / Hey! Ho! Lets

The Ramones

story:
"We don't accomplish anything in this world alone...and whatever happens is the result of a whole tapestry of one's life and all the weavings of individual threads from one to another that creates something." --Sandra Day O'Connor

2016 marks a significant milestone for the high school graduating classes of 82-85.  With each of us either having recently turned 50 or are about to turn 50, it presents a unique opportunity to reflect on our lives, understand where we’ve come from, how we’ve grown and those who’ve shaped our outlook. 

Music is the thread that ties us all together and we have the opportunity to recognize the teachers and mentors that have shared their passion for music, demonstrated teamwork through the process and ultimately inspired each of us to be better individuals and members of the community.

Our goal is to create a holiday music video using members listed below in a manner that renews and builds on the camaraderie we once shared and recognizes Ron Cardeccia, Jimmy Wilkins & Bill Berndt and their contributions on shaping our lives. The video will contain pre/post interviews with various members of the band and our former mentors as well as an arrangement of 'Frosty the Snowman' specifically created for this unique reunion ensemble.

  • Nick Backos , drums, 78
  • Todd Belanger , trumpet, 85
  • Bill Berndt, teacher/band director
  • Ron Berndt, trumpet, 84
  • Stephanie Brown, saxophone, 79
  • Ron Cardeccia, trumpet-teacher/band director
  • Kim Cieslak, trumpet, 82
  • Mike Gronowicz, kazoo, 84
  • Doug Katchorek, bass, 84
  • Craig Marshall, trombone, 82
  • Mike McClain, kazoo, 84
  • Kathy Schnieder, saxophone/clarinet, 79
  • Gary Schodowski, trumpet, 84
  • Frank Schuster, trombone, 84
  • George Schuster, guitar/saxophone, 82
  • Anjan Shah, saxophone, 84
  • Rena Urso, flute/narration, 85
  • Jimmy Wilkins, vocals-teacher/band director

Funds will be used to pay on production related expenses such as videography, photography, recording studio & editing, video editing, graphic design and script development.  Funds in excess of production related expenses will be donated to the Chippewa Valley's music program.
story_txt:
"We don't accomplish anything in this world alone...and whatever happens is the result of a whole tapestry of one's life and all the weavings of individual threads from one to another that creates something." --Sandra Day O'Connor2016 marks a significant milestone for the high school graduating classes of 82-85.  With each of us either having recently turned 50 or are about to turn 50, it presents a unique opportunity to reflect on our lives, understand where we’ve come from, how we’ve grown and those who’ve shaped our outlook. Music is the thread that ties us all together and we have the opportunity to recognize the teachers and mentors that have shared their passion for music, demonstrated teamwork through the process and ultimately inspired each of us to be better individuals and members of the community.Our goal is to create a holiday music video using members listed below in a manner that renews and builds on the camaraderie we once shared and recognizes Ron Cardeccia, Jimmy Wilkins & Bill Berndt and their contributions on shaping our lives. The video will contain pre/post interviews with various members of the band and our former mentors as well as an arrangement of 'Frosty the Snowman' specifically created for this unique reunion ensemble.

story:
You are helping to bring a dream home by supporting "Always Home"! Terry Burns and Ron Kristy met  in Nashville, where they were both  already independent, successful songwriters and musicians. They were married in 2004, and began creating music together in 2011 in Ithaca NY. “Burns and Kristy” was born out of their musical union… and one thing they knew early on was that spiritual music would be an important part of their musical journey together. They both felt that in these difficult times, the healing power of music can help create harmony, connection, and peace in people and in the world.         

Terry and Ron's wish is to bring this CD into your hearts and homes, and to reach out to spiritual centers and teachers who are interested in bringing messages of peace and understanding to others. They see this CD being sold in yoga and meditation centers, retreat centers, churches, and workshop settings where community and sustainability are the focus. AND they are ready to go on the road with these songs.

Thank you for making this possible, we are so grateful for your contribution and support! We can do this!

Here’s an overview of some of what your funds are providing:

*Studio time and engineers in Ithaca and Nashville

*Additional musicians and vocalists

*Artwork for the CD cover

*Videography for the site and new EPK (press kit)

*CD mastering and production

*Promotion and professional packaging of this new work to be sold in spiritual centers as well as promoting Burns and Kristy live at wellness events/venues

*Toys for "Skoot The Schnoodle"... to keep her quiet while we record.


From Terry and Ron: “This CD has given us such joy, and is a labor of love! Find a fun perk that suits you, and allow us to share back with you.

Thank you So Very Much!!!!

Love, Terry And Ron

p.s. Keep a lookout for our "Indiegogo bloopers" reel over the next few days!

story:
Below is a link that takes you to my  interview with Jonathan Nadeau.  It was fun but I was a little nervous. Thanks for listening!

http://crowdfundingcast.tk/crowdfunding-cast-episode-335-alice-darling/

In a dream, I heard this beautiful orchestration and melody of the song I named “I’ll Say It”. It wasn't the first night I had heard music in my sleep. I woke myself up and ran to the piano to quickly recreate the song before I had forgotten it. My inspiration for creating many of the songs on the album came from those kinds of dreams or from piano chords or key combinations which  provoke an emotion. I did my best to translate the emotion I felt into the music.


I would have never started this album if not for the unresolved, unsettling  empty feeling I encountered one night out.  I was watching a band and caught myself sobbing over my drink, while thinking that I had never followed through with music. The next day, from in my closet, I took my demos, dusted them off, and headed down to show them to a musician friend. He liked them a lot and encouraged me to write the lead sheets for them. That led me into a nearby recording studio to lay down a more presentable version of these songs. It was the recording of these initial songs that sparked my determination to polish up some other song ideas for my own full album. It took years writing, rewriting, arranging, rearranging, tracking, re-tracking, etc. It certainly was a learning process in self producing an album.  

Now, I feel I have produced songs that sound like what I had imagined. I'm hoping and would be grateful for any help through Indiegogo for the completion of this album. 


About the Music:  

Written by Angelina Jean

In a dream, I heard this beautiful orchestration and melody of the song I named “I’ll Say It". It wasn't the first night I had heard music in my sleep. I woke myself up and ran to the piano to quickly recreate the song before I had forgotten it. My inspiration for creating many of the songs on the album came from those kinds of dreams or from piano chords or key combinations which provoked an emotion. I did my best to translate the emotion I felt into the music.

ABOUT THE MUSIC
Written by Angelina Jean

Engineer Ron Vento has been tracking the deep raspy vocals of Darling from the initial stages of her upcoming album Alice Darling. “The album is definitly about the vocals,” Vento admits. While other initial previewers from in and out of the sound room have picked their favorite songs based on musical style, it is difficult to put her music in one specific genre since it integrates rock, funk, soul, electronic, and even classical sounds. Her music has recieved some great responses and is unique in that it does mix multiple types of genres.

Two Steps

The song “Two Steps” stands out as a catchy tune that mixes funk rhythms and integrates a syncopated chorus and fun dance beat. The song’s final mix was done by multi-platinum and grammy nominated engineer, Benny Steele, who has mixed songs and worked with top artists such as Justin Bieber, David Guetta, Jason Derulo, and Pitbull. He describes Darling’s writing as “Classic” and proclaims her as an “incredible singer/songwriter”. (http://soundbetter.com/profiles/21759-alice-d/reviews)                  

While “Two Steps” offers a funk inspired guitar rhythm, the song “What I Want” composes differently, much like a rock song, including two rhythm guitars and a lively pop beat. The music sounds light, the vocals are soulful, and most of the instrumentation comes from a synthesizer keyboard to create a fresh vibe.

Another track on the album called “Euro” is an electronic dance song with a heavy kick drum beat. It is unique in a way that does not contain the repetitious loops associated with typical electronic music. This instrumental arrangement incorporates horns and violins, and the bulk of the song features the synthesizer keyboard which gives off a sweeping and uplifting melody.

“I’ll Say It”, in which New York Advertiser Richard Ferelli (Greengage Associates) describes as “Haunting”, denotes a classical influence. The arrangement stirs the emotions and is reminiscent of a movie score. Joining Darling on the single are singer Reggie Honere, who counters in a duet, and classically trained violinist Yoed Nir.

When the album is complete, Darling says her next step is to tour the country for the album release and continue to write and produce songs full time.

To hear samples of Alice Darling’s music, please visit Venus & Alice Publishing homepage:  http://www.venusandalicepublishing.com

Hopefully with your help for this campaign, I can make this album available to the public. I am so happy and so grateful for any amount you can contribute through Indiegogo. My songs are from the heart and I hope you enjoy the music that I loved creating. 

Thank you for you're consideration.

Love, 

Alice 

       What You Are Supporting:

This campaign is raising funds to create a physical CD to be distributed in stores.  I started the finishing process with a wonderfully talented Platinum Engineer named Benny Steele.  He has fine-tuned two songs thus far and we have more to go.You can hear the finished digital master on "All that Matters" in the background of the uploaded video on this campaign. One of my favorite songs on the album called "Two Steps", can be found on YouTube which is accompanied by lyrics. If this album is something you would like to help me with, please be the driving force in getting this project accomplished. 

To finish the album of this quality, costs quickly add up. Together with your help, here’s what your donation will cover for the cd project:

1). Mixing & Mastering of Seven More Songs: Each track will be mixed for sound and balance to enhance the music. In the final step, the album will be mastered for commercial standards.

 2). CD insert.  Each photo will be edited and color balanced.  All print will be inserted into a 6-panel CD insert for a CD jewel case.

3). 1000 CD: Replication of songs will be put on a CD, wrapped and shipped.  

4)  LYRIC/Youtube Videos for Eight Songs

All funds go  into the CD making even if the entire goal is not reached. Any funds above the initial  goal to make the album  and Lyric videos will go into PHASE TWO towards the making of T.V. music videos. 

        

A Gift of Thanks

This Indiegogo campaign is a crucial step to finally make this album a reality.  If you have friends in your network, please tell them about this campaign and share to your social media preferences. I can’t wait to get started on this project and I am confident with your help, I will be able to introduce my music to people that listen from the heart and as a result are moved in some way. 

Thank you for your contribution,  

Alice Darling

story:
Short Summary

 Hey There, Remember us?
No?  You may have helped us fund our first album "The Crooked Road."
It was such a great experience the first time - really - you all humbled us by digging deep and helping us make a dream come true. We want to do it again, but like anything one does, it's not worth it if you don't do it better or take it to the next level. That being said, we want to make an even better album than our first go. 
"The Breakup" is our new journey. Over the past two years we've had lots of new life experiences and this is a new phase for us.  This album is really about love, life, and new beginnings.  Sometimes something has to end for something new to begin. 
We have already headed to the studio to start recording this new collection of 10 songs, but we need your help to finish the recordings, press them, and market them. 

What We Need & What You Get

 We are trying to raise $13,000 for this new album. Why 13K you ask?  Music like anything is a process that takes time, investment, and promotion.  We want to use the money to finish the studio time of course, but that's just a small part of the process.  After that, we want to get this album physically distributed in the form of CD's and Vinyl, as well as digitally - iTunes, Spotify, and Pandora.  We'll also be trying to get this album some serious play and promotion including trying to get songs synced to film.  We've got loads of sweet perks that we are looking forward to sharing with you as well.

The Impact

Music production, recording costs, distribution and promotion can all be pretty expensive and we are being very careful in how we spend every penny in making this album.  We also want to make a great product and our ultimate goal is to further our careers. As we said above, we are making a full album that we intend to license for TV and film. We've come a long way in two years and it's time to take the next step.

  • Supporting this projects means you support local Bay Area Music.
  • We fully funded our last album "The Crooked Road" and we are confident that we will be able to make an even better follow up album.
  • Every dollar you give to this project goes directly toward costs for  recording, physical/digital distribution, Marketing/PR

Risks & Challenges

 Any project like this has inherent risks and challenges.  This go-round we are aiming for a bigger outcome and that requires a bigger budget.  It's possible that we could not make our goal.  But we can guarantee that this album will get made.  We've already laid down two tracks and are looking to finish the rest in the following months.

We are really trying to make career as a band; being independent is difficult but doable.  We were so elated that you helped us all make our first record we wanted to ask you to join in with us this second time around.  We want this record to stand out and be heard by more ears than we can imagine and making the best possible record, with the best possible songs is the first step.  We are approaching this project with blood, sweat, and tears and no lack of humility.  We need your help and we are confident we are making something special.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes it's hard financially to support such a big project but there are so many ways to help!  You could join our Indiegogo team and help share this campaign,  You could also share this with every person you have an email for.  You can share it on your Facebook or your twitter- let's not forget Instagram.  Help us spread the word - We will be forever grateful.

And that's all there is to it. Let's do this!

story:
Esther Kang EP - New Music!

  • Carrie Akre, lead singer of the bands Hammerbox, Goodness and The Rockfords, started the band with her brother Eric Akre (Treepeople, Citizens Utilities, Built to Spill, Diddly Squat), alongside Daniel G. Harmann (solo artist, and songwriter from the Trouble Starts), and Martin Lund as a side project when she missed being in a band.
  • Music heals and fills our souls and it's time to rock out!
  • We want to share our music and commune with our fans. We have great gifts to share. Music being only one of the gifts that will be available.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Breakin it down into details:

  • We are in need of $3500 to cover our recording costs and mixing of a new EP (5 songs).
  • We will share music, send posters, get you on guest lists, put your name on the EP and come play at your home!
  • If we don't make the whole goal we will still use any funds donated to help pay for recording and keep on trucking to get you the music!

The Impact

The difference you as a fan will make:

  • Collectively this bands members have been in the NW scene for over 25 years and we have strong ties to all the fans. We have new moments in our lives that we will share through music. It's all about communing and bring some happiness your way!
  • Carrie's previous efforts have brought huge support and healed her heart all over.
  • We want to do this with fans and we want to give you music to enjoy!

Risks & Challenges

Here are the risks and our solutions:

  • We all have ways to make this happen and we will persevere to get this music out! 
  • If it takes longer to record we will set up more time. We will give ourselves the time to make the money to pay for it even on our own.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ways you can contribute, other than with moola:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
IVA is a crossover project that I started in 2004 after I’d been cast to sing on Late Night with Conan O’Brien. At the time I was studying classical voice at Juilliard, but wanted to say even more as an artist. I created the name IVA to represent a woman living at her full potential who inspires others to do the same. I began to explore all aspects of my voice to express myself and my music.

IVA has been evolving for twelve years now. Six of those I spent in Sweden, where I was a pop star on national radio and television while singing at the Royal Opera of Stockholm. I was in Billboard magazine and on the front page of magazines and newspapers in Sweden. But financial woes at the Royal Opera prompted me to return to the U.S. to continue to develop my sound, this time with a band. 

I have faced many challenges as an artist, both financial and mental when setbacks have shaken my confidence. Despite adversity, this past year I’ve made some important breakthroughs. I released my third album, “Leap”, to my first U.S. radio play on NPR and tastemaker stations. The Vasa Order of Sweden also recognized me with an award for my unique contributions to culture as a classical and popular artist. The Swedish-American of the Year award has gone to Ann Margaret, Buzz Aldrin, Chief Justice Rehnquist and this year to Nils Lofgren of Bruce Springsteen’s E-street band. It was a true lift to my career at a challenging time in my personal life.

Creativity has always come with an investment of heart and soul, but the financial returns have not been so easy. The market for music has changed a great deal, and illegal downloading has made it difficult to make money from recordings. Many record labels have shut down, or taken on less projects. Crowdfunding has made it possible for independent artists to turn to their own fan base for support, and listeners can be valuable contributors to the creative process. 

My last album was funded by a successful Kickstarter campaign, when we raised $15,000, 150% of our goal. The support was overwhelming, a huge lift knowing I had so many people behind me. Your contribution for this new album will make it possible for us to record and promote our album with some of the best people working in the music industry, building upon our work from the last album. You will also help touch the hearts of the people who hear IVA, and help that feeling reach many more listeners. 

THE TEAM

This year I’ve had the opportunity to work with two pivotal musicians at the top of their game - Jaron Olevsky and Trey Pollard. The sound they gave my songs motivated me to start this album project. Jaron Olevsky and I were introduced at Philly’s Milkboy studios and Jaron helped me with my piano arrangements until he demoed one of my new songs in his new home studio. The sound was incredible and we decided to do more. 

Meanwhile I had gone to the World Cafe Live to see Natalie Prass perform. I fell in love with her record after a voice student of mine played it for me. Trey Pollard, who’s gorgeous arrangements frame her songs, was playing guitar and we spoke after the concert. I sent him a few of my new songs and we agreed to work on them together. Dream come true here!

Here are Jaron and Trey’s bios so you can get to know them better:

  • Jaron Olevsky is a multi-instrumentalist and producer in Philadelphia. He’s played in Bluenote and Republic Records artist Amos Lee’s band for over a decade as bass player and now as keyboardist and Music Director. They have toured with Norah Jones, Bob Dylan, Elvis Costello, Paul Simon, Merle Haggard, Van Morrison, John Prine, Dave Matthews Band, Adele, the Zac Brown Band, Jack Johnson, The Avett Brothers, and David Gray. I just heard his music direction live at Amos’s most show and it is just perfect. We’ll be recording in his home studio and at gorgeous new studio Rittenhouse Soundworks in Germantown, PA. 
  • Trey Pollard is a guitarist, arranger, producer and pedal-steelest and will write the arrangements for the new songs. He co-produced and arranged Natalie Prass’s breakthrough album, released last summer, which was recognized at one of the Best New Albums by music review website Pitchfork. It was his arrangements on this album that truly blew my mind, and I am so thrilled that he will work on my songs for this album. I’ll be driving down to Spacebomb studios in Richmond, Virginia, be there for the recording of the arrangements with Trey and their crew of musicians.

And, of course, my amazing band will be a part of the album. Sam Nobles will play bass, Matt Scarano will play drums, and Nate Gonzalez will add guitar. In addition Jim Hamilton, who built the gorgeous Rittenhouse Soundworks studio, will play percussion on the album. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

I started this project with a small grant from the Delaware Division of the Arts ($750). It was nice to have this bonafides as a starting off point. Here is a breakdown of our remaining costs. Funding is needed both to make recording as well to promoting the album so it can be heard on radio and reviewed in the press.

RECORDING COSTS

  • Production fees for arrangements and editing $4,000
  • Musician fees for band and arrangements $3,325
  • Rittenhouse Soundworks studio fees $3000 ($750 per day x 4 days) 
  • Travel to Spacebomb in Richmond $80 gas (staying with friends)
  • Mixing $2000
  • Mastering $1000
  • Total recording budget $13,405

PROMOTION

  • Marketing and promotion coordination $2500
  • Radio promotion $2500
  • Press promotion $2500
  • Social media promotion $1200
  • Promotion total $8,700

TOTAL COSTS $22,105

Should we not reach our total goal, we will put the money that we have towards the costs that we can cover, starting with recording costs. 

PERKS

  • $15 will give you exclusive video of our recording process
  • $25 will give you downloadable mp3s of the EP and access to exclusive video footage
  • $50 will give you a signed EP sent to you in the mail anywhere in the world, downloadable mp3s and access to exclusive video footage
  • $100 will give you a signed EP and a ticket to the release concert, downloadable mp3s and access to exclusive video footage
  • $250 will provide 3 donors with songwriting guidance on a song and/or lyrics they have written, as well as an EP, mp3s and access to exclusive video footage
  • $300 will give 3 donors a song written by IVA for you, a friend, or a special occasion, as well as an EP, mp3s and access to exclusive video footage
  • $500 will give you 3 private voice lessons with IVA, a signed EP, mp3s and video footage
  • $2,000 will give 3 donors a house concert with IVA either solo or with her band, a signed EP, mp3s and video footage

THE IMPACT

This journey has been a beautiful, ongoing epic with many twists and turns. Your support will helps me to continue to break through with the incredible team on this album in the United States and abroad. 

So many friends and fans have told me how much my music means to them. Because of their love, I know that I am reaching and inspiring people doing what I feel I am meant to do. That inspiration and understanding is what you will help to continue with your donation. 

Every album that I have made has been a stepping stone, bringing IVA to a wider audience and evolving my sound. My first album launched my career in Europe as a popular singer. The second album brought me to national press, radio and TV in Sweden, the Royal Opera in Stockholm, and Billboard magazine. Now my third album has brought IVA to NPR and tastemaker radio stations around the United States.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The music industry today is a jungle. There is an incredible amount of excellent music out there, and with record sales declining and the low royalties paid by streaming services, we independent musicians really do need the help of our friends and fans to make our recordings possible. The financial risks are particularly daunting and have cause me many woes during my starving artist building years. With your donation and our good music and planning I feel that we will do even better with this album than we did on the last, using our resources to reach a larger audience. 

SHARING

Please share my campaign on your Facebook page and with your friends. IVA is meant to inspire everyone to be who they truly are, and we would like to have you all in the recording studio with us in spirit and support.

IVA-The Fourth Album is supported, in part, by a grant from the Delaware Division of the Arts, a state agency, in partnership with the National Endowment for the Arts.
