story:
"Fervent and heartfelt" ~The New York Times

"Revolution Now" . . . Right Now

If there was ever a time for a powerful, loving transformative revolution, that time is now--and this is the music to fuel it!

We are grassroots, activist musicians and our songs have been used as tools in movements for social justice around the world for years, keeping people inspired & energized in the work for a world we want to live in. Leading up to the 2016 election, we felt it was crucial to get this CD out as soon as possible. And now with the election results, what we hear from our audiences is that the need is even more immediate. 

"Revolution Now" will be officially released in 2017. This is a special pre-release run to get the CD out in time for your holiday gift-giving.

"Revolution Now" is our fourth crowd-sourced CD and our first on a public site like Indiegogo (we did the other three through our website). We know the power of community and we call it Community Supported Culture, because we couldn't do it without you! Covering issues from killer drones to wind energy, from the Black Lives Matter movement to the sustaining power of love, the songs on "Revolution Now" span folk to jazz to funk and will keep you going through this unimaginable-Inauguration-to-come and beyond. Take a listen and help support us in getting these songs out. As our friend Pete Seeger inspired us to sing, "Hope changes everything!"

Funds . . .

We had started this project back in June when, seemingly out of the blue, Sandy had a heart attack (!). Thankfully, with the help of friends, family, committed healthcare providers and support from so many of you, she healed well. We found out, a few months after, that she had had the kind of heart attack that happens to otherwise healthy women because of intense stress. We are creating a new way forward that allows us to continue to do this work--with a focus on less stress and a more mindful pace. We finished out a lighter touring season and, in the time we would usually have been booking gigs and touring, we were able to get back to work on the CD so we could get it to you in time for the holidays. We borrowed the money to do the project and here's the breakdown of how your contribution supports this project:

Performers 20%

Recording 15%

Mixing 15%

Mastering 6%

Travel 5%

Photos, Video, CD Design 16%

Manufacturing 8%

Fulfillment 8%

Payment Processing (credit cards, paypal) 4%

Crowd-funding Fees 3%

Any funding beyond our goal will go towards promotion for the CD and to other projects we've had on the back burner, like our songbook with stories about the songs, live concert DVD, song videos, sustainable touring RV, to name a few. Thank you!

 .  . . and Fun

We have lots of great perks to gift you with for your support of "Revolution Now." Choose a download version of the CD or a signed copy, mailed to you or a loved one. Plus you can get a range of goodies: enjoy a box of our delicious Sweet Revolution Homemade Toffee with Organic & Fair- Trade Ingredients, or an audio track of Pat's laughter that'll get you through the Inauguration; choose the "In-House Revolution" of a concert in your home or "With the Band!" to gift your community or favorite cause with a public concert with us accompanied by three fabulous players: a lead player on keys, electric guitar or fiddle, plus bass and drums. Get two free tickets to a show of our choice and add on our beautiful silver "Salaam Shalom Peace" pendant or have us bring a mini-concert to you with a Skype (or other tech) serenade of two songs of your choice from "Revolution Now".

What does it mean to be activist musicians?

Our music is deeply focused on issues of peace and justice and we use our music, our time and our actions to support movements for justice in our communities here in the US and around the world. We’ve toured all over the country and beyond. Our songs have been sung everywhere from Korea to India to Palestine. We have shared the stage with Pete Seeger, Bernice Johnson Reagon, Jesse Jackson, Holly Near, The Indigo Girls, Sister Helen Prejean, Medea Benjamin and many more activists and activist musicians. We have performed for audiences of intimate concerts to mass demonstrations of half a million people. Your support of us and our music will help support all of those working for justice who are reached by our music!

Being activist musicians also means that we are completely grassroots funded. We perform wherever communities are working on peace and justice and our music is played on community radio. We fly under the radar of commercial venues, commercial radio and the recording industry. But we fly nonetheless, thanks to you!

Be a Revolutionary

All too often, we hear musicians interviewed in the media being asked about why we don't hear more songs about social justice. People, here and abroad, don't know that progressive songwriters like us exist. This music is certainly being written, it's simply ignored--or suppressed--both by the heavily-consolidated corporate media and even the progressive and alternative media outlets who often report solely on the few musicians who already get larger media coverage.

That's where you come in. 

We invite you--and rely on you--to share this page, our website and our work widely:

- Share with your Facebook friends & Twitter followers (click on the "share" links on the upper left of this page). 

-Send an email directly to people who care about music and justice!

Thank you!

We love the work we do and we're honored to do that work with you and with your support. Your support and your presence at our concerts and at demostrations means so much to us! Your financial investment helps our work reach well beyond the communities that can come see us in concert. We are grateful for you, our amazing, loving, generous audiences and supporters.

Peace, love and health,
Pat Humphries & Sandy O 
Emma's Revolution

 

Photo Credits:
Cover & laughing photos: Irene Young
Live performance photo: Robert Yahn

story:
This photo was taken at the first venue I attended open mic nights - The Hard Rock Cafe, Sydney in 2014.

Who Am I?

Hi,

My name is Nina. I'm 21 and I'm from the Gold Coast, Australia. I moved here a bit over two years ago from Sydney after leaving uni and found music. Ever since I've been writing and playing wherever I could get the opportunity. I've played countless open mic night's, paid gigs and even have performed at weddings. It has never been so clear that all I want to do is music, however it hasn't always been that way.

When I was younger I actually wanted to be a Latin & Ballroom dancer. I danced for seven years, even won medals but when a singing teacher started teaching at my high school and my friend suggested I take lessons I was curious. That's when I got the bug. My parent's couldn't afford to have me do both and without blinking I said I'd quit dancing. I took singing lessons from then on and dabbled in piano but found my passion with the guitar. I loved the variety of expression.

Songwriting wasn't something that came easily to me. I could come up with a tune almost instantly but I felt stuck for words. I started out when I was 15 trying to write out lines that rhymed with each other to form the structure of a song which could take me days and the story wouldn't be real. It's amazing to look back as now I'll be driving to work and a whole song will come to me instantaneously.  I hear so often from people that listen to my performances, "that song should be on the radio", and they have no idea how much I want to make this happen.

I have songs in a folder that I wrote from way back when I was 15 but with time my writing has changed and I have five songs I'm dying to get out into the world to perform and sell. Realistically after performing for over three years the next step is to record and release music.

Without releasing something I will stay at a stand still and I can't let that happen. I can't work in an office job the rest of my life and not have given my best shot at trying to make it in something that would give me immense joy to wake up and do everyday.

With this help I will be able to record the EP and get the kick start I need to put it out there. This would be creating the first step but the most important. THE MUSIC. If you know are a musician or understand the process you know that this is the most integral part of what makes an artist. Your help is going to start the biggest change in my life.

The Funding

I'm attempting to fund just the recording of the EP itself which is $5000, for those of you musos reading this includes mixing and mastering so it's a great deal. I have gotten many quotes from different recording studios around the same price but I'd really like to work with a producer by the same of Sean Carey from Thirsty Merc. He has done some amazing work not only in the band but with many awesome releases for other artists.

This is the major start guys. I am going to be playing as many gigs as I can, working as many hours as possible to fund the rest of this release. Once it's recorded the ball will be rolling and I can start setting dates for release.

What You'll Get

Not only will you be making this EP with me but you'll be pre-purchasing a signed copy. There will also be posters and an option of house concerts for those who live in Byron Bay, Gold Coast and Brisbane.

If I don't get the target amount I am putting the full amount towards recording this EP. It is just going to take me longer to raise the rest of the funds myself.

The Challenge

The main challenge with this is securing a date to say I'm recording this. I can't secure anything until I have the funds so unfortunately it's all riding on finances. I've said that this is the year I make a change and make progress. This is the first step but even without it I will make this happen whether it takes me longer or not.

The Impact

You have no idea how much of a difference this would make for me to be able to record this. I've been sitting on the sidelines with every other singer who wants to make it but doesn't know how.
It's hard to put into words the agony I have to become a successful recording artist but I believe in dreaming big. I've auditioned for countless talent shows and been rejected, had many opportunities that have fallen through but this is something I can make happen with your help.

I will love you for making a donation no matter how small but I will also love you if you share this around. That's what will help guarantee success. Please share it on the social media webs and with anyone who you think will connect with my story.

If you've read this far, thank you.
Thank you for taking the time out of your day to get to know me and my story.

I'll finish with a quote:

"Do it now. Sometimes later becomes never."

Love,
Nina x

I have songs in a folder that I wrote from way back when I was 15 but with time my writing has changed and I have five songs I'm dying to get out into the world to perform and sell. Realistically after performing for over three years the next step is to record and release music.
Without releasing something I will stay at a stand still and I can't let that happen. I can't work in an office job the rest of my life and not have given my best shot at trying to make it in something that would give me immense joy to wake up and do everyday.
With this help I will be able to record the EP and get the kick start I need to put it out there. This would be creating the first step but the most important. THE MUSIC. If you know are a musician or understand the process you know that this is the most integral part of what makes an artist. Your help is going to start the biggest change in my life.


The Funding
I'm attempting to fund just the recording of the EP itself which is $5000, for those of you musos reading this includes mixing and mastering so it's a great deal. I have gotten many quotes from different recording studios around the same price but I'd really like to work with a producer by the same of Sean Carey from Thirsty Merc. He has done some amazing work not only in the band but with many awesome releases for other artists.
This is the major start guys. I am going to be playing as many gigs as I can, working as many hours as possible to fund the rest of this release. Once it's recorded the ball will be rolling and I can start setting dates for release.
What You'll Get
Not only will you be making this EP with me but you'll be pre-purchasing a signed copy. There will also be posters and an option of house concerts for those who live in Byron Bay, Gold Coast and Brisbane.
If I don't get the target amount I am putting the full amount towards recording this EP. It is just going to take me longer to raise the rest of the funds myself.
The Challenge
The main challenge with this is securing a date to say I'm recording this. I can't secure anything until I have the funds so unfortunately it's all riding on finances. I've said that this is the year I make a change and make progress. This is the first step but even without it I will make this happen whether it takes me longer or not.

The Impact
You have no idea how much of a difference this would make for me to be able to record this. I've been sitting on the sidelines with every other singer who wants to make it but doesn't know how.It's hard to put into words the agony I have to become a successful recording artist but I believe in dreaming big. I've auditioned for countless talent shows and been rejected, had many opportunities that have fallen through but this is something I can make happen with your help.
I will love you for making a donation no matter how small but I will also love you if you share this around. That's what will help guarantee success. Please share it on the social media webs and with anyone who you think will connect with my story.
If you've read this far, thank you.Thank you for taking the time out of your day to get to know me and my story.
I'll finish with a quote:
"Do it now. Sometimes later becomes never."
Love,Nina x

story:
Eli Raybon and director Markus Thorington team up once again to work on a new video for the song "Thirty Cents". After the successful release of "Unsymmetrical," which premiered on buzzbands.la and was featured as an official selection at the Universe Multicultural Film Festival, they decided to pursue something more ambitious...

The video will place Eli in the world of top secret espionage as he is caught in the crossfires of a Femme Fetal and FBI agents in hot pursuit. Danger! Excitement! And lot's of fun, iconic imagery from classic spy movies. It will play out entirely in reverse, which will create a very interesting dynamic! From the beginning, you know the end ;)

"Thirty Cents" will be the final single before Eli's EP "Green" releases in June.

story:
Our Master Project

Out of the turmoil that followed the 2011 earthquake and tsunami, our band distilled a new style of Japanese art to bring to the world, which it termed ‘chaos’, or KAO=S. Our sound is a blend of vocals (Kaori Kawabuchi) and acoustic guitar (Shuji Yamagiri) overlaid with traditional Japanese instruments such as the three-string Tsugaru shamisen (Jack) using a full range of effects. Complemented by a spellbindingly powerful sword dance, we have quickly caught people’s attention.

With our Master Project crowdfunding campaign, we want to produce a six track album and accompanying music video to be released by December 31st, 2017. We've decided to turn to crowdfunding, because we want to produce a truly master class album - but producing a high quality album is expensive. These days it has become easier and easier to produce music cheaply and easily. But we plan to work with some of the best musicians and artists for our masterpiece, an album that will be legendary in quality.
 
KAO=S has been lucky enough to visit many countries around the world to perform. We have been influenced by the folk and traditional music of everywhere we have traveled to. Drawing on these wonderful influences, we want to make an album that shows off the traditional instruments and music of the world by combining it with our unique Japanese art rock sound.
 
If our crowdfunding campaign is successful, we'll produce one of the highest quality, most unique and interesting albums to come out of modern Japan. We hope you are looking forward to listening to our Master Project. We hope to do a world tour with our album once it is finished, so with your help we'd love to perform it live for you, in your own country!
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $16,000 US Dollars for our Indiegogo campaign to be successful. We are running another Japan-only crowdfunding campaign on Motion Gallery for the same amount. This will cover:

  • Musician performance, studio and staff fees ($11,000)
  • Mastering ($2,000)
  • Music video production ($3,000)

We have four perk levels of funding in our campaign, and everyone who contributes to the album, no matter the amount, will have their name listed on our band website with a thank you*. Our perk levels are:

$5: Three digital tracks (in full definition WAV and MP3 format) from the album, almost 50% less than our release retail price!

$30: The full album (in full definition WAV and MP3 format), which will be provided to contributors a week before the commercial release. Be the first to hear the new album! You will also receive special unreleased footage of KAO=S's live shows.

$100: The $30 reward of the full album in advance, along with special unreleased footage of our sword and shamisen performance, and a limited edition digital photo album created by the band's official photographer, that will only ever be available to our $100 contributors.

$250: The $30 and $100 rewards, and our $250 contributors will have their names written calligraphically on Kaori's back and receive a personalised photograph of it!

New! (July 27, 2017)

Bonus Track: Our campaign reached over 85% of our goal. Thank you for supporting us. We would like to thank all of our contributors, so we have added a new reward - a bonus track called "Koujou no Tsuki". It is a Japanese traditional song and KAO=S recorded it in Spain in April of this year. It's an unreleased special version.

Everyone who contributes at least $30 USD for the Early Access Pack will receive the bonus track. It is also included in the $100 USD Exclusive Photo & Video Pack and $250 USD Ultimate Fan Packs. Everyone who has already contributed at least $30 USD will also receive the bonus track. The song file will be sent along with the other contribution rewards.

*We are happy to list either your real name or your Indiegogo account name. If you would prefer to keep your contribution private, please let us know and we will omit your name from the thank you list.

**We are happy to use either your real name, or your Indiegogo account name. Unfortunately, we aren't able to use names which include vulgarity, but we are happy to discuss further. Thank you very much for your kind understanding.

Experience & Talent

This will be the fourth album our band has produced, and with our long experience in the indie music industry and proven track record of releasing successful albums, we have every confidence this fourth album will be a huge hit - with your help! We will also be working with a number of top-class guest musicians who will bring incredible skills and professionalism to the project.

The band's core members include:


Kaori Kawabuchi
Kaori is the lead vocal of KAO=S. Kaori is also a Japanese sword master, and is also known as "Lady Samurai". Her intense performance is a synthesis of dance and swordplay. Not limited to KAO=S, Kaori is a part of many projects. Kaori has appeared on stage in various plays, and in many films in Japan. She is currently scheduled to travel to Hollywood for filming. As a motion capture performer, Kaori has participated in many famous movies and video games including the Final Fantasy video game series, and NieR:Automata (2B and A2) . In 2013 & 2014, Kaori also held Samurai performance workshops in Germany. Her workshops were officially recognised as benefiting international cultural exchange.


Shuji Yamagiri
Shuji is the guitarist, main songwriter, and the leader of KAO=S. Not only a chorus member, Shuji does both main vocals and chorus thanks to his wide vocal range. He can sing of Japanese folk, rock and pops. He conceptualised the story of KAO=S’s promotional Manga, which has been downloaded over 10,000 times.

Jack
Jack plays the Tsugaru Shamisen, a classical Japanese instrument. He skillfully makes use of sound effects and draws forth the many sounds of the Shamisen. Jack has also invented a new instrument known as the Yomisen, a four-stringed Shamisen. In 2014, Jack entered the World Tsugaru Shamisen Championships where he received a silver medal in the category of improvisational play.

 


Guest musicians include Japanese drummer Wataru Kamiryo from NeoBallad, Erhu player Shin from China, Morin khuur player Senjiya from Mongol, Tabla player Tansen Shrivastava from India, and more! Many musicians will contribute to our new album.

We will also be working with some fantastic artists. Our music producer, Kenji Nakai, has worked with Red Hot Chili Peppers. Our photographer, Mikio Ariga, is the official photographer of The Rolling Stones. Our music video director, Tomoo Noda, has done videos for GACKT. They are all contributing to our new album and will guarantee that it's our best yet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute directly to our campaign, we would be so grateful if you could let your friends and family know about us by Twitter, Facebook and share our YouTube videos! KAO=S's hashtag is #kaos_japan

When you help me in Japanese, please look at the Motion Gallery website.
日本語での支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します
3人のトップクリエイター達とコラボ！海外も注目のバンドKAO=Sの世界照準アルバム＆MV制作プロジェクト！

story:
Short Summary

 

  • Opus 5 is composed of musicians from the Philadelphia area. Each member has studied music at a collegiate level and some are obtaining advanced degrees. Our founder, Jeremy Gaddy, has a vision to create a musical group that performs to the highest standard and produces a sound that is unique to Philadelphia and a reflection of each member of the quintet. 
  • Our members: Will Gregory, trumpet; Tessa Ellis, Trumpet; Bryn Coveney, Horn; Matt Gatti, Tuba. 
  • All of Opus 5's members are at the start of their careers. This campaign is important as it will help to pave the way to professional playing for the current members as well as for other skilled musicians in the future.
  • Your contribution will help our dream become a reality. It will allow us to share the love and dedication each of us has for our instrument and for this ensemble. By commissioning local composers, we will help to enrich our own musical community, as well as add valuable new pieces to the brass quintet repertoire.

 

What the funding covers. 

  • The funding will be be used to pay for the following: 
  • $2000 to pay for coachings with members of the Philadelphia Orchestra
  • $800 to pay for our piece that is being written by local Philadelphia Composer Alex Kruchoski
  • $1500 to pay for our recording space and sound engineer.
  • $200 for the sheet music
  • $1500 for creating albums and merchandise to give to our backers. 
  • $500 to cover the cost of rehearsals and the rehearsal space. 

 

  • Our project will allow a group of talented musicians to be heard and the beauty of their gift to be shared. 
  • This campaign brings 5 individual's dreams one step closer to reality. 

Risks & Challenges

  • It is always a challenge for independent musicians to successfully advertise themselves in their community. We hope that this campaign and our dedication to excellence with help us overcome this obstacle.
  • Each of us have had a chance to network with some of the finest musicians in the world. This gives us a valuable resource that can help us refine our musicianship and market our sound. We also have the benefit of our experiences outside of the music world to help us establish ourselves in the Philadelphia area - and beyond!

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for taking the time to read our campaign and watch our video. Please share our campaign and our Facebook page and help us reach a wider audience! 

 

"Help other achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours."

-Les Brown

story:
Short Summary

For those of you who don't know me, I grew up in a small town in northern Minnesota (yes I talk like Fargo). I started a dairy operation with my brothers when I  was 16 and sold it when the market collapsed in 2010...crazy I know, I'll tell you more in person. I was an Air Traffic Controller in Alaska (I know another crazy story)...But ultimately in 2015 I moved to Nashville to pursue my real passion of country music. Since moving here I've been able to write with some truly great writers and I'm finally ready to put out an album!! Funding it is the only thing holding me back!

What We Need & What You Get

What does the money go to?

At least 6 fully produced tracks, paying the musicians, paying the producers/engineers, paying for studio time, costs associated with printing the actual CDs and tip reward fulfillments, and hopefully a small cushion extra for any unexpected costs (i.e.  Mastering etc)

What do you get:

New music! Merch! (T-shirts, Hats, Sweatshirts), liner note THANK YOU, and a tractor ride/meet and greet/writers round with my friends who wrote the EP with me! 

What happens if we don't reach our goal:

I'm making this album happen no matter what!!  If I make less than the goal, I can reassess what needs to be done to fit into the financial constraints, but hitting the goal would be really helpful!

The Impact

Getting this album funded will have a huge impact on not just ya'll getting new music...but starting the ball rolling for me in the music world. It will lead to many open doors here in Nashville in the industry but also touring and the chance to meet so many of you that have supported me so far...I can't wait!

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE SHARE SHARE! If you can't contribute...sharing my campaign would mean the world to me.

story:
About the songs for the CD, "Twist Run Road"

About the songs for the CD, "Twist Run Road"
Twist Run Road is the name of the street I grew up on, in the countryside outside of the small town of Endicott, in upstate New York. Although my experience growing up there was very difficult, my memories of "Twist Run Road" center on the beauty, the innocence, the tiny moments of joy that do exist in my memories of that place:

Catching fireflies on a warm, August night. Playing in the fields of milkweed, releasing their feathery seeds "like snow, falling from a summer sky." The title song tells the story of "the house across the street from us on Twist Run Road," where I was welcomed and loved by the family that lived there. 

These songs are ultimately about Love. Not romantic love, really, although there are a few lyrics along those lines. The Love that comes from true Forgiveness. The Love that Hope is made of. The Love that conquers Fear. And ultimately, the Love that heals all of us by creating connection, understanding and empathy toward each other.

Many of these songs came to me while sleeping...in my dreams, the music and / or the lyrics would form fully realized. All I had to do was remember them. Other times, the songs would come as snippets of memories accompanied by music. Very rarely do I ever sit down to "write a song." 

Because of the way in which I have been give these songs, they feel like gifts that must be passed on, shared with anyone and everyone who cares to hear them.

And that is why I am embarking on this campaign to raise the funds to complete this recording project.

Why Am I Asking You to Join Me in This Campaign?

My goal is simple: to release these songs out into the world; to share peaceful, loving music and stories that touch the heart.

The time is now, more than ever, to create and share Music and Art that connects us with each other. With your contribution to this project, you'll be a part of something positive...bringing even more beautiful Music into the world! Let's do this together!

I hope you will join me, because the truth is: it takes more than one person to share...I can't do it without You!

It is an honor and a privilege to be a Musician, to have the opportunity to connect with you, and I greatly appreciate every single contribution, no matter what size or form it takes. Thank you so much!

About the CD Project "Twist Run Road," the Musicians and the Recording:


Musicians/Instrumentation:  Jasnam Daya Singh and John R. Burr on piano; guitarists Randy Vincent and Dave MacNab (and other amazing guitarists I plan to invite); Alan Hall on drums, Tom Martin on bass; and other great musicians (percussion, string quartet, cello, harp, accordion, harmonica).
Will be Recorded and Mixed at: The renowned Prairie Sun Recording Studios in Cotati, CA
Will be Mastered by: Tim Gennert (multi-Grammy winner). 

I have been working on this record for almost four years now, and enjoy the support of so many wonderful musicians, artists, industry professionals, family and friends. We are ready to get into the studio now!

What the funds will pay for:

  • My musical family, the talented musicians I have had the honor and privilege to work with for decades:  Jasnam Daya Singh; John R. Burr, Randy Vincent, Dave MacNab, Alan Hall, Tom Martin, Gerry Grosz and other guest artists who will be on the recording. 
     
  • The arrangements include a string quartet, cello solos, an orchestral harp, harmonica accordion, and a horn section! I'd like as many musical colors as possible to paint these song-stories! 
     
  • Studio Costs: Recording engineer, daily studio fees, mixing, and mastering all make up a major expense for the project. Award-winning Prairie Sun Studios recorded the demos you hear on this page, and I will be recording the full CD there.
     
  • Manufacturing of physical CDs and digital distribution.
     
  • Marketing Costs:  Marketing and promotion of the album, costs involved for website, promo mailings, digital ads, SEO and other digital marketing costs.

Risks & Challenges? Bring 'Em On!

  • I've recorded three CDs in ten years, while a self-employed, single mother. If I can do that, I can do anything! There is no risk in contributing to my project, and there are really no obstacles that have ever prevented me from attaining my goals in Music. Every penny of the donations to this project will go toward the musicians, engineers and professionals who know how to bring this project to a successful and beautiful completion. I can't wait to share it with you!! 
 

These Songs That Come to Me in Dreams....

For as long as I can remember, music has been 'playing in my head' day and night. Underlying every moment of my life, the undercurrent of music has always been there. And so, it has never seemed unusual for me to dream a song.  It was something I took for granted! Many times over the years, I have had very vivid dreams – complete with song melodies and lyrics – that would come to me while I slept, and stay with me for days. In the dreams, I open my mouth to speak, but instead of a speaking voice, I sing the words...I am dreaming in song.

Many times during a dream/song, a separate part of my mind, the observer of this dream, will comment: "Oh my gosh, this is beautiful....I need to remember this!"  I wake up and write or record as much as I can remember.

These are not overtly spiritual songs or religious songs, but they do come from Spirit. They are simple songs that tell a story or paint a picture from the past. Underlying the stories are images of the moon and stars; they evoke water or the wind. They are beautiful dreams songs that are open and spacious, allowing you the room in your mind and heart to go wherever your Spirit takes you as you listen.

The Soul within each of us does speak to us in our dreams. But we do not always recognize the voice of our own Soul. It is only recently that I realized the music of my dreams is actually my own Higher Voice that has been trying to reach me, through songs, for my entire life. Now I know that this lovely music and loving lyrics were being dropped into my dreams like beautiful, shining Gifts.  I finally got the message: 'Wake UP, Elaine!! You're supposed to SHARE these songs!!"

 

    Thank you for visiting this campaign page

    My campaign goal is stated as $10,000. But if 300 people contribute $100 each, I can raise my overall goal of $30,000 and hire every single musician, artist and professional on my complete list. The wonderful arrangements by Jasnam Daya Singh include string quartet and other instruments, and I want the instrumentation to include all of the parts he has written. I'm going for it...!!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can further help by sharing this campaign with your family and friends:

    • Please COPY & SHARE THIS LINK to your friends, family, etc:

      https://igg.me/at/ElaineLucia/x/16451840
       
    • AND:  See the Social Media Buttons at the top of this page, right side?...PLEASE SHARE to your Facebook, Twitter, Email, Etc.!!  Thank you so much!!

    I thank you with all my Heart for visiting this page, listening to my songs, and contributing to my CD project, Twist Run Road. 

    Love and Peace Thru Music,

    Elaine
story_txt:
About the songs for the CD, "Twist Run Road"
About the songs for the CD, "Twist Run Road"Twist Run Road is the name of the street I grew up on, in the countryside outside of the small town of Endicott, in upstate New York. Although my experience growing up there was very difficult, my memories of "Twist Run Road" center on the beauty, the innocence, the tiny moments of joy that do exist in my memories of that place:
Catching fireflies on a warm, August night. Playing in the fields of milkweed, releasing their feathery seeds "like snow, falling from a summer sky." The title song tells the story of "the house across the street from us on Twist Run Road," where I was welcomed and loved by the family that lived there. 
These songs are ultimately about Love. Not romantic love, really, although there are a few lyrics along those lines. The Love that comes from true Forgiveness. The Love that Hope is made of. The Love that conquers Fear. And ultimately, the Love that heals all of us by creating connection, understanding and empathy toward each other.
Many of these songs came to me while sleeping...in my dreams, the music and / or the lyrics would form fully realized. All I had to do was remember them. Other times, the songs would come as snippets of memories accompanied by music. Very rarely do I ever sit down to "write a song." 
Because of the way in which I have been give these songs, they feel like gifts that must be passed on, shared with anyone and everyone who cares to hear them.
And that is why I am embarking on this campaign to raise the funds to complete this recording project.
Why Am I Asking You to Join Me in This Campaign?
My goal is simple: to release these songs out into the world; to share peaceful, loving music and stories that touch the heart.
The time is now, more than ever, to create and share Music and Art that connects us with each other. With your contribution to this project, you'll be a part of something positive...bringing even more beautiful Music into the world! Let's do this together!
I hope you will join me, because the truth is: it takes more than one person to share...I can't do it without You!
It is an honor and a privilege to be a Musician, to have the opportunity to connect with you, and I greatly appreciate every single contribution, no matter what size or form it takes. Thank you so much!

About the CD Project "Twist Run Road," the Musicians and the Recording:
Musicians/Instrumentation:  Jasnam Daya Singh and John R. Burr on piano; guitarists Randy Vincent and Dave MacNab (and other amazing guitarists I plan to invite); Alan Hall on drums, Tom Martin on bass; and other great musicians (percussion, string quartet, cello, harp, accordion, harmonica).Will be Recorded and Mixed at: The renowned Prairie Sun Recording Studios in Cotati, CAWill be Mastered by: Tim Gennert (multi-Grammy winner). I have been working on this record for almost four years now, and enjoy the support of so many wonderful musicians, artists, industry professionals, family and friends. We are ready to get into the studio now!What the funds will pay for:


My musical family, the talented musicians I have had the honor and privilege to work with for decades:  Jasnam Daya Singh; John R. Burr, Randy Vincent, Dave MacNab, Alan Hall, Tom Martin, Gerry Grosz and other guest artists who will be on the recording.  

The arrangements include a string quartet, cello solos, an orchestral harp, harmonica accordion, and a horn section! I'd like as many musical colors as possible to paint these song-stories!  

Studio Costs: Recording engineer, daily studio fees, mixing, and mastering all make up a major expense for the project. Award-winning Prairie Sun Studios recorded the demos you hear on this page, and I will be recording the full CD there. 

Manufacturing of physical CDs and digital distribution. 

Marketing Costs:  Marketing and promotion of the album, costs involved for website, promo mailings, digital ads, SEO and other digital marketing costs.


Risks & Challenges? Bring 'Em On!
I've recorded three CDs in ten years, while a self-employed, single mother. If I can do that, I can do anything! There is no risk in contributing to my project, and there are really no obstacles that have ever prevented me from attaining my goals in Music. Every penny of the donations to this project will go toward the musicians, engineers and professionals who know how to bring this project to a successful and beautiful completion. I can't wait to share it with you!! 

 


These Songs That Come to Me in Dreams....
For as long as I can remember, music has been 'playing in my head' day and night. Underlying every moment of my life, the undercurrent of music has always been there. And so, it has never seemed unusual for me to dream a song.  It was something I took for granted! Many times over the years, I have had very vivid dreams – complete with song melodies and lyrics – that would come to me while I slept, and stay with me for days. In the dreams, I open my mouth to speak, but instead of a speaking voice, I sing the words...I am dreaming in song.Many times during a dream/song, a separate part of my mind, the observer of this dream, will comment: "Oh my gosh, this is beautiful....I need to remember this!"  I wake up and write or record as much as I can remember.
These are not overtly spiritual songs or religious songs, but they do come from Spirit. They are simple songs that tell a story or paint a picture from the past. Underlying the stories are images of the moon and stars; they evoke water or the wind. They are beautiful dreams songs that are open and spacious, allowing you the room in your mind and heart to go wherever your Spirit takes you as you listen.
The Soul within each of us does speak to us in our dreams. But we do not always recognize the voice of our own Soul. It is only recently that I realized the music of my dreams is actually my own Higher Voice that has been trying to reach me, through songs, for my entire life. Now I know that this lovely music and loving lyrics were being dropped into my dreams like beautiful, shining Gifts.  I finally got the message: 'Wake UP, Elaine!! You're supposed to SHARE these songs!!"
 

Thank you for visiting this campaign page
My campaign goal is stated as $10,000. But if 300 people contribute $100 each, I can raise my overall goal of $30,000 and hire every single musician, artist and professional on my complete list. The wonderful arrangements by Jasnam Daya Singh include string quartet and other instruments, and I want the instrumentation to include all of the parts he has written. I'm going for it...!!
Other Ways You Can Help
You can further help by sharing this campaign with your family and friends:


Please COPY & SHARE THIS LINK to your friends, family, etc:https://igg.me/at/ElaineLucia/x/16451840 

AND:  See the Social Media Buttons at the top of this page, right side?...PLEASE SHARE to your Facebook, Twitter, Email, Etc.!!  Thank you so much!!

I thank you with all my Heart for visiting this page, listening to my songs, and contributing to my CD project, Twist Run Road. Love and Peace Thru Music,Elaine

story:
The Realest Things Music Video

Aryn's fourth studio album, The Realest Thing, is a concept album inspired by a book on Christian apologetics. Each song explores a different philosophical argument for the existence of God and evidences for Jesus as his son. 

We'd like to make a professional music video for the title track of the album because this will be the best and most affordable way to SHARE THIS SONG with the world!

By simply pre-ordering the album you will be able to get your cd mailed to you before the official release and help this music video come to life!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Aryn has already partnered with a director/videographer that has a unique vision for the song and has given a quote of $4,500.
  • Perks are physical copies of the cd mailed to you, shipping included!
  • You get your perks whether we reach the video goal or not.

The Impact

  • Let's make an excellent and compelling video people want to SHARE!
  • You get the satisfaction of knowing your pre-order made it happen.

Challenges

If we can't hit the 4.5K goal, there's no guarantee that I can get the video made. However, all money that is raised WILL GO DIRECTLY toward promoting the album in other ways. (For example: Facebook ad campaigns, lower budget video options)

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you'd prefer to wait to download the album on ITunes, you can still help the video campaign through the $5 "little bit o'love" option and get an mp3 of the song NOW!
  • Help share this campaign with your friends that love to support independent music.

story:
Please type "Susanna Lynn Prolife" or "Susanna Lynn I Am Alive" in the Indiegogo search bar for my LIVE CURRENT campaign. 


I'm Susanna Lynn and my debut CD of original songs was a top 5 finalist for Christian Album of the Year at the Independent Music Awards.   But I got very sick and had to put my music ministry on hold for quite a while.  I was down for several years.  But God healed me!  And now I'm recording my second Christian CD of my original Christian songs.  I'm crowdfunding to help with the overwhelming costs of staying in Nashville to record, buying equipment, travel and more.


I'm so excited that we have already recorded the single!   I wrote this song because the subject (a secret till the release) is so important to me.  It has a powerful message and will be released before the CD.   

A little background: I've been writing songs since I was a little girl, and sang at church and in my brother's garage band.  In Kentucky, while I was a teacher for years, I continued to sing at churches and charity events.  God opened doors that allowed me to meet legendary producer, Larry Rogers, who recorded a CD of my original songs with great Nashville musicians, even a couple of Grammy winners!  The CD placed in the top 5 for Christian Album of the Year at the Independent Music Awards.  But I got sick, and had to put my music ministry on hold for quite a while. 

Then God did a miraculous healing in me, and He blessed me with a new music mission!   I've been writing new music and I'm recording again in Nashville :-)  God is so good! God's Grace has given me a new joy and thankfulness for every moment. If you wonder why I smile so much it's because I just can't contain my gratitude for God healing me and opening doors to a new music mission!  
 
This is where you come in…Although I have been signed to record a new CD, I have many expenses that are overwhelming me during this process, also while recording in Nashville, and I'm also traveling to sing at no charge for charities quite often.  So I am grateful for and appreciate any contribution that you feel led to give.  You'll receive a gift in return for your contribution, including my debut CD that made top 5 finalist for Christian Album of the Year at the Independent Music Awards for any contribution over $15.  

For more information go to my website or Facebook:  
www.SusannaLynn.com
www.facebook.com/Susanna.Lynn.9
www.facebook.com/SusannaLynnMusic

Thank you so much for your support and prayers.
I hope to sing for you soon!
Blessings and Peace,
Susanna :-)

story:
Soy Rafa Guillén

Soy de El Salvador, Centroamérica. Mi sueño desde pequeño siempre fue cantar. He logrado que mucha gente me escuche, sin embargo necesito el apoyo de ustedes para seguirlo haciendo. Grabar música y hacer vídeos requiere de mucho dinero.

Esta campaña tiene el objetivo de recaudar fondos para poder producir mi tercer material discográfico el cual tendrá 10 canciones de mi autoria las cuales tendrán su propio vídeo clip.

Con tu ayuda, estas canciones podrán sonar en radios, redes sociales, youtube y todas las plataformas de música como spotify, itunes, etc.

Necesito $15,000.00

La producción básica de cada canción me cuesta entre $400 y $700. Con este dinero se paga el arreglista, el estudio de grabación, los musicos que participan y el proceso de masterizacion.

La producción de mis videos cuestan entre $800 y $2,400 dependiendo del nivel de complejidad, la locación, la cantidad de personas que participan en el vídeo y todo el costo de post producción.

Necesito presupuesto para invertir en publicidad para dar a conocer mi música en redes sociales y medios tradicionales. La gente que no conoce mi música debe enterarse a través de estas plataformas pagadas.
 

El Salvador Tiene Talento 

A pesar de los grandes artistas que han nacido en El Salvador y los grandes temas musicales que han surgido a lo largo de nuestra historia como país, aun no somos un referente en la industria musical a nivel mundial.

Con tu donativo estarás ayudando que mi música se propague en nombre de todos los salvadoreños y que con esta iniciativa mas artistas salvadoreños se vayan entusiasmando a dar a conocer su música al mundo.

 

Estoy seguro que esto funcionará

 

Luego de aperturar mis redes sociales y ver la reacción de las miles de personas que me siguen, considero que tengo un buen material que ofrecerle a mundo. Considero que las mejores ideas no logran desarrollarse por falta de interés y de recursos por parte del artista.

Esa ayuda economica que estoy solicitando es un impulso importantisimo para el desarrollo de alguien que tiene las ganas y toda la energia del mundo para llevarlo a cabo.

 

Si no puedes donar, ayudame COMPARTIENDO esta campaña.

Seguramente, no todos van a poder ayudarme economicamente, pero eso no significa que abandones tus ganas de echarme una mano. Comparte mi link para que llegue a mas perosnas en el mundo y pueda recibir ese aporte que tanto necesito para iniciar la grabación de mi tercer disco.

story:
My name is Matt Mayer and I’m an artist, storyteller and believer. I know what I’ve been called to do and it’s to help people see through the BS our culture cultivates and ultimately see the truth. It’s pretty simple really, but not easy. With the fusion of my two passions, art and music, I’m going to create an album that dives deep into what influences us and what it takes to reach the surface again.
 

You can find out more about me and the story behind the music by clicking on the link below.

 

Against wave upon wave of shallow songs filled with lazy lyrics, self-obsessed personas promoting degrading content, and manufactured marketing schemes designed to sell records, I am creating authentic hip-hop music with an uplifting and honest message.

In other words, my music takes you deeper.

As in introduction to my style, check out this Live Acoustic Version of my first single, “Forward.” Birthed out of a conflict with my friend, myself, and ultimately my God. This song epitomizes the perseverance needed to fight for your future.

There’s a war going on. And you don’t have to look far to see it, or feel it. Just turn on the TV, or scroll through social media and in seconds you will be inundated with all kinds of messages trying to sell you on something to improve your life. It could be a product, experience, or lifestyle. The only problem is that these promises continually let us down and never lead to ultimate fulfillment, only to bondage and disappointment.

With “American Survivor”, I want to help free as many people as I can from their subconscious imprisonment by illuminating their understanding and offering an opportunity to walk in their unique, God-given identity.

Turn everything off and tune into the lyrics in this Live Acoustic Version of the title track off the album, “American Survivor.”

I’m here to remind us what Rap really is– Rhythm And Poetry. By harnessing this powerful art form, I’ll be reaching people on a powerful, emotional level. I’ll be able to convey my message to people without them even realizing it. That’s why I’ve spent the last 5 years working diligently to find my voice and craft my own authentic style as an artist. Each song on the album is a glimpse into my story, my journey, and offers a unique message to the listener. I use intentional and descriptive words matched to beautiful music to paint a complete and robust picture of the concept I’m trying to convey.

Check out the third and final Live Acoustic Video called “The Human Race” that explores our relationship to time and offer a solution to the ongoing expectations that we ourselves, and culture at large puts on us.

Now that you know my heart behind the music, let me tell you about my goal:

My goal is to raise $15,000 in 40 days.

What started out as an EP that I was going to just give to my friends has become so much more. It’s transformed into a full album and campaign I'm trying to promote nationally. Trust me when I say I've given, and I'm currently giving EVERYTHING I have to this project. My vision is clear, but I just need more resources.

Your donation will play a vital role in bringing “American Survivor” into the world. I fully believe in the positive impact this project will have, and with your support you'll be as much a part of the music as I am.  

There’s so much that’s needed to properly set up an album for success, but I’m confident in the talented and trustworthy people on my team. There are so many people devoted to making sure my record sounds amazing and has the proper chance to be heard. Your donation will go toward a variety of things including mixing and mastering, production costs, music videos, photography, management fees, Ad costs, and marketing and promotional materials.

As a contributor you will have access to purchase perks with your donation. Everything from a digital download of the album, to a Live Acoustic concert. Check out the Perks Page for more info.

 

If you can't contribute financially, no worries. My whole goal is to connect with you through my music, so If I have done that on any level, I’m glad.

Indiegogo has easy share tools you can use on social media and so you can always help by making some noise for me!

You can also help me by praying for resources to come in as well as the overall success and impact of the album.

Thanks!

Indiegogo has easy share tools you can use on social media and so you can always help by making some noise for me!

story:
• I've been writing songs for almost 50 years, however, I didn't start bringing them out to an audience until 2001..
  • I was fortunate enough to have recorded 2 albums, in 2005, and 2012, as a solo artist with a bit of help from other musicians
  • Still fortunate, in that I've got a great band which helps me arrange and perform my latest tunes- and we've recorded 12 of them in this new collection
  • The album is done, and just needs a bit of a financial push, to get it mastered, duplicated, and promoted...
  • This is where you come in...
  • There are various ways to help; you'll get a download, an actual physical CD, or other perks in return
  • One easy way to help us is to spread the word to others... share this campaign on social media, in email, or good old fashioned word of mouth...
story_txt:
I've been writing songs for almost 50 years, however, I didn't start bringing them out to an audience until 2001..
I was fortunate enough to have recorded 2 albums, in 2005, and 2012, as a solo artist with a bit of help from other musicians
Still fortunate, in that I've got a great band which helps me arrange and perform my latest tunes- and we've recorded 12 of them in this new collection
The album is done, and just needs a bit of a financial push, to get it mastered, duplicated, and promoted...
This is where you come in...
There are various ways to help; you'll get a download, an actual physical CD, or other perks in return
One easy way to help us is to spread the word to others... share this campaign on social media, in email, or good old fashioned word of mouth...

story:
Carrie Akre 4th Solo CD Project

Hi all! I'm the lead singer for the bands Hammerbox, Goodness, The Rockfords w/Mike McCready from Pearl Jam and I have also worked on my own music. I have 3 solo cds and now I'd love to move into making my forth. 

I'll be working on a full length record and it will contain a ton of new music based on some pretty big changes in my life from my mother passing to moving back home.

This funding will help me gather musicians, pay for studio time, mixing, master and printing of a a run of these in cd format.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking for about 5k to cover the cost for expenses to make a full studio record.
  • I'll be sending out hand written lyrics, organizing a private concert, send you the new work and getting you a look at the process.
  • Costs go to hired musicians, studio time, producer, mixing, mastering and printing of the new work in cd form.

The Impact

  • You help all of my new work come to life! Music soothes and gets us through life!
  • I want to share my past few years with you and go on the journey together. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spreading the word is SOOO helpful! Thank you so much!
  • Whenever possible use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hello every one! Like you see in the title, my name is Andres Arciniega and I'm a rock singer and writer from Caracas, Venezuela... Currently living in the beautiful city of Philadelphia.


I used to be the front man of a Spanish rock band called Los Inquilinos (www.losinquilinos.com), there were quite a few great years of doing music with these guys. However, due to various circumstances, I'm now here in the United States, doing all by my own, giving away what I do best... sing! 

I have a long career being musician... I started to play the guitar 22 years ago, and when have I started singing? I can't even remember. And so many times I try to stop playing music, but the music never leaves me... she still believes in me jajaja.
Through all these years I played a lot, in small venues and big concerts, here is a secret... theres nothing like small ones, because the energy with the public is another thing; but back in to the above, having played in all these venues taught how it feels like... to play music to people! 

I've been working for a few years in this album, working with SUPER great people that believe in me, believe in what I would like to do and what I would like to show you... Even though, here is the point that divides the reality from the dreams, what I mean is, that in order for me to make a good record, I need good equipment. 

In the past I counted with my band partners, but now I am by my own and that makes it much more difficult all. 

What I'm talking about is "The Budget"... And YES! I know that I can count on you! I know that you're going support this dream and let me show you the fantastic music that I've been working on! 
If we make this dream come true I promise you that I will never stop playing around the world, making videos for and with you, I'll always be there to do music! I know that sounds like other artists but if you don't believe me you can ask your self by adding me on twiter or instagram by @andrexarciniega or sending me an email at andrexarciniega@gmail.com, and be assured that I'll be there answering. You could also go to my web page www.andresarciniega.com and you'll find all my social networks! 

What I need and what you get :)

Ok! Lets break the budget down, it's something like this:

  • Studio = $7,276
  • Producer = $3,000
  • Indiegogo = 5% + 5% + 3%... at the end is like 15%
  • Administrative Expenses = $1,500 
The overall will be arround $12,000 :) and I'm sure that we can make it!  And if we do so, you're going to receive GREAT prices, like songs, t-shirts, sandwich in my concerts, letters, concerts in you houses and much more!!! 
So come and make this dream real together!!! 

The Impact!

I have to tell you at this part about other projects success... but the problem is that this is the first music project of a latin person! So it's difficult to explain.

But I can tell you something real... I've been playing in the US for around few weeks and a lot of greats things they happened to me... like playing like an opener in a place called Tierra Colombiana for a Stand Up comedian, playing in a tour for the Break Out Artist in Philadelphia, and playing with a great artist in the Hispanic Choice Awards!  

So that is the point when I stop and think that I'm doing good music :) and I'd lik to share it with more and more people!!! 

Risks

I will not lie to you, like everything, this one also has it's risks... like delays on time to launch the record, or simple like I  didn't archive the target and I couldn't do the record. 

I want to be the most open person with you and thats the reason why I tell you this, and I know that the first idea that comes to your mind is "Why should I support him?" and the only thing I could tell you is that I'm a person how doesn't stop dreaming and achieving goals. I make a lot with my band but the problem was the place, so I came here to a new country and I know that I'll make it!! 

Other ways that you can help! 

THANKS for taking the time and read till here :) I feel very greatful for that... So! If you can't support this campaign at the moment, don't worry! There are others ways for you to help... You can spread the campaign, and let other people knos of it and maybe they will become supporters :) every single dollar is SUPER important for me, and every single help too! Ultimately, "Every littler helps"


I know that wouldn’t be able to this on my own, I need you all; this will be our shared success. So LETS DO IT!

story:
Short Summary

We are the Indigenous musical group Tzotzollin. Some time ago we produced a CD of Aztec sacred songs that sold worldwide. It is time to produce a second CD of ceremonial music as a follow-up to the first CD: Mexihkateokwikameh—which can still be found at CDbaby.com/tzotzollin. 

 It has always been our objective to learn, teach, document and share the sacred songs of our Indigenous community so that they might be preserved and available for future generations. People from across North America and around the world have referenced our music for ceremonial purposes. Because of our efforts, the songs we recorded will never be lost.  It is time for us to share new music with the world and the generations of children that will follow in our footsteps. To do this we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We estimate the cost to record, mix, master and produce a second CD of music will be about $6000.00.  Rock Garden Studios has offered us a fantastic rate to record this new CD.  We will be recording songs used for the rite of purification. We estimate $2500 in studio time expenses. Mastering the CD will cost an estimated $1000. Production of the CDs will cost $2000. Costs for postage, handling and the percentages kept by the crowdfunding source, another $500. Already we have had contributions and commitments from videographers, photographers, and graphic artists who are donating their time and talents to help reduce our costs. Money raised for this project will go directly to fund production of the CD.

With your contribution of $25, you will receive a copy of the CD in the mail once it has been produced or you can pick it up at the CD release party set for March 12, 2016.

If we fail to reach our goal of $6000, we will produce fewer copies of the new CD, but we will still accomplish the project.  The importance of documenting and providing this music so that it is not lost is too critical for us not to complete the project.  We promise a new CD of music on March 12, 2016.  Help us to make that possible without having to borrow money and support the credit card companies.  The release party will coincide with the Aztec New Year and you are invited to join us! No entrance fee.

If we are able to surpass our goal, the extra money will be used to produce an additional CD of music documenting traditional songs used for the velación. The more money we are able to raise, the more songs we will be able to document.

The Impact

So much has been lost to the Indigenous communities over the last 500 years. The losses continue and only with projects like this and support from you can we hope to preserve the rich cultural gifts our communities have to offer. This CD of music will be available for those that share a passion for the cultural riches of the Mexica community.

Proceeds from the sale of the new CDs will all be donated to a Native not-for-profit dedicated to supporting the Native communities.  All of the musicians donate their time and efforts for the benefit of the community.

Words to the songs will be available online to the community at no cost. The commitment of Tzotzollin is always to serve the Indigenous community with the talents the Creator provided. Already the first CD of music is used by communities from Canada to Mexico who sing the songs in sacred, traditional Indigenous ceremonies.

Given the success of our first CD of music, we know that this is a valuable and needed project!

Risks & Challenges

Our risks are few. We already have the commitments from the recording studio, mastering studio, artists (graphic design and photographer) and musicians so that the project will succeed. Many are donating their time or giving a huge discount to the work. All we need are funds to pay for studio time and production of the CD of music.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, don’t worry, you can help by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Thank you for your prayerful consideration in partnering with my ministry! God has opened so many doors and has blessed this project already so much. You are a continuation of His faithfulness.  

As you may or may not know I spent the last few years writing and recording a project with Grammy and Dove award nominated songwriter and producer - Aaron Rice. He has written and produced songs with many of the top artists in Christian Music today (TobyMac, Mandisa, Hawk Nelson, Britt Nicole...).  

We sat down with some of today's greatest A-list writers to write a record that I believe will impact the culture of today's music listeners. This album is of my personal journey to faith as well as where I feel God is leading me.  

Although some may think that once the music is done everything is done, there are many different elements that go into helping release a record into the market place. While the majority of the hard part of this record is finished, (the actual writing and recording part) there are necessary and very costly elements still to come.  

We believe in this record so so much and want to keep TOTAL liberty to move however GOD is leading. In order to do that we have to replace the things a traditional record company would handle. 

This is where you and your support come in...


What We Need

  • Prayer Partners
  • Packaging (graphic design)
  • CD Duplication (physical copies of the CD - including all licensing and fees required to do this legally. Many independent artists take advantage of the fact that this is hard to track and therefore don't pay all fees required by law - I want my ministry to be an example of integrity and to bless the many different people who worked hard on this record so I will treat it like a major label release.
  • Distribution (both physical and digital - getting the CD in stores and online retail outlets like iTunes...etc)
  • Radio Promotion (promoting the music to Radio) 
  • Marketing, PR and Tour Support (the number one way to impact culture with this project is for me to be in front of people with my music and testimony) 

What We Need & What You Get

We will need $50k to get this out there: 
  • Every single penny of this will go into the bullet points mentioned above. My main goal is to share the light that I found in a dark and hopeless world.  
  • We have set up incredible perks to ensure that everyone involved and along for the ride is blessed in return for their contribution.
  • If for any reason all of the funds are not raised we will move forward and use whatever is contributed for the end goal.  

The Impact

Throughout my journey I was fortunate enough to have been exposed to many different circles of life. All of which I have made friends, supporters and spectators in. 

  • I believe in the impact this ministry can make, I believe in the influence the music and testimony can make on this generation, but more than anything I believe in the God that is fully steering this ship to its destination. He has never forsaken me and I know He's not going to now.

  • My projects in the past have done a great job at reaching people with the message I delivered. Top Billboard success, certified gold on radio airplay, being the opening act for international stars but this time around all of this is more than that to me, Its ministry! Helping others, sharing the hope that I found and that's the ministry I feel like the Lord has placed me in and quitting is not an option. This is what I was born to do! 


Risks & Challenges

Truth is this whole thing does have the capability of failing and reaching just a couple of hundred people but I believe even just one is better than none. 

  • If we have a slow start, I will keep going, if the door slams shut in my face I will journey on to the next ones. I will build the wells the Lord leads me to and I will retreat when He tells me too. If God be for us, who can be against us?

  • I will approach every risk, challenge and step with careful prayer. I will not move forward unless given a full peace from above because that assurance has proven to be faithful in my life.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I left this for the end but it's in fact the most important element of this entire campaign. I need people that will partner with us and PRAY this all the way to completion and beyond.

  • Please please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Share this with everyone you know. Allow others the opportunity to help share the light with us. Use the Indiegogo share tools!


“I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live up to what light I have.” ― Abraham Lincoln


*Album projected release Spring/Summer 2016 (Album Title Not Yet Determined)
