story:
Rhythms With Refugees (RWR) is a grassroots musical collaboration between Drumming for Social Change, National Music Conservatory and UNRWA in Jordan’s refugee camps. We believe in the power of music for cultural preservation and psychosocial development.​

Our work is social and centers on bringing traditional musical and cultural arts to refugee youth from various communities in Jordan as a means to empower, uplift, and transform. 

This campaign aims to make our work self-sustainable by supporting teachers' funding and special guest performances.

Our Story

Rhythms With Refugees began in May 2016 as an idea of the Jordanian National Orchestra’s Principal Percussionist. Realizing the power of utilizing local cultures and teaching artists to bring about positive social transformation among refugee youth, RWR started working in early December of 2016 in Baqa’a Refugee Camp through a generous donation of instruments from Talal Abu-Ghazaleh Organization and a partnership with Drumming for Social Change and UNRWA.

While our flagship work is in Baqa’a refugee camp – the largest Palestinian refugee camp in Jordan – RWR has plans to extend its services to refugees of other backgrounds through projects that will include Somali, Sudanese, Yemeni, Iraqi, and Syrian youth.

Where We Work

We operate out of Jordan in the heart of the Middle East. Jordan currently hosts over 40 different nationalities of refugees. We do not have a bias to our reach, as we are focused primarily on assisting peoples fleeing conflict. Specifically, we are based in the capital city, Amman. From Amman we are able to facilitate projects in various camps and community centers throughout the country, working with diverse communities.

Where Your Money Is Going

The most important expense in our work is hiring local teacher artists! Without our dedicated teachers this program can not exist. More than 50% of the funds being raised will go directly towards making sure that all students in the program have local artists working with them each week! Currently, we have an amazing team of 4 TA's (both female and male) working with the youth.

First and foremost for us is securing funds for teaching artists in this upcoming season. With these funds we will be able to provide teaching artists at two additional sites: one operating with Syrian refugees and another with African refugees from Sudan and Somalia. For the upcoming 30 week season at three different sites, with at least one TA at each site, the total expense comes to $3,150.00. 100% of this total will go directly to the teachers who are working in front of the kids each week.

The next expense is drums! The truthful reality is that as long as we have teachers, the program can function since we can, theoretically, drum on anything! In fact, many of our teachers are very familiar with "bucket bands" and using other types of "found objects" as a means to creating music - and we support the idea!

However, the nature of our project is creative as much as it is cultural, and to this end we believe nothing quite matches the power and beauty of playing the instruments that can be heard in ones daily social settings. A hallmark of our project, the drums then become a direct gateway into the youths' own history (past and present) and culture - which is at the heart of the psychosocial development that we are committed to. 50 additional drums will cost us $1,750.00. This will allow us to outfit each of the two additional sites with 25 drums, giving us the ability to service well over 100 at-risk youth. Drums will be purchased from local vendors, putting the money directly into the local Jordanian economy.

The next place funds will go is towards our special projects. This includes: participation in at least two concerts for the 2017-18 season; working with local and international guest artists; creating t-shirts for our students; transportation expenses to bring students to and from events; and gas money for our TA's working outside of Amman traveling to the camps. We've estimated these funds at $700.00.

Finally, we were extremely lucky to begin our first season fully funded! However, things changed almost immediately, and we found ourselves without the initial funding we had expected just two weeks into launching our project in Baqa'a refugee camp. This was most certainly an unexpected setback that could have completely derailed the program, but our Teaching Artists, like THE TRUE CHAMPIONS they are, completely volunteered their time and talents over the next 6 months without any financial compensation!

We want to be able to give them the funding that was initially promised to them for their hard work, time, and dedication in the camp with the kids every week! That fee is $1400 for 20 weeks of work. This comes out to about $70 per each week of work that the teachers have done since the first week of December 2016. It is our sincere hope that we can compensate them for this extremely critical first 6 months of service they gave to our students - They deserve it!

Video English Transcription

Outside a community centre near Amman, percussion beats and the sound of children clapping can be heard. The lessons are part of a new initiative 'Rhythms with Refugees' that aims to introduce refugee children in Jordan to percussion. The first class was held at the Baqaa refugee camp, located 20 km north of Amman. The largest camp in Jordan, it is home to more than 100,000 Palestinian refugees. The programme was founded by Bradley Broomfield, the head percussionist at Jordanian National Orchestra Association. "With the help of the orchestra, I thought it would be a really neat and amazing idea, with Talal Abu Ghazaleh's help to bring music to kids, especially Arabic music in particular, to them so they can have a chance to see how beautiful their culture is and how neat it is to play drums," he said. The musician, along with a team of six volunteers, will go to Baqaa once a week to teach the students various drumming and percussion techniques. So far, around 30 students have signed up for the classes. Among them is 11 year-old Raghad Althaker. "I wanted to learn (the drum) because it had great beats. So I wanted to learn how to play it and how to play these beats," she said. The initiative is supported by the Talal Abu Ghazaleh Foundation. The director of the group said music was a "therapy for the soul". "It calms people down, makes them more productive, allows them to express whatever feelings they have inside, anger or any other emotion. This is especially true with the tabla," Luay Abu Asbeh said, referring to the drum, which is a variation of the Indian tabla. Set up in 1968, the Baqaa camp is one of six emergency camps set up to house Palestinians who left the West Bank and Gaza during the 1967 Arab Israeli war. Poverty and high unemployment are the major issues facing residents of the camp, according to U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees. Student Mohammed Abu Doush said the programme offered him the only chance to learn an instrument he loves. "Playing tabla is a good hobby, I started learning it from my uncle who is a percussionist, I came to him and asked him to start teaching me, so he did. But now my uncle works and is very busy. So I heard about this through school, they said there is someone who could teach me, so I came," he said. The teenager said he wants to be a professional drummer one day. 'Rhythm with Refugees' programme is expected to last six months, culminating in a concert that will showcase the skills learned by the students. Classes will also be held at the Zaatari refugee camp, which is home to around 80,000 Syrian refugees."
story_txt: Rhythms With Refugees (RWR) is a grassroots musical collaboration between Drumming for Social Change, National Music Conservatory and UNRWA in Jordan’s refugee camps. We believe in the power of music for cultural preservation and psychosocial development.​Our work is social and centers on bringing traditional musical and cultural arts to refugee youth from various communities in Jordan as a means to empower, uplift, and transform. This campaign aims to make our work self-sustainable by supporting teachers' funding and special guest performances.Our StoryRhythms With Refugees began in May 2016 as an idea of the Jordanian National Orchestra’s Principal Percussionist. Realizing the power of utilizing local cultures and teaching artists to bring about positive social transformation among refugee youth, RWR started working in early December of 2016 in Baqa’a Refugee Camp through a generous donation of instruments from Talal Abu-Ghazaleh Organization and a partnership with Drumming for Social Change and UNRWA.While our flagship work is in Baqa’a refugee camp – the largest Palestinian refugee camp in Jordan – RWR has plans to extend its services to refugees of other backgrounds through projects that will include Somali, Sudanese, Yemeni, Iraqi, and Syrian youth.Where We WorkWe operate out of Jordan in the heart of the Middle East. Jordan currently hosts over 40 different nationalities of refugees. We do not have a bias to our reach, as we are focused primarily on assisting peoples fleeing conflict. Specifically, we are based in the capital city, Amman. From Amman we are able to facilitate projects in various camps and community centers throughout the country, working with diverse communities.Where Your Money Is GoingThe most important expense in our work is hiring local teacher artists! Without our dedicated teachers this program can not exist. More than 50% of the funds being raised will go directly towards making sure that all students in the program have local artists working with them each week! Currently, we have an amazing team of 4 TA's (both female and male) working with the youth.First and foremost for us is securing funds for teaching artists in this upcoming season. With these funds we will be able to provide teaching artists at two additional sites: one operating with Syrian refugees and another with African refugees from Sudan and Somalia. For the upcoming 30 week season at three different sites, with at least one TA at each site, the total expense comes to $3,150.00. 100% of this total will go directly to the teachers who are working in front of the kids each week.The next expense is drums! The truthful reality is that as long as we have teachers, the program can function since we can, theoretically, drum on anything! In fact, many of our teachers are very familiar with "bucket bands" and using other types of "found objects" as a means to creating music - and we support the idea!However, the nature of our project is creative as much as it is cultural, and to this end we believe nothing quite matches the power and beauty of playing the instruments that can be heard in ones daily social settings. A hallmark of our project, the drums then become a direct gateway into the youths' own history (past and present) and culture - which is at the heart of the psychosocial development that we are committed to. 50 additional drums will cost us $1,750.00. This will allow us to outfit each of the two additional sites with 25 drums, giving us the ability to service well over 100 at-risk youth. Drums will be purchased from local vendors, putting the money directly into the local Jordanian economy.The next place funds will go is towards our special projects. This includes: participation in at least two concerts for the 2017-18 season; working with local and international guest artists; creating t-shirts for our students; transportation expenses to bring students to and from events; and gas money for our TA's working outside of Amman traveling to the camps. We've estimated these funds at $700.00.Finally, we were extremely lucky to begin our first season fully funded! However, things changed almost immediately, and we found ourselves without the initial funding we had expected just two weeks into launching our project in Baqa'a refugee camp. This was most certainly an unexpected setback that could have completely derailed the program, but our Teaching Artists, like THE TRUE CHAMPIONS they are, completely volunteered their time and talents over the next 6 months without any financial compensation!We want to be able to give them the funding that was initially promised to them for their hard work, time, and dedication in the camp with the kids every week! That fee is $1400 for 20 weeks of work. This comes out to about $70 per each week of work that the teachers have done since the first week of December 2016. It is our sincere hope that we can compensate them for this extremely critical first 6 months of service they gave to our students - They deserve it!Video English TranscriptionOutside a community centre near Amman, percussion beats and the sound of children clapping can be heard. So I wanted to learn how to play it and how to play these beats," she said. The initiative is supported by the Talal Abu Ghazaleh Foundation. The director of the group said music was a "therapy for the soul". "It calms people down, makes them more productive, allows them to express whatever feelings they have inside, anger or any other emotion. story:
Who are we?

Auburn Row was originally formed in 2012 through a combination of mutual friendships and a variety of unsuccessful musical projects. Though the past few years have been multi-focused for each of us, we now feel ready to break into the music scene more than ever before. Our original material stems from a vast variety of influences- including classic rock, modern rock, metal and jazz. In an album critique from 2016, Music Connection Magazine praised the band’s “prog-rock precision” and emphasized the group’s “soulful subtleties.”

Our new EP, titled "A World Divided" is slated for release this summer. And this is your chance to be directly involved in the process.

Campaign Purpose

The purpose for this crowdfunding campaign is to assist with an organized pre-sale for the new EP- allowing devoted fans (like you) to participate, and extend the reach of our music to new heights. We handpicked our six most popular live songs and recreated them to better reflect our live energy in an accurate and fresh way. Though the six songs on this EP are not "new," these recordings are completely different from their previous iterations with updated lyrics, unique instrumental additions and new instrumentation. 

We are aiming to raise $2000 from this campaign for various costs associated with production and distribution of the new EP. Specifically, all money raised from this campaign will go directly toward the manufacturing of physical copies of the EP, recording and mixing costs, digital distribution across all types of media (including radio), and marketing of the material. Even if we do not reach our goal, the music will still come out as planned and we will push it as hard as possible to make this release a big success.

The Impact

Over the past few years, many of you have expressed to us just how important the messages of some of these songs are within your own lives. "I'm Not Like You" deals with the concept of individuality and standing up for yourself in the face of adversity, while "Out of Time" explains the value of every human life and is dedicated to Alex's friend, Miles Applebaum, who tragically passed away in 2014. We want to share these messages with others in hope of creating new connections around the world and inspiring others in the process.

YOU are directly helping us to bring this new music into the world. We launched a successful pre-order campaign for our debut album in 2015, and reached our goal with ease thanks to our dedicated supporters. This time, we want to make this campaign bigger and infinitely better. Through the use of Indiegogo, we hope to expand the outreach of our music while allowing our fans to remain involved in the pre-order process, as well as with our big summer plans- including a two week Eastern United States tour. 

The creation of this music would not be possible without the support of our devoted fans. Any and all support toward this campaign is incredibly appreciated and will be a significant help to our endeavors!
 

Perks

No crowdfunding campaign would be complete without some enticing perks! There are rewards associated with each and every contribution. A brief outline can be found below, and details of each perk category can be found detailed at the right of this page.

  • $1: Download of our new single, "I'm Not Like You"
  • $3: Download of our new single, "I'm Not Like You" and handwritten thank you note
  • $5: Digital Download of the new EP plus download of "INLY" and handwritten thank you note
  • $10: Physical Copy of the new EP, plus an AR sticker, handwritten thank you note and everything in the Digital Download perk.
  • $20: Behind the Scenes tour video plus everything in the Physical EP package.
  • $25: PIE TO THE FACE: Alex will take a pie to his face in your honor, plus everything in the Behind the Scenes package.
  • $35: Signed AR Poster plus everything in the Pie to the Face perk.
  • $35: AR T-Shirt plus everything in the Pie to the Face perk.
  • $50: Merchandise Master: Signed AR poster, AR T-Shirt and everything in the Pie to the Face perk.
  • $60: Piano versions of songs from the EP, plus everything from the Merchandise Master package.
  • $75: An AR recorded cover (song of your choice) plus everything from the Merchandise Master package.
  • $100: #1 Fan: Everything from the Merchandise Master package, plus piano versions of songs from the EP and a recorded cover of your choice
  • $125: Lesson with a band member, plus everything from the Merchandise Master package and a recorded cover of your choice.
  • $150: 2 tickets to an AR show, thank you video and everything from the #1 Fan package
  • $200: Lesson, 2 tickets from an AR show, thank you video and everything from the #1 Fan package
  • $300: Alex Cross Solo House Show, plus everything in the #1 Fan perk
  • $400: Alex and Mike Acoustic House Show, plus everything in the #1 Fan perk
  • $500: Electric AR House Show, plus everything in the #1 Fan perk

Risks & Challenges

We are taking every necessary precaution to make sure this EP release is as smooth as possible. That said, things can always happen, and it is necessary to expect the unexpected. We plan to have the EP released in late July and do not anticipate any delay in the ordering or shipping of any of the physical copies or perks. However, if any problems do arise, we will be sure to keep our backers informed in an efficient manner and to the best of our abilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, that is no problem! You can still help by sharing this campaign to help us engage as many people as possible.

We thank you for reading this, and for your time and consideration!

story:
Présent dans le paysage montréalais

Dirigé par la chef de chœur et pianiste Roseline Blain, le chœur des Petites Voix du Plateau réunit près d’une centaine d’enfants. Fondé en janvier 2012, le chœur s’est rapidement taillé une place dans le paysage culturel montréalais, en participant à plusieurs concerts et événements  depuis leur fondation:

- Prestations dans l'émission Samedi et rien d’autre (radio de Radio-Canada) 
- Émission spéciale avec le groupe Rock et Belles oreilles (radio CIBL)
- Figuration dans un épisode de la populaire série 30 vies  
- Émission Pénélope McQuade
- Magazine télé Formule Diaz
- Chœur d'enfants dans l’immense Troisième symphonie de Mahler avec l’Orchestre symphonique des Jeunes de Montréal (Maison symphonique de la Place des Arts)
- Participation dans les productions Carmen de Bizet et La Bohème de Puccini (Opéra Immédiat)
- Chœur d'enfants dans le Carmina Burana de Carl Orff en juin 2017 (avec l’Orchestre de chambre de McGill et le Chœur Saint-Laurent)

Le concert 5e anniversaire 

Ce concert, qui aura lieu le 13 mai 2017, est une auto-production du chœur.  Se voulant à la fois une rétrospective en chansons des 5 dernières années, et une ouverture vers les 5 prochaines, la production prévoit l'accompagnement de nos 90 choristes par 5 musiciens professionnels (percussionnistes, pianiste et flûtiste),  des projections live, la captation vidéo, l'enregistrement  et la production d'un CD souvenir.  On y interprètera les "hits" des 5 dernières années du chœur, ainsi que des extraits du magnifique Songs of Sanctuary du compositeur Karl Jenkins.

Plus de 15 bénévoles contribuent présentement à l'organisation de ce concert et deux activités de financement ont également été réalisées par les enfants cette année.

Pour nos jeunes choristes, ce concert, le plus grandiose depuis la naissance du chœur, sera l'occasion de se produire devant plus de 500 personnes!

Vos dons permettront à près de 100 jeunes de 6 à 17 ans de vivre une expérience hors du commun,  qui marquera leur jeunesse et qui les fera grandir. 

En échange de vos dons, nous proposons des billets du concert, le CD souvenir, des objets à l'effigie des Petites Voix du Plateau et votre nom dans le programme. Si vous ne pouvez contribuer, partagez notre page auprès de votre réseau, un coup de pouce qui pourrait faire une grande différence!

Merci de votre générosité!

story:
UN APPELLO A TUTTI GLI AMANTI DELLA MUSICA!!

Nel Nome del Rock sta tornando. Sta tornando nel Parco Barberini. Sta tornando, come sempre, ad ingresso gratuito!  

Purtroppo però, per la prima volta dal 1989, dobbiamo chiedere aiuto al nostro pubblico per ripartire!

Il magazzino di NNdR è stato vittima di vari furti durante i 5 anni di assenza e stiamo raccogliendo fondi per ripartire letteralmente da zero e per sostenere gli alti costi di produzione!

Aiutateci a riportare in vita un evento unico nel suo genere!

L'associazione culturale Nel Nome del Rock è sempre stata orgogliosa di non aver mai chiesto nulla al proprio pubblico ma quest'anno abbiamo veramente bisogno del vostro aiuto!

Chi siamo?

Nel Nome del Rock Festival è nato nel 1989 a Palestrina in provincia di Roma dalla passione di un gruppo di amici  ed è cresciuto fino a diventare un appuntamento da non perdere nella scena dei festival estivi italiani. Rigorosamente ad ingresso gratuito fin dalla prima edizione, Nel Nome del Rock è riuscito a portare sul proprio palco grandi nomi del panorama indipendente nazionale e internazionale, artisti come Queens Of The Stone Age, Morphine, Theraphy?, Levellers, New Model Army, Senser, Kaki King, Caparezza, Frankie Hi NRG MC, Marlene Kuntz, Afterhours e molti altri.

Dopo 23 anni, per vari motivi, sia economici che logistici, NNdR ha dovuto chiudere i battenti dopo l'edizione del 2012.

Siamo qui come associazione culturale Nel Nome del Rock a presentarvi questa campagna di raccolta fondi perché crediamo vivamente che Nel Nome del Rock debba tornare ad essere un punto di riferimento per artisti emergenti e non. Nel Nome del Rock è un festival nato dalla passione e che con la passione è sempre andato avanti gestito interamente da volontari, con il solo intento di promuovere musica di qualità e noi crediamo che debba essere incoraggiato e sostenuto!

Perché questa campagna?  

Nel Nome del Rock è sempre stato un festival difficile da mettere in piedi e con alti costi di produzione. La natura gratuita dell'evento ha sempre richiesto grandi sforzi per la raccolta fondi e sempre un alto rischio di fallimento, ma noi abbiamo sempre confidato nel fatto che il pubblico avrebbe risposto numeroso e che il festival sarebbe stato un successo. L’approccio non è cambiato, ma purtroppo abbiamo bisogno di un sostegno economico da parte vostra in questo momento critico!

Una delle cose che ci ha sempre aiutato è stato il fatto di avere accumulato negli anni, tramite donazioni e acquisti mirati, un ingente quantitativo di attrezzature, materiali e attrezzi da lavoro. Il magazzino di NNdR comprendeva (notare l'uso del passato) legname, decorazioni, banconi bar, impianti elettrici, illuminazione, piani cucina, insomma, un mare di attrezzatura, tutta fondamentale all'allestimento del parco e che riduceva enormemente i costi limitando il noleggio a palco e impianti audio/luci del main stage.

Purtroppo nei 5 anni di inattività il magazzino di NNdR ha subito un alto numero di furti riducendo l'attrezzatura e i materiali rimasti a poche cose che fortunatamente altre associazioni locali stanno ancora utilizzando. Come potrete immaginare, le cose più importanti sono andate letteralmente a ruba :(

Illuminazione, cavi e quadri elettrici, bruciatori, decorazioni, striscioni che risalivano alle prime edizioni, banconi bar, materiali per allestimento come pareti in legno, gazebo, tavoli, insomma, un mare di attrezzatura è andata perduta. Questa perdita costituisce un grande ostacolo per la produzione e l'allestimento del parco e alza di molto i costi di noleggio di attrezzature che altrimenti avremmo avuto a nostra disposizione e a costo zero.

Che impatto avrà la raccolta fondi?

Nel Nome del Rock ci manca, manca al pubblico e manca a molti artisti. Far rinascere il festival significa ridare speranza a tanti amanti della musica ma anche a molti artisti che per mille motivi hanno sempre meno palchi dove esibirsi. Non si parla solo di Nel Nome del Rock, noi crediamo nel potere della musica e nel potere che i festival hanno sulle persone; i festival sono luoghi di aggregazione e sono luoghi dove ci si conosce, ci si ritrova, si condividono musiche, momenti, esperienze; i festival sono luoghi che servono, sono luoghi che devono essere sostenuti e non condannati come purtroppo spesso accade!

Questa campagna ambisce anche dettare un esempio, crediamo che riportando in vita Nel Nome del Rock si possa dare speranza ad altre realtà, talvolta addirittura ispirate dallo stesso NNdR, che si trovano in difficoltà nel portare avanti eventi gratuiti con il solo intento di promuovere musica di qualità e aggregazione sociale.

Far rinascere Nel Nome del Rock significa ricreare un luogo, un momento, un evento magico che per 23 anni è stato un appuntamento fisso per molti e che adesso manca a tutti, anche a chi ne ha solo sentito parlare!

Riportiamo Nel Nome del Rock ad essere quello che era: un weekend all'insegna della musica, della cultura e dell'aggregazione, il tutto in una cornice stupenda quale il Parco Barberini di Palestrina.

Quanto vogliamo raccogliere?  

Vorremmo raggiungere il nostro target di 25.000 € per far sì di riuscire a produrre un Nel Nome del Rock degno di questo nome! Ai 25mila si andrà a sottrarre una cifra di circa il 20% per la realizzazione dei "Perks" generati dalle vostre donazioni oltre alle spese di Indiegogo. Il target sarà flessibile e qualunque cifra raggiungeremo alla fine della campagna sarà di grande aiuto per ricostruire un magazzino mirato a sostenere le edizioni future.

I costi di noleggio di tutte queste attrezzature sono insostenibili per il festival specialmente se si considera che il festival è sempre stato, e sempre sarà, ad ingresso gratuito. Per poter pensare al futuro dobbiamo essere in grado di poter limitare i costi di noleggio ai soli palchi, audio e luci e ad attrezzature speciali.

Al momento sappiamo che Nel Nome del Rock 2017 si farà, però, per far sì che il festival torni ad essere un appuntamento fisso nel futuro e con line-up degne degli anni passati, abbiamo bisogno del vostro sostegno specialmente nell'anno in cui stiamo ripartendo letteralmente da zero!!

Come saranno spesi i soldi raccolti?

I soldi raccolti in questa campagna, come annunciato, andranno a limitare i costi di noleggio consentendoci l'acquisto di nuove attrezzature, impianti elettrici e illuminazione. Nel caso in cui la vostra generosità ci portasse a raggiungere cifre superiori al nostro target finale, il resto delle donazioni andranno a contribuire alla copertura di altri costi di produzione come palco, luci e backline, così come a sostenere i costi di marketing e lineup consentendoci di far crescere il festival sia a livello di produzione che a livello promozionale fin da subito!

Nel caso in cui non dovessimo raggiungere il nostro target finale, le donazioni andranno a contribuire all'acquisto di materiali e a coprire alcuni dei costi di noleggio. Il festival del 2017 non dipende necessariamente da questa crowdfunding, ma la qualità dell'evento e la fattibilità delle future edizioni dipende da quanto riusciremo a raccogliere, quindi, per favore, aiutateci; noi lo facciamo per voi, aiutateci a ripartire!! 

Inoltre se supereremo il target che ci siamo prefissati riusciremmo a ricreare un festival di nuovo sostenibile e crescerebbero le possibilità di ritornare a fare beneficienza già dal primo anno. NNdR ha sempre cercato di sostenere organizzazioni e progetti in ambito sociale, come il progetto Basket e Autismo Roma, il Centro Anziani di Zagarolo, la TAC dell'ospedale di Palestrina e molti altri.

Cosa riceverete in cambio della vostra donazione?

Abbiamo cercato di pensare a dei "Perks" legati a Nel Nome del Rock e senza andare sul banale quindi si andrà da ristampe dei poster e delle t-shirt delle edizioni passate più amate a t-shirt uniche dell'edizione 2017 fatte ad-hoc per chi ha partecipato alla crowdfunding, il tutto con un design unico fatto apposta per l'occasione da artisti e grafici che si sono prestati alla nostra causa!

Offriremo registrazioni live esclusive delle edizioni passate (a sorpresa) che vi manderemo via email... e vi possiamo garantire che abbiamo delle perle rare!

Daremo l'opportunità (limitata) di passare un weekend al festival con pacchetti hospitality e accesso backstage. 

Ogni donazione, dalla più piccola alla più sostanziosa, verrà condivisa sui nostri social media con un ringraziamento personale (a meno che non specifichiate di rimanere anonimi); avremo anche una pagina nel nostro "giornalino" dedicata ai ringraziamenti. Lasceremo inoltre un "Perk" aperto per chi volesse donare una cifra senza ricevere nulla in cambio a parte un ringraziamento.

SUPPORT NNDR

Per concludere, vi chiediamo di condividere questa campagna, di parlarne con amici e conoscenti e di cercare di spargere la voce il più possibile. Confidiamo in voi per ripartire ed ogni forma di supporto verrà apprezzata tantissimo!

Parlatene, condividete sui social media, DONATE e mi raccomando, non mancate a Nel Nome del Rock 2017!!

Grazie a tutti e sempre Nel Nome del Rock!!

#supportnndr
story_txt: UN APPELLO A TUTTI GLI AMANTI DELLA MUSICA!!Nel Nome del Rock sta tornando. Sta tornando nel Parco Barberini. Sta tornando, come sempre, ad ingresso gratuito!  Purtroppo però, per la prima volta dal 1989, dobbiamo chiedere aiuto al nostro pubblico per ripartire!Il magazzino di NNdR è stato vittima di vari furti durante i 5 anni di assenza e stiamo raccogliendo fondi per ripartire letteralmente da zero e per sostenere gli alti costi di produzione!Aiutateci a riportare in vita un evento unico nel suo genere!L'associazione culturale Nel Nome del Rock è sempre stata orgogliosa di non aver mai chiesto nulla al proprio pubblico ma quest'anno abbiamo veramente bisogno del vostro aiuto!Chi siamo?Nel Nome del Rock Festival è nato nel 1989 a Palestrina in provincia di Roma dalla passione di un gruppo di amici  ed è cresciuto fino a diventare un appuntamento da non perdere nella scena dei festival estivi italiani. Rigorosamente ad ingresso gratuito fin dalla prima edizione, Nel Nome del Rock è riuscito a portare sul proprio palco grandi nomi del panorama indipendente nazionale e internazionale, artisti come Queens Of The Stone Age, Morphine, Theraphy?, Levellers, New Model Army, Senser, Kaki King, Caparezza, Frankie Hi NRG MC, Marlene Kuntz, Afterhours e molti altri.Dopo 23 anni, per vari motivi, sia economici che logistici, NNdR ha dovuto chiudere i battenti dopo l'edizione del 2012.Siamo qui come associazione culturale Nel Nome del Rock a presentarvi questa campagna di raccolta fondi perché crediamo vivamente che Nel Nome del Rock debba tornare ad essere un punto di riferimento per artisti emergenti e non. Nel Nome del Rock è un festival nato dalla passione e che con la passione è sempre andato avanti gestito interamente da volontari, con il solo intento di promuovere musica di qualità e noi crediamo che debba essere incoraggiato e sostenuto!Perché questa campagna?  Nel Nome del Rock è sempre stato un festival difficile da mettere in piedi e con alti costi di produzione. La natura gratuita dell'evento ha sempre richiesto grandi sforzi per la raccolta fondi e sempre un alto rischio di fallimento, ma noi abbiamo sempre confidato nel fatto che il pubblico avrebbe risposto numeroso e che il festival sarebbe stato un successo. L’approccio non è cambiato, ma purtroppo abbiamo bisogno di un sostegno economico da parte vostra in questo momento critico!Una delle cose che ci ha sempre aiutato è stato il fatto di avere accumulato negli anni, tramite donazioni e acquisti mirati, un ingente quantitativo di attrezzature, materiali e attrezzi da lavoro. Il magazzino di NNdR comprendeva (notare l'uso del passato) legname, decorazioni, banconi bar, impianti elettrici, illuminazione, piani cucina, insomma, un mare di attrezzatura, tutta fondamentale all'allestimento del parco e che riduceva enormemente i costi limitando il noleggio a palco e impianti audio/luci del main stage.Purtroppo nei 5 anni di inattività il magazzino di NNdR ha subito un alto numero di furti riducendo l'attrezzatura e i materiali rimasti a poche cose che fortunatamente altre associazioni locali stanno ancora utilizzando. Come potrete immaginare, le cose più importanti sono andate letteralmente a ruba :(Illuminazione, cavi e quadri elettrici, bruciatori, decorazioni, striscioni che risalivano alle prime edizioni, banconi bar, materiali per allestimento come pareti in legno, gazebo, tavoli, insomma, un mare di attrezzatura è andata perduta. Questa perdita costituisce un grande ostacolo per la produzione e l'allestimento del parco e alza di molto i costi di noleggio di attrezzature che altrimenti avremmo avuto a nostra disposizione e a costo zero.Che impatto avrà la raccolta fondi?Nel Nome del Rock ci manca, manca al pubblico e manca a molti artisti. Far rinascere il festival significa ridare speranza a tanti amanti della musica ma anche a molti artisti che per mille motivi hanno sempre meno palchi dove esibirsi. Ai 25mila si andrà a sottrarre una cifra di circa il 20% per la realizzazione dei "Perks" generati dalle vostre donazioni oltre alle spese di Indiegogo. Il target sarà flessibile e qualunque cifra raggiungeremo alla fine della campagna sarà di grande aiuto per ricostruire un magazzino mirato a sostenere le edizioni future.I costi di noleggio di tutte queste attrezzature sono insostenibili per il festival specialmente se si considera che il festival è sempre stato, e sempre sarà, ad ingresso gratuito. story:
Bref résumé

 Les contributeurs financent des idées qui leur plaisent et des personnes en qui ils ont confiance. Voici quelques pistes à suivre dans cette section :

  •  Présentez-vous et parlez de votre parcours.
  •  Décrivez brièvement votre projet et pourquoi il est important à vos yeux.
  • Expliquez l'importance du projet auquel les contributeurs vont participer. 

 N'oubliez pas, restez concis mais original. Demandez-vous : si quelqu'un s'arrêtait de lire à cet endroit, serait-il prêt à faire une contribution ?

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

 Fournissez plus de détails aux gens :

  •  Expliquez le montant du financement dont vous avez besoin et à quoi il va servir. Soyez clair et précis : les contributeurs ont besoin de vous faire confiance pour vous aider.
  •  Parlez de vos contreparties uniques. Suscitez l'intérêt de vos visiteurs !
  •  Décrivez où les fonds iront si vous n'atteignez pas complètement votre objectif.

 L'impact

N'hésitez pas à expliquer votre projet plus en détail et indiquez aux visiteurs en quoi leur contribution fera la différence :

  •  Expliquez pourquoi votre projet est précieux pour le contributeur et pour le monde.
  •  Mettez en avant vos expériences réussies sur des projets tels que celui-ci (si vous en avez).
  •  Rendez votre projet concret aux yeux des visiteurs et suscitez la confiance.

 Risques et défis

 Les gens apprécieront la transparence de vos propos. Soyez ouvert et démarquez-vous en exposant les risques et les obstacles auxquels vous allez peut-être faire face pour atteindre votre objectif.

  •  Expliquez pourquoi vous pensez être en mesure de relever ces défis.
  •  Décrivez comment vous comptez résoudre ces éventuels problèmes.

 D'autres façons d'aider

 Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas aider :

  •  Demandez aux gens de passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour de votre projet.
  •  Rappelez-leur d'utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

Et le tour est joué.

story:
We Do This Together

First of all, thank you. Thank you for showing interest in helping us and this music. No band can make it without those standing in front of the stage and the fact that you are considering to help us means more than you know. Without you, these songs would stay demos on our computers but with you they can reach the ears and hearts of many. 

What We Need & What You Get

To be honest we have never put more effort into anything. We have invested thousands of our own dollars and countless hours traveling, writing, and recording. With that being said, we need your help raising $6,450.00 to finish the last three songs! If we can raise more than our goal, we will be able to make an even bigger impact.

Every dollar donated makes these dreams that much closer to reality. We have organized many perks (t-shirts, hats, music, etc.) to say thanks for contributing so definitely check out the different levels of giving! Below, you will find a breakdown of funds needed and what they will go to. We will unlock each step as we are able to fund the following:

  • $2,150.00 (LOCKED) - First Song
  • $4,300.00 (LOCKED) - Second Song
  • $6,450.00 (LOCKED) - Third Song
  • $7,000.00 (LOCKED) - Artwork and Distribution
  • $9,000.00 (LOCKED) - Printing EP
  • $10,000.00 (LOCKED) - Radio Team for One Single
  • $12,000.00 (LOCKED) - Music Video
  • $13,500.00 (LOCKED) - Music Publicist
  • $15,500.00 (LOCKED) - Streaming Promotor for One Single
  • $18,000.00 (LOCKED) - Vinyl Record Printing

YOUR Impact

We have so many beautiful stories of people that have given up suicide, cutting, insecurities, etc. due to these songs from our live show. When these songs get recorded and in the ears of the one struggling to survive, you will be a part of the hope revealed in each song. We do this together.

 

Risks & Challenges

Producing a music project on a professional level is very mentally draining. Most of the time we are touring, we just hope to break even due to the financial weight from travel. To think about the thousands it takes to record almost seems impossible.

We have put so much of our own money into the songs we have now and to be honest it isn't easy. While others are buying things for their families, homes, personal lives, etc. we are putting our paycheck into a recording. We do this with joy because we know the impact it makes. However, in order to finish this project, we need your help because we have given just about all we can at this point.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially but you can in other ways. Please join us in every way you possibly can! We love you!

  • Help us get the word out by sharing this campaign on your social media and word of mouth!
  • If you would take a minute and pray, this would mean the world to us!
  • Continue to share our music and attend shows. It means more than you know.

Thank you,

Jared and Chase

story:
Who Is EBRA?

You must be wondering...

Well, first things first, I was born and raised in Rabat, Morocco.

When I started my path as EBRA, I was already based in Barcelona and had recently become a mum and so, life happened. Therefore, after releasing the single EXPECT in 2014 and performing an acclaimed interpretation of the song MON DOUBLE as a guest artist together with the Iberica AllStars backing band the summer of the same year at the Rototom Sunsplash Festival (20th Edition, 23.000pax), I tasted paradise… yet I had to take care of priorities first. However, I never stopped writing songs… Music is my muse, and singing is my muscle. Songwriting helps me breathe and understand the world we live in, both the beauty and ugliness.

This First Studio Record

When I started working on “MODERN AFRICA I: REVERIES” (referred to from now on as REVERIES), I wanted to make an original record, the reflection of my true essence as an artist; and the biggest influence for me were clearly my roots, the Arabian as well as the African ones. But it also had to reflect the story of my adulthood in Europe, as I left the motherland aged 17.

Talk about contrast.

Africa, and Morocco are pure contrast. Wet/dry, rural/urban, clean/gritty, dark/colourful, traditional/modern, silent/loud, extremely formal behaviors vs freedom to be, desert landscapes/green valleys, reality and fantasy, fear and faith, truth and mythology, chaos and courage... Both Africa and Morocco on my mind were a perfect place for the stories I chose to tell in this first record collection, where I also wanted to pay my tribute to those poets, songwriters, vocalists and artists of all disciplines whose names juggle in my head-space; those who inspire me besides just my folks.

That being said, “REVERIES” is a tasteful, personal homage to the music that I have incubated throughout the journey of life (Gnawa music, Malian music, the blues, desert folk music, Moroccan traditional music, arab classical music, gospel, soul music, funk music, afrobeat, world music in general...), and shaped with care and passion together with my producer Jules Bikôkô; I am honored if anyone can put my little record on their shelves, or in the same sentence as one of the greatest world, desert-inspired, singer-songwriter music accomplishments of all times.

The duration of the record will be approximately 45 minutes. 8 songs + 1 remix.

Summing things up, I have spent the last two years in my tiny home studio when I wasn't nurturing my son Jad or working as a performer, taking every spare moment of my time and all of my skill, dedicating it to bringing "REVERIES" to… well, life. ),0)

Teamwork Does Make The Dream Work

My core team consists of myself (the jack of all deals), my best friend Stef (my best advisor, aka the oracle), and a collection of loyal collaborators to whom I am forever grateful; and with some help from my friends and family whom basically hold my sanity together, I carried this project on my back for as long as I could, but I realized that, in order to finish my record in the way I envisioned it, I need the help from my fans and the wider community. As a platform best suited for my needs, I chose Indiegogo to present this record, connect me with my audience, and give you a chance to be an essential part in the creation of "REVERIES". Because. This. Is. The. Future. Of. Music.

What I Need & What You Get

Cards on the table: I have spent quite some money out of my pocket already, and NOW I need you guys to help me finish the record and release it worldwide, in order to bring it to you digital, physical as well as personally.

A big part of the work is done: the music is almost finished (I still need to pay the studio hours for recording, mixing and mastering). It shall be ready to share in less than a couple of months from now, but I have an extensive production, post-production and release list of needs ahead of me; I have also planned a clear and strategic promotional process.

For the record, and on top of the above-mentioned actual music making process duties (5.5k), the breakdown of the remaining 40.000€ I am raising is as follows:

  • 6k: Finalizing the artwork + graphic design by Marc Mallafré and Chamo San (REVERIES cover & back-cover art, concert posters, and merchandising)
  • 2k: Finalizing the two official music videos I have developed with GIRL IN A SUITCASE, a Barcelona-based film production company, for the songs OYA and OISEAUX ÉGARÉS
  • 1.5k: Finalizing the mixing and mastering of the Afro House remix of the single SACRED together with producer/remixer Tête de La Course
  • 6.5k: Manufacturing the CDs + Vinyls (pressing + printing)
  • 1.5k: Producing cool tote bags as a mean of merchandising (manufacturing + printing)
  • 2k: Paying for the website's design and maintenance (including photoshoot, MUH…)
  • 6k: Organizing a pre-release party in Barcelona in a 100pax intimate venue in order to collect promo live materials of my performance to meet festival deadlines (all production costs included: hiring the venue, paying my musicians & backing vocalists, video/photographer, security, sound/light engineers...)
  • 10k approx. (i.e all the remaining money I can raise and invest after paying 5% to Indiegogo): Last but not least, being an indie artist, I would need to set and drive all management & promotional efforts myself in order to make my music available on one hand to my fan base/audience (i.e. those souls who resonate and want to see this music blossom), and on another to music professionals, such as radio show hosts, online mags and podcasts, festival organizers worldwide (...). As a former publicist, I know for a fact that there are many ways of leveraging the promo aspect, and the costs multiply yet it is the minimum necessary (i.e. digital platforms fees, hiring a press assistant/publicist, attending relevant international music fairs like SXSW + WOMEX + VISA 4 AFRICA + major European ones to showcase my music alone or with the band, depending on the funds, exploring every new technology channel, considering Sync options, and so on and so forth).

First and foremost, please accept my deepest gratitude, not just for helping me financially, but for believing in me and my project. I want to thank you for your support and trust, and give you something to remember "REVERIES" as one of your fondest memories in the years to come.

That being said, I have prepared the following exciting rewards for all of you wonderful contributors to keep the backing process fun:

  • 50 EARLY BIRD TICKETS to the pre-release party on Sept. 17th, 2017 in Barcelona,
  • Lots of cool “REVERIES” TOTE BAGS, designed by Marc Mallafré and illustrated by the artist Chamo San,
  • SPECIAL “REVERIES” BOXES (the Key Tastemaker Box + all the way from my Mum's kitchen, the Sweet Tooth Box -oh my, you'll go bananas!-),
  • XCLUSIVE BEAUTIFUL CALLIGRAPHIC ART of the name of your choice (yours or someone else's) in Arabic, handmade by yours truly,
  • XCLUSIVE SHORT POEM in English / French / Arabic penciled by yours truly,
  • XCLUSIVE SONG in English / French / Arabic / Spanish penciled and recorded by yours truly,
  • ONLINE FINANCIAL DONATIONS to the NGO or social work association of your choice on your name,
  • LIMITED EDITION ONE-OFF DINNER DATES WITH ME at one of my favorite Barcelona restaurants,
  • A 48HRS EXPRESS GUIDED TOUR AROUND BARCELONA, special moments captured on tape for my docu-series,
  • XCLUSIVE private or corporate CONCERTS,
  • And of course, there will be one more thing - THIS FINISHED RECORD called “MODERN AFRICA I: REVERIES” (ON CD OR VINYL), which you will be able to enjoy for a very long time in the years to come.

What Happens If I Don't Reach My Goal

I love Indiegogo (I truly do!) as one platform that provides the option of conducting a Flexible Campaign. That means I can keep the funds I raise at the end of the campaign (50 days length) whether I reach my ultimate goal or not.

Now more than ever, every euro counts!

The Impact

About the way my campaign is built and the difference your contribution will make: every time we reach a milestone (I have set 6 of these for you to follow the progress easily), on top of the rewards you choose to claim based on your contribution you will be able unlock the following surprises for the whole community of contributors:

  • 5.000€ EARLY BIRD milestone: 50 tickets to collect at the entrance of the pre-release party in a Barcelona intimate venue on Sept. 17th 2017, with the whole 7-piece band. All first 50 of you can meet & greet with me and the band after the show, refreshment in hand and have your picture taken with us.
  • 10.000€ milestone: I will reveal the record's artwork on the campaign page!
  • 15.000€ milestone: I will publish the single SACRED + SACRED REMIX by Tête de La Course on all digital platforms.
  • 20.000€ HALFWAY milestone: I will publish the first music video, for OYA, exclusively available to all contributors so far.
  • 30.000€ milestone: I will publish the second music video, for OISEAUX ÉGARÉS, exclusively available to all contributors so far.
  • 40.000€ FINISH LINE milestone: on top of all of the previous, the exclusive digital download of the whole record will be made available to all contributors before the official release!

So, my dears, you've got the power ,0)!

I know I was born to touch the souls of others through my voice and powerful energy. Help me be heard and make others as happy as making art makes little me happy! Plus, strong of over 15 years as an international performer (I sing, dance, act), stage is my second home... Help me come to you and you'll hopefully leave after the show more touched than you came!

I undoubtedly believe in the transforming and healing powers music has over all living beings.

Risks & Challenges

I am blessed to have a network of friends, colleagues and family determined to help at any level of this project to help me give response to all the challenges, organization as well as production-wise. I would never be here without them. And they are also whom will help me stay dynamic throughout the campaign, dealing with every single step and also keeping you up-to-date!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's absolutely fine, but that doesn't mean you can't help if you'd like to:
    •    Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign on your social media networks or any other means, sharing is undeniably caring, you will help me spread this music far and wide to those kindred souls it might speak to!
    •    Remember you can also use the Indiegogo share tools! I am forever grateful to all of YOU lovely people!

This is the future of music.

Let's make it happen, I trust we can, because it ain't no mountain high enough!

We are here to empower and lift each other up, that is what our global tribe is made of.

AND YOU CAN REST ASSURED THAT... I AM WORKING DAY AND NIGHT TO MAKE OUR COMMON EFFORTS COUNT!

Thank you from the very bottom of my heart and soul.

Blessings, love and light,

EBRA
story_txt:
Who Is EBRA?You must be wondering...Well, first things first, I was born and raised in Rabat, Morocco.When I started my path as EBRA, I was already based in Barcelona and had recently become a mum and so, life happened. Therefore, after releasing the single EXPECT in 2014 and performing an acclaimed interpretation of the song MON DOUBLE as a guest artist together with the Iberica AllStars backing band the summer of the same year at the Rototom Sunsplash Festival (20th Edition, 23.000pax), I tasted paradise… yet I had to take care of priorities first. However, I never stopped writing songs… Music is my muse, and singing is my muscle. Songwriting helps me breathe and understand the world we live in, both the beauty and ugliness.This First Studio RecordWhen I started working on “MODERN AFRICA I: REVERIES” (referred to from now on as REVERIES), I wanted to make an original record, the reflection of my true essence as an artist; and the biggest influence for me were clearly my roots, the Arabian as well as the African ones. But it also had to reflect the story of my adulthood in Europe, as I left the motherland aged 17.Talk about contrast.Africa, and Morocco are pure contrast. Wet/dry, rural/urban, clean/gritty, dark/colourful, traditional/modern, silent/loud, extremely formal behaviors vs freedom to be, desert landscapes/green valleys, reality and fantasy, fear and faith, truth and mythology, chaos and courage... Both Africa and Morocco on my mind were a perfect place for the stories I chose to tell in this first record collection, where I also wanted to pay my tribute to those poets, songwriters, vocalists and artists of all disciplines whose names juggle in my head-space; those who inspire me besides just my folks.That being said, “REVERIES” is a tasteful, personal homage to the music that I have incubated throughout the journey of life (Gnawa music, Malian music, the blues, desert folk music, Moroccan traditional music, arab classical music, gospel, soul music, funk music, afrobeat, world music in general...), and shaped with care and passion together with my producer Jules Bikôkô; I am honored if anyone can put my little record on their shelves, or in the same sentence as one of the greatest world, desert-inspired, singer-songwriter music accomplishments of all times.The duration of the record will be approximately 45 minutes. 8 songs + 1 remix.Summing things up, I have spent the last two years in my tiny home studio when I wasn't nurturing my son Jad or working as a performer, taking every spare moment of my time and all of my skill, dedicating it to bringing "REVERIES" to… well, life. ),0)Teamwork Does Make The Dream WorkMy core team consists of myself (the jack of all deals), my best friend Stef (my best advisor, aka the oracle), and a collection of loyal collaborators to whom I am forever grateful; and with some help from my friends and family whom basically hold my sanity together, I carried this project on my back for as long as I could, but I realized that, in order to finish my record in the way I envisioned it, I need the help from my fans and the wider community. story:
The Beki Brindle Band - About us - Our Story

 

Beki Brindle - Guitars (lead and rhythm) and Vocals (lead and harmonies)

New York Blues Hall of Fame 2014 Inductee, Beki Brindle was discovered at Indiana University by Rick Danko and Richard Manuel of "The Band," while she was Blues Legend James "Yank" Rachell'slead guitarist. A consummate player at an early age, Beki toured repeatedly with Jerry Lee Lewis, as his guitarist. A native of Indiana, she spent time living in Ireland where she shared the stage with Hot House Flowers, The Waterboys, members of U2 and Thin Lizzy, The Pogues and Francie Conway, as well as recording  & touring with blues artists such as Carey Bell, Johnny Mars, Joe Louis Walker, Mary Stokes Band, Tampa Red, Fenton Robinson and more. She was also commissioned by Bono of U2 to create and run a blues workshop on Irish National Television.

Although Beki is a renowned blues guitarist and singer, with a style that is a mix of classic and original blues, peppered with sounds from Chicago and The Delta, she was also the guitarist for the Warner/Reprise band Grace Pool, as well as releasing several albums featuring other guitar stylings.

In 2016, Beki's latest blues album, "All Kinds of Beki," released on NY Blues & Jazz label Random Chance Records, was much-lauded, including a stellar review from Living Blues Magazine (by Robert Cattaliotti). In November, Beki and her band recorded a "Live in The Studio" album in Staffordshire, UK, featuring original, classic and obscure songs by artists such as Willie Dixon, Ike Turner, The Band, Lightnin' Hopkins, Russ Ballard's "Blue For You" (the title track,) and Yank Rachell. The new album, "Blue For You," promises both classic blues and originals, jam-packed with unforgettable, exuberant and raw performances.

Beki Brindle Band members:

Danny McCormack - Piano/Hammond/Backing Vocals
From Stockton-On-Tees UK, "Ivory" Dan McCormack sprang onto the Birmingham music landscape at the age of seventeen, playing his trademark boogie style piano with King Pleasure and the Biscuit Boys. Dan is a fine musician, who has toured and recorded with many respected artists, including Van Morrison (also Van's musical director as well as his pianist), Imelda May, Tony Christie, Richard Hawley as well as countless American jazz and blues performers such as Screaming Jay Hawkins and Bobby Parker (James Brown). He has appeared on Radio 2 as guest pianist with the BBC Radio Orchestra and is a lecturer in Music Studies at Derby University. Dan is a regular player with The Sticky Wicket Swing Orchestra, Roy Wood and The Beki Brindle Band. An arranger with an extraordinary reputation, Danny has made a massive contribution to the upcoming Beki Brindle album, “Back to the Juke Joint."


Sticky Wicket - Drums/Percussion
After beginning his career playing with rock bands in his hometown of Birmingham, UK, Sticky switched gears and began playing with jazzmen. His big break came when he became a member of The Russ Ballard Band, which toured the world and had the distinction of appearing on the legendary BBC TV live music show, "The Old Grey Whistle Test."  Returning to his roots, he became a longtime member of the successful rock band The Steve Gibbons Band. He played with the legendary Steve Marriott (Humble Pie & Small Faces), the venerable British jazzman Chris Barber, and the acclaimed Lonnie Donegan Band. Sticky is a much-respected teacher of drums and percussion and also runs one of the UK's most celebrated swing bands.

Sticky has played with Mark Knopfler, Joe Cocker, Roger Daltry, Van Morrison, Bryan Ferry, Jools Holland, Peter Frampton, Leo Sayer, Chas & Dave, Marsha Hunt, Steve Marriott , Paul & Barry Ryan, Bruce Welsh, Chris Farlow, Chris Barber, Steve Gibbons, Paul Jones and many more.  Sticks is currently a member of The Beki Brindle Band.

Chris Maidment - Congas/Washboard/Percussion

Born in London and brought up in Luton, UK, Chris first took to the congas after a chance meeting with the incredible rock drummer Richie Dharma, then of Mick Abrahams Band. His first band was Mustn't Grumble. He went on to work with Barry Ryan, Cahoots, Paul Young and many others. He has appeared on the Saturday pop TV show, Supersonic. Chris often plays with The Sticky Wicket Swing Band and is a member of The Beki Brindle Band.



John Riordan - Bass
Born and brought up in Birmingham, UK, John played bass alongside Sticky Wicket in West Midlands-based band Clayton Peacock. He has also played with Steve Gibbons, Status Quo, Slade, Andy Fairweather Lowe, Vince Hill, The Pretty Things, and many more.

Jo Griggs - Backing Vocals/Percussion
South London-born and bred, Jo met Beki in New York in 2013 whilst working as a session vocalist with Et Tu Brucé, supporting The Zombies on their US tour. A natural harmonies-singer, Jo has worked on numerous live and recorded collaborations with a wide range of artists; most recently with Beki Brindle on ‘Back to the Juke Joint’ and her previous album, ‘All Kinds of Beki’, as well as being part of Beki's British touring band. Jo has previously made a foray into dance music, co-producing and singing vocals for transatlantic collective Noizdisco, featuring Grammy-award-winning engineer Phil Pagano (MAW; David Sanborn; Tower of Power; Average White Band, The Bucketheads and Ultra Naté).​

  • The Campaign - why we are doing this and what it means to us!

    "It was never our intention to record this album but the ensuing results of jamming a few tunes at Danny McCormack's studio at  Netherseal in the County of Derbyshire, UK encouraged us immensely. Further encouragement came from Beki's Woodstock chum John Sebastian (Lovin' Spoonful etc) who offered to play harp on one of the tracks, which he did beautifully! 

    Also, two of drummer Alan 'Sticky' Wicket's old band bosses, Russ Ballard and Steve Gibbons, on hearing the rough mixes wanted to get involved too! Steve came along and sang a duo with Beki and Russ offered some advice on song writing as he saw so much potential in our sound. In the end Russ went a step further and offered us one of his songs to be recorded and produced at his studio, which was Blue For You.

    With so much encouragement and involvement form these musicians/songwriters of such high esteem (and and there were others too) we felt compelled to complete this album which comprises of strong 'Blues roots' tunes plus more original material that Beki came up with to compliment our unique line up and sound! The only trouble was we needed more funding to do this project the justice that it deserves and make it accessible to our growing number of fans!........That's where you guys come in."

    Our Next Intentions...

  • The album is completed but funds for 'Production and Marketing Cost' plus 'Promotional' expenditure needs to be met so join us to complete this journey and be part of something exciting for the future...and you would have been there to help make it happen!!

  • The Magnitude of what YOU, the contributors will help us achieve is quite substantial.  We have a big "in" with a large record distribution company / promotion company but this costs quite a bit.  This is for a good 3 months of promotion and that means airplay.  Solid airplay.  We know this album has some hits on it.  We have been told this by people who really know what constitues a hit.  YOU would be essential in helping us to reach the goal of rotation airplay which will ensure that our songs are played enough to be heard by hundreds of thousands of listeners .. maybe millions.  We are seasoned players and we've all been on major labels and on the big stage.  It is time for that again as our music truly is unique and we are very proud of all the hard work we put into this.  We've put all of our faith and funds into this and the album is complete!  Now for promotion.  We thank you in advance for helping us.  Thank you to those who have helped us previously and during this nearly 2 year process!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise about $30,000 in order to pay for top promotion for 3 months. We've set our goal at obnly 20% of this amount so that, as long as we rach that goal in 60 days, we can run this open-ended campaign.  We know it will take time to raise that amount of money. We could need more but this is a number we have agreed upon as a band.  This covers most of it. 
  • If you contribute, you will get signed CDs + early download (before the CD is manufactured) and other levels of contribution will get you more things, such as signed CD, early download PLUS a signed lyrics sheet.  You may contribute enough to get Beki's Danelectro signed guitar and/or a personal concert in your home or venue of your choice. 
  • If we don't reach our goal completely, we have chosen flexible funding, so we will use the funds to promote as much as we can and manufacture the CDs.  We are running this as an open ended campaign so hopefully, within 60 days, we will have the funds but if not, we will still carry on and work hard to pay for promotion, manufacturing, etc.  We will have the CDs no matter what.  

The Impact

  • Our album BLUE FOR YOU is important as we are keeping real roots music and crossover roots music, played by real musicians, alive!  We have a message and it is "STAY REAL!" .. this band is filled with great talent and seasoned players, each with many accolades from the many well known musicians they have backed.  We want our magic to spread to YOU and everyone who hears our music.  
  • We have a great track record with reaching our goal on a previous project and it helped tremendously.  That album is still being discovered and played on the air!
  • Join us by choosing one of our Perks and even our 1st level perk will get you the digital download as soon as we put it online. PLUS exclusive interviews with the band and guests.  Basically, you are pre-ordering and getting a few extras!  Thanks in advance from all of us.

Are there Risks & Challenges?

We have already taken all of the risks and overcome obstacles such as mixing issues using Logic Pro when Apple upgraded but caused a lot of issues for those using this program even in major studios!  It was frustrating but we have managed, thanks to Dan McCormack and lots of others figuring out Apple's changes!  We had the challenge of Beki travelling to the UK many times to work on the album.  This was quite expensive but we are all dedicated to this project and we know it is a winner.

The only challenge now is to raise money as we have all contributed our own money for nearly 2 years and well..... we are at the golden door .. we've got the pass but we just need the funds to walk through it! :) (mainly money to promote.)

Other Ways You Can Help

    Please feel free to share this campaign .. this will help us tremendously.  Word of mouth is at         least 50% of any campaign's success!  

    You can contribute more than any of the offered amounts we have listed, if you feel like it.  Some people have done so in the past and we do appreciate to no end, their generosity.  You know who you are.   XXOO!!! Very much appreciation and love from The Beki Brindle Band!
