A native of Indiana, she spent time living in Ireland where she shared the stage with Hot House Flowers, The Waterboys, members of U2 and Thin Lizzy, The Pogues and Francie Conway, as well as recording  & touring with blues artists such as Carey Bell, Johnny Mars, Joe Louis Walker, Mary Stokes Band, Tampa Red, Fenton Robinson and more. She was also commissioned by Bono of U2 to create and run a blues workshop on Irish National Television.Although Beki is a renowned blues guitarist and singer, with a style that is a mix of classic and original blues, peppered with sounds from Chicago and The Delta, she was also the guitarist for the Warner/Reprise band Grace Pool, as well as releasing several albums featuring other guitar stylings.In 2016, Beki's latest blues album, "All Kinds of Beki," released on NY Blues & Jazz label Random Chance Records, was much-lauded, including a stellar review from Living Blues Magazine (by Robert Cattaliotti). In November, Beki and her band recorded a "Live in The Studio" album in Staffordshire, UK, featuring original, classic and obscure songs by artists such as Willie Dixon, Ike Turner, The Band, Lightnin' Hopkins, Russ Ballard's "Blue For You" (the title track,) and Yank Rachell. The new album, "Blue For You," promises both classic blues and originals, jam-packed with unforgettable, exuberant and raw performances.Beki Brindle Band members:Danny McCormack - Piano/Hammond/Backing VocalsFrom Stockton-On-Tees UK, "Ivory" Dan McCormack sprang onto the Birmingham music landscape at the age of seventeen, playing his trademark boogie style piano with King Pleasure and the Biscuit Boys. Dan is a fine musician, who has toured and recorded with many respected artists, including Van Morrison (also Van's musical director as well as his pianist), Imelda May, Tony Christie, Richard Hawley as well as countless American jazz and blues performers such as Screaming Jay Hawkins and Bobby Parker (James Brown). He has appeared on Radio 2 as guest pianist with the BBC Radio Orchestra and is a lecturer in Music Studies at Derby University. Dan is a regular player with The Sticky Wicket Swing Orchestra, Roy Wood and The Beki Brindle Band. An arranger with an extraordinary reputation, Danny has made a massive contribution to the upcoming Beki Brindle album, “Back to the Juke Joint."
Sticky Wicket - Drums/PercussionAfter beginning his career playing with rock bands in his hometown of Birmingham, UK, Sticky switched gears and began playing with jazzmen. His big break came when he became a member of The Russ Ballard Band, which toured the world and had the distinction of appearing on the legendary BBC TV live music show, "The Old Grey Whistle Test."  Returning to his roots, he became a longtime member of the successful rock band The Steve Gibbons Band. He played with the legendary Steve Marriott (Humble Pie & Small Faces), the venerable British jazzman Chris Barber, and the acclaimed Lonnie Donegan Band. Sticky is a much-respected teacher of drums and percussion and also runs one of the UK's most celebrated swing bands.Sticky has played with Mark Knopfler, Joe Cocker, Roger Daltry, Van Morrison, Bryan Ferry, Jools Holland, Peter Frampton, Leo Sayer, Chas & Dave, Marsha Hunt, Steve Marriott , Paul & Barry Ryan, Bruce Welsh, Chris Farlow, Chris Barber, Steve Gibbons, Paul Jones and many more.  Sticks is currently a member of The Beki Brindle Band.Chris Maidment - Congas/Washboard/Percussion
Born in London and brought up in Luton, UK, Chris first took to the congas after a chance meeting with the incredible rock drummer Richie Dharma, then of Mick Abrahams Band. His first band was Mustn't Grumble. He went on to work with Barry Ryan, Cahoots, Paul Young and many others. He has appeared on the Saturday pop TV show, Supersonic. Chris often plays with The Sticky Wicket Swing Band and is a member of The Beki Brindle Band.
John Riordan - BassBorn and brought up in Birmingham, UK, John played bass alongside Sticky Wicket in West Midlands-based band Clayton Peacock. He has also played with Steve Gibbons, Status Quo, Slade, Andy Fairweather Lowe, Vince Hill, The Pretty Things, and many more.Jo Griggs - Backing Vocals/PercussionSouth London-born and bred, Jo met Beki in New York in 2013 whilst working as a session vocalist with Et Tu Brucé, supporting The Zombies on their US tour. A natural harmonies-singer, Jo has worked on numerous live and recorded collaborations with a wide range of artists; most recently with Beki Brindle on ‘Back to the Juke Joint’ and her previous album, ‘All Kinds of Beki’, as well as being part of Beki's British touring band. Jo has previously made a foray into dance music, co-producing and singing vocals for transatlantic collective Noizdisco, featuring Grammy-award-winning engineer Phil Pagano (MAW; David Sanborn; Tower of Power; Average White Band, The Bucketheads and Ultra Naté).​


The Campaign - why we are doing this and what it means to us!
"It was never our intention to record this album but the ensuing results of jamming a few tunes at Danny McCormack's studio at  Netherseal in the County of Derbyshire, UK encouraged us immensely. Further encouragement came from Beki's Woodstock chum John Sebastian (Lovin' Spoonful etc) who offered to play harp on one of the tracks, which he did beautifully! 
Also, two of drummer Alan 'Sticky' Wicket's old band bosses, Russ Ballard and Steve Gibbons, on hearing the rough mixes wanted to get involved too! Steve came along and sang a duo with Beki and Russ offered some advice on song writing as he saw so much potential in our sound. In the end Russ went a step further and offered us one of his songs to be recorded and produced at his studio, which was Blue For You.
With so much encouragement and involvement form these musicians/songwriters of such high esteem (and and there were others too) we felt compelled to complete this album which comprises of strong 'Blues roots' tunes plus more original material that Beki came up with to compliment our unique line up and sound! The only trouble was we needed more funding to do this project the justice that it deserves and make it accessible to our growing number of fans!........That's where you guys come in."
Our Next Intentions...

The album is completed but funds for 'Production and Marketing Cost' plus 'Promotional' expenditure needs to be met so join us to complete this journey and be part of something exciting for the future...and you would have been there to help make it happen!!
The Magnitude of what YOU, the contributors will help us achieve is quite substantial.  We have a big "in" with a large record distribution company / promotion company but this costs quite a bit.  This is for a good 3 months of promotion and that means airplay.  Solid airplay.  We know this album has some hits on it.  We have been told this by people who really know what constitues a hit.  YOU would be essential in helping us to reach the goal of rotation airplay which will ensure that our songs are played enough to be heard by hundreds of thousands of listeners .. maybe millions.  We are seasoned players and we've all been on major labels and on the big stage.  It is time for that again as our music truly is unique and we are very proud of all the hard work we put into this.  We've put all of our faith and funds into this and the album is complete!  Now for promotion.  We thank you in advance for helping us.  Thank you to those who have helped us previously and during this nearly 2 year process!


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $30,000 in order to pay for top promotion for 3 months. We've set our goal at obnly 20% of this amount so that, as long as we rach that goal in 60 days, we can run this open-ended campaign.  We know it will take time to raise that amount of money. We could need more but this is a number we have agreed upon as a band.  This covers most of it. 

If you contribute, you will get signed CDs + early download (before the CD is manufactured) and other levels of contribution will get you more things, such as signed CD, early download PLUS a signed lyrics sheet.  You may contribute enough to get Beki's Danelectro signed guitar and/or a personal concert in your home or venue of your choice. 
If we don't reach our goal completely, we have chosen flexible funding, so we will use the funds to promote as much as we can and manufacture the CDs.  We are running this as an open ended campaign so hopefully, within 60 days, we will have the funds but if not, we will still carry on and work hard to pay for promotion, manufacturing, etc.  We will have the CDs no matter what.  


The Impact

Our album BLUE FOR YOU is important as we are keeping real roots music and crossover roots music, played by real musicians, alive!  We have a message and it is "STAY REAL!" .. this band is filled with great talent and seasoned players, each with many accolades from the many well known musicians they have backed.  We want our magic to spread to YOU and everyone who hears our music.  
We have a great track record with reaching our goal on a previous project and it helped tremendously.  That album is still being discovered and played on the air!
Join us by choosing one of our Perks and even our 1st level perk will get you the digital download as soon as we put it online. PLUS exclusive interviews with the band and guests.  Basically, you are pre-ordering and getting a few extras!  Thanks in advance from all of us.


Are there Risks & Challenges?
We have already taken all of the risks and overcome obstacles such as mixing issues using Logic Pro when Apple upgraded but caused a lot of issues for those using this program even in major studios!  It was frustrating but we have managed, thanks to Dan McCormack and lots of others figuring out Apple's changes!  We had the challenge of Beki travelling to the UK many times to work on the album.  This was quite expensive but we are all dedicated to this project and we know it is a winner.
The only challenge now is to raise money as we have all contributed our own money for nearly 2 years and well..... we are at the golden door .. we've got the pass but we just need the funds to walk through it! :) (mainly money to promote.)

Other Ways You Can Help
    Please feel free to share this campaign .. this will help us tremendously.  Word of mouth is at         least 50% of any campaign's success!  
    You can contribute more than any of the offered amounts we have listed, if you feel like it.  Some people have done so in the past and we do appreciate to no end, their generosity.  You know who you are.   XXOO!!! Very much appreciation and love from The Beki Brindle Band!

story:
"Do You Hear Me Now?" 

Its more than the title of a song, its the main reason for doing this project: We really just want these songs to be heard!   They're all original tunes, all new recordings, and they're fresh, exciting and 'smart' songs.   Some of them actually  were originally recorded in the 80's,  and released as a cassette-only EP. called "Starksongs".  That project, produced by Bill Starks and Chuck Underwood,  yielded an exciting  mix of high-energy power-pop and roots-influenced rock, but it remained 'under the radar' for a lot of folks.   Why was that?

The tunes were well-received by those who heard them - and several of the songs were awarded honors in the Mid-Atlantic Songwriters competition - but they weren't really performed live on more than a few occasions,   Plus, this was long before facebook and youtube and file-sharing.  So,  while this music represents an exciting and creative period for us,   it didn't get the attention of many DC music fans back in the day.  

Bill, Chuck and Greg first began working together in the band called ShadowBox, which soon morphed into The Rhythm Method.   More changes a year or so later found these guys in separate bands, but before too long, they were working together again on the "Starksongs" recording project.

The core band for the original recordings, was Bill Starks on keys and vocals and Chuck Underwood on guitar, with Greg Hardin on bass and vocals, and Joe Dougherty on drums.  Also on the original sessions, was a great horn section with Bruce Swaim (tenor sax), Vince McCool (trumpet) and John Wolff  (trombone) and some backing vocals by the members of the Dynettes (Martha Hull, Cherie Grasso, and Diana Quinn).    That's a whole lot of creative energy - and not something that's easily duplicated!

So why not just re-release the original recordings on CD?  Well, that isn't possible, because the original master tapes are gone.  But we wanted to take another crack at these tunes anyway! Plus, the original recordings were very energetic and fun, but they were also flawed in some ways.  For example, when the cassettes were mass-produced, they sounded a bit sped-up. We decided to recreate the original arrangements and get a better sounding final result. 

So it wasn't easy, herding all these cats, but we 'got the band back together' for this project,  and we cut brand-new versions of all the tunes that we recorded years ago, along with a couple other unreleased 'lost classics'. Hopefully, having honed our chops, and having acquired a bit more studio experience over the years, we've now created the definitive versions of these favorite songs of ours.   

For this new CD, the core band again includes Bill, Chuck, Greg and Joe, along with the horns: Bruce and Vince again,  and this time, with Chris Watling on baritone sax. We also brought in percussionist Josh Howell to play congas on a couple of tracks. And  topping it off,  some harmonies provided by the Starks Famdamily.  Also, we've added a couple of songs to the six tracks that were on the original Starksongs EP.  We are really pleased with the results -- the energy is fresh, and the music feels new again.  And with Jim Robeson behind the console, you know its going to sound incredible.  And it's been quite a rewarding experience, reuniting to give these songs their due, and approach them from a more mature perspective.

 

 

"Do You Hear Me Now" is really more than the title cut in the collection, it's the theme of this project, with our goal of presenting these  new-and-improved versions of these tunes to a wider audience.  Its been a labor of love, and a good deal of the work involved is still ahead.  A lot of planning, a lot of talent, time and effort, and a fair amount of money is required, but at this point we're nearly done and there is no turning back! 

Now, we're hoping that you and other music fans, through your donations,  will help us with our funding goals, in order to complete this project. The money from CD purchases and other donations will be used to cover the recording and production costs, and the design and manufacturing of the CD's, and to compensate the very talented musicians who have so generously offered their services in making this record, and bringing these long-neglected tunes back to life again.  We wouldn't ask you for a commitment like this unless we were confident that everyone will like the results.  So - come on and join the band -- We're counting  on your your support to make this happen!   

Here's how you can help!

 We're looking for the support of music lovers like you, in the DC area and beyond, to fund this project:  donations will help pay the musicians who have (so far) contributed their time and talents,  and cover the costs of the recording studios we used,  and  will also pay for the manufacturing of the discs themselves.  Our goal is to raise  $7500  in contributions, in 2 months, based on the budget for this project. To be clear, this is not designed to make a profit, just to recoup the costs we've incurred so far.  

How you can help?  It could be as simple as pre-ordering an autographed copy of the CD, for $25.  For a little more money ($35) you can get an autographed CD and a copy of the accompanying poster as well. For a $50 donation, you can get an autographed copy of "Do You Hear Me Now", as well as the award-winning 2015 CD release "I See Trouble".  Also, once we have scheduled a CD release party, (which is still TBA, as of now)  and when we have more details about the time and place,  we're also hoping to add  a perk so you can get VIP status at that event.  And, to be clear, there is no limit to the amount of your donation: if you just want to make a small donation and hold off on getting a copy of the CD for now, that is just fine, and we appreciate any help you can give. And,  if you are feeling more generous, we'll gladly receive any amount you can afford  to help fund this campaign, and  of course, in return for larger donations, we'll gladly provide you multiple copies of the new CD.  How many copies can we put you down for?

Finally, its worth mentioning that we had a very successful IndieGogo campaign for Bill's first solo CD project, "I See Trouble" in 2015. And we're certainly hoping to repeat those results for this campaign as well.   Incidentally, that  "I See Trouble" CD received multiple nominations in the annual Washington Area Music Association awards, and Bill received a "Song of the Year" Wammie for one song, "300 Miles", and "Songwriter Of the Year" award for the album. Those were such gratifying and affirmative experiences that we're still so thankful for, and we couldn't have done it without you!

story:
We are not collecting money for a record. 

But for two of them!!!

2 ganz besondere Alben

GETTIN' ANGRY und LIES/truths. CABARET SOUL - Sound aus Berlin.

THANKS TO ALL SUPPORTERS! This campaign has been viewed over 1.500 times! That we didn't reach our goal is, admittedly, my own fault - setting up the campaign too early without much to show in the beginning, letting it run over the holidays when nobody had time (and afterward, no money), and during a time when I was making a record - not running around and handing out flyers! But still we got a huge amount of money which means A LOT for me, especially as more than half of the money was GIFTS, not bargains....! Thank you again for your ongoing trust into our weirdness, and we will never disappoint you!

Now here's the story:
Der großartige amerikanische Produzent JASON RUBAL  (Referenzmusiker: Amanda Palmer, The Cure, Violent Femmes, birdeatsbaby, Bitter Ruins, Garbage, Lone Wolf Project...), der uns ENTDECKT und LIES/truths mit uns produziert hat, als GETTIN' ANGRY gerade halb fertig war. Mit dabei: Phantastische Gastmusiker - vor allem der unglaubliche BRIAN VIGLIONE (Schlagzeuger der Dresden Dolls, Violent Femmes...) Und die Fortsetzung unserer Geschichte: Warum sind die Aliens aus SCIENCE FICTION eigentlich auf der Erde und was machen sie hier? 
_____________________english________________________

GETTIN' ANGRY and LIES will be special. CABARET SOUL - sound from Berlin.

Amazing JASON RUBAL (known for his work with members of The Dresden Dolls, The Cure, Violent Femmes, birdeatsbaby, Bitter Ruins, Garbage, Lone Wolf Project...) who DISCOVERED us as GETTIN' ANGRY was halfway done, and produced LIES/TRUTHS with us. Including gorgeous guest musicians, especially the incredible BRIAN VIGLIONE (drummer of Dresden Dolls, Violent Femmes...). And the sequel to our story. Why are those aliens from SCIENCE FICTION on Earth? And what do they do here? 

More about our story with Jason

You Give & You Get

LIES/TRUTHS: Album mit 9 Titeln, für unsere Helfer (wenn das Geld reicht) auch als Schallplatte auf Vinyl!! Nur in der Hardware, also CD- und Vinyledition, könnt Ihr die vollständige Geschichte erfahren, die im Cover versteckt ist... 

GETTIN' ANGRY: Album mit 14 Titeln, luxuriöse Metallbox (als stumpfe Schlagwaffe verwendbar) und 32seitiges Comicheft (Artwork bei Feline).

Produktionskosten: 5.000,- Euro. Die Veröffentlichung und PR beim renommierten Label motor entertainment kostet weitere 6.000,- Euro. Warum müssen wir dafür zahlen? Weil wir Indie bleiben wollen und bei motor-RAR alle Rechte an unseren Songs behalten. Für Studiokosten, Mastering und Musikergagen hat unser Geld gereicht - aber nun stehen wir mit zwei halb fertigen Platten da und brauchen dringend Deine Unterstützung!

__________________________english__________________________

LIES/TRUTHS: 9 Songs, for our supporters (if we raise enough funds) as vinyl! Only on hardware, that's CD and vinyl, you will be able to read the full story hidden in the cover....

GETTIN' ANGRY: 14 songs, luxury steel box (an assault weapon, if needed) and a 32page graphic novel by Feline.

Making this will be 5.000,- Euro. To release and PR with renowned label motor entertainment we need another 6.000,- Euro. Why pay for this? Because we want to stay Indie and keep the rights on our songs. motor-RAR makes this possible. Studio costs, mastering, and musician´s wages - that´s what our money paid. But now our music is halfway done - and to bring it to YOU we need your support!

Past&Future

Zwei Alben haben wir bereits selbst finanziert und erfolgreich veröffentlicht, BEHAVIOUR und SCIENCE FICTION. Aber mit Deiner Hilfe wird es so viel leichter! Und Du kannst sagen: ICH WAR DABEI.

___________________________english____________________________

Two longplayers have been self-financed and successfully released: BEHAVIOUR and SCIENCE FICTION. But with your help so much easier! And you will say: THIS IS MINE, TOO!


DANKE!!! THANK YOU!!!

ergebenst, yours sincerely

Feline & die Jungs

LIES/TRUTHS: 9 Songs, for our supporters (if we raise enough funds) as vinyl! Only on hardware, that's CD and vinyl, you will be able to read the full story hidden in the cover....

GETTIN' ANGRY: 14 songs, luxury steel box (an assault weapon, if needed) and a 32page graphic novel by Feline.Making this will be 5.000,- Euro. To release and PR with renowned label motor entertainment we need another 6.000,- Euro. Why pay for this? Because we want to stay Indie and keep the rights on our songs. motor-RAR makes this possible. Studio costs, mastering, and musician´s wages - that´s what our money paid. But now our music is halfway done - and to bring it to YOU we need your support!


Past&Future
 

Zwei Alben haben wir bereits selbst finanziert und erfolgreich veröffentlicht, BEHAVIOUR und SCIENCE FICTION. Aber mit Deiner Hilfe wird es so viel leichter! Und Du kannst sagen: ICH WAR DABEI.
___________________________english____________________________
Two longplayers have been self-financed and successfully released: BEHAVIOUR and SCIENCE FICTION. But with your help so much easier! And you will say: THIS IS MINE, TOO!





DANKE!!! THANK YOU!!!


ergebenst, yours sincerely
Feline & die Jungs

story:
The wonderful 1930s spinet that witnessed my mom learning to play, and then me in turn, has been cast aside and desperately needs to be rescued. 

My heart longs for the piano of my childhood. Will you help me in this musical mission of mercy? Please?

My name is Wendy Wham Mills. Music and art have been a huge part of my life as long as I can remember, and have always dreamed of playing this piano once again, though I thought I would never have the chance.   So many blissful memories of the family gathering around this beauty to sing Broadway or popular tunes from the American Songbook, or quiet times of repose playing Chopin...

 

(You can see me along with my twin brother at the piano as babies).

But I digress. 

Long story short:  when my brother married and had children, this beautiful piano was given to my brother by my mother so his daughters might have the chance to play. Their interest was short, and the piano was left unused in the living room, then was relegated to the basement where it stayed for years. Though not as grand as a Steinway, this beautiful 1930's spinet has deep loving roots in my memory.  My brother doubted that my memories were in step with the reality of an instrument that lay in dust for years... so I journeyed to Utah to see. 

It was!  I was so joyous! The piano was just as beautiful as I had imagined-- and my heart sang!  But she needed some work: besides desperately needing tuning, the white keys were cracked and swirled, a leg was wobbly, and her finish needed some love (the refinishing I can do, but replacing the key tops, securing the leg, and transportation needed to be handed to the professionals).

I thought that I would have some time to gather funds for her removal and restoration, but that was not to be.  I recently learned that she had to be gone. 
Now. 
Right on the heels of an engine rebuild on my car. (-sigh-)  Timing...

Details:

$500 for fixing leg, and re-topping the white keys
$900 for transportation from Utah to Colorado
$100 to help with storage costs until the move.

I have already put  some money into the piano's move from the basement, and restoration, but need further assistance, given the engine rebuild... 

Please help me achieve this dream, and give love to a beautiful and worthy instrument, and help to bring her home to Colorado.  

All funds received will go to this project.  The piano mover and restoration company is the most wonderful Barrus Pianos in Salt Lake City (http://barruspianos.com)

Might you help?
In exchange for your generous monetary  gift *of any amount,* I have several one-of-a -kind artistic thank you gifts to share- you may view my work at www.wendywhammills.com-- I would love to share (or create) a heartfelt thank you for your kindness. 

(If you have too much stuff and wish to donate without receiving a gift, you may do so directly above the 'Contribute Now' button).

Thank you so very much for your consideration, and thank you for helping to make this dream come true.
♥

Wendy

story:
What is this all about??

Hi Folks - If we haven't met please allow me to introduce myself.  My name is Matthew Morgan and i'm a singer songwriter from Chicago, IL who's been obsessively writing folk, rock and Americana tunes for several years.  My music has given me the opportunity to travel across the country performing at numerous shows and festivals, sign a record deal, and write and record a couple of albums that I'm pretty proud of.

For me, this past year has been all about reflecting and acknowledging that music is no longer about selling a million records and being famous.  It's about making honest connections with real people and for that reason I've decided to release my next EP independently with support from my family, and friends

I've been putting in lots of hours traveling back-n-forth from Illinois to several studios in Ohio where I've been working with producer, Nate Lockwood, to record this EP while still managing to keep my day job in Chicago (phew!).  I'm happy to say that I've managed to cover the entire cost of all the travel, studio time, and final production, but now I need your help to cover the cost of printing CDs, pressing vinyl (some folks have asked why vinyl is important to this project.  If you're interested, my answer is at the bottom of this page), and creating merchandise (t-shirts).  

My Goal is to Raise $4000 for the Final Pressing of the EP to Vinyl, Printing CDs & Merchandise, and Promoting the Album.  

For the sake of transparency I've created a detailed budget for the EP (see  below).  Please know that if I raise more than my set goal I will put the extra money into greater promotional materials.


Matt's Budget (total $4000):

- Pressing to full-color Vinyl  $2000
- Printing short run of full-color CDs  $500
- Purchasing mechanical license to record the cover of "Hold On I'm Comin'"  $500
- T-shirts  $600
-  Mastering B-Sides  $200
- IndieGogo Fee:  $150
- Paypal Fee: $50


If you look to the right you'll see that I've created some really neat perks for each level of contribution including the B-sides that didn't make it on to the album.


What if I Can't Contribute Financially?


I understand there are a lot of reasons why folks are not able to contribute and the last thing I want anyone to do is to feel pressured to donate.  In fact, the single most important thing you can do is help me get the word out about the campaign and the new EP!  If you would be so kind as to share this information using the convenient social media buttons at the bottom of this page and tell your friends about the project, you will be helping me in ways you can't even imagine.  


So...that's it in a nutshell!  What I'm really hoping to gain from this experience is to make a deeper connection with all of you because I'm asking you to become a partner in the making of this record.  Truly, I want to thank you for taking the time to read this and for all of your support.  I hope that you will enjoy the new EP as much as I've enjoyed making it!


Much love,

Matt

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Why Vinyl?


Hmm...the short answer is because I think it's awesome!  But, maybe not for the reasons you think.  Some people say that vinyl offers superior sound quality over digitally compressed files and, while that's true to some extent, it's not the number one reason why I think it's such a special medium...



For me what makes vinyl special is the physical connection to the artifact itself.  When I discover new music that I love it becomes immediately important to me to discover the deeper meaning behind the songs by reading the lyrics and liner notes, gazing at the artwork, and taking the time to really listen to the music in an environment where I'm not being distracted by messages on my computer, or smart phone.  It's pretty unique in our fast paced digital world!

story:
Short Summary

In 1966-67 NASA sent five spacecraft to the Moon to map it in preparation for the Apollo Moon landings.    These high resolution images, hundreds at 1 meter resolution, provided the first closeup look of the Moon in human history. The images were recorded on 70mm high resolution film, processed on the spacecraft in lunar orbit, scanned with a light beam and sent back to the Earth via radio.  At ground stations at Goldstone California, Madrid Spain, and Woomera Australia, the images  were recorded on tape, and also on 35mm film.

The images that the world saw in the 1960's were from the 35mm film and were grainy, with low dynamic range, and with striping.  The recordings on the tape were preserved in their most pristine form and were stored for over 40 years by NASA.  In 2007 we found, from retired NASA employee Nancy Evans, the last four remaining tape drives in the world that could play the images, stored for decades in a barn in Los Angeles with Nancy hoping for the day that the tapes could be read.

The Lunar Orbiter Image Recovery Project (LOIRP) was kicked off in 2008 with $120k in NASA funding and $15k from the Odyssey Moon Google Lunar X Prize Team.  We were able to get of the four 40+ year old Ampex tape drive running and produce in stunning quality, the remastered first image of the Earth first seen from lunar orbit.  This image, along with many others that we have produced have received worldwide acclaim.  

Between further NASA funding and $62k raised by crowd funding in 2013 we have completed the process of digitizing almost 1500 tapes, the entire tape library from lunar orbiter.    This has created tens of terabytes of data, and over 1700 images.  Each medium resolution image is broken into 28 strips or framelets.  Each high resolution image is made from 98 framelets.  Each framelet is a file. We have over 107,000 of these files.  

Our task is to complete the processing of these files and publish them to the NASA  website where they will be free for everyone to enjoy.  We are also doing the paperwork to get the raw data and images to the National Space Science Data Center.   We had estimated the cost to NASA to complete this at about $400,000 dollars, of which they provided $300k after we finished the work from the 2013 crowd funded effort.  We originally thought that we were only going to get Lunar Orbiter II and III, but because of our previous crowd funded effort, we were able to leverage the additional $300k.  That puts us at about $100k short of what we needed to finish, and that is what we are asking you, the crowd funding community to help us with.  This gets us our very last mile to finish everything.  To see what we have done so far, here is our gallery at NASA Ames Solar System Exploration Research Virtual Institute web site.

http://sservi.nasa.gov/LOIRP/loirp_gallery/

What We Need & What You Get

We already have the software to do the image processing to remove the striping from the images, assemble them, and do the final touch up to go to the NASA server.  However, our computers are several years old now, and we need to upgrade them and our photoshop and other software (we have to remove all the alien artifacts [just kidding!]) needed to process the images.  These images are gigapixel size and thus it takes time to process!  This will take about 20% of the funds.

Salaries for the team will take about 60% of the funds.

Fulfillment of the perks will take 10-11% of the funds.  This including mailing the perks here and overseas which is fairly expensive for the perks (you will see the good swag that we provide), packaging (good shipping tubes come from Yazoo.com) and first class mailing.  We have had problems with media mail class shipping before and we want you to get your prizes!

Oh, and Indiegogo does not do this for free!  It will cost between 7-10% if we make our goal (including credit card fees), and 12-15% if we don't!  So really it would be nice if we beat the goal a bit to take care of this cost.

Our perks will include at the lowest level your name on a plaque that will be given to whatever museum gets some of the original Lunar Orbiter hardware.  We will then have certificates for more help, then some really interesting original images on kodak paper from the 1960's donated to us by Dr. Donald Wilhelm, former head of the U.S. geological survey.  These will come with a certificate of provenance.  Just this week a major gallery is auctioning off similar images for lots of money.  Not only are these beautiful images, but they will have enduring value in the collectors market.  We will also put out special images related to our work in lunar bases and NASA studies over the years from acclaimed space artist Mark Maxwell.  We will have a few special image prints that will be colorized and otherwise creatively improved, and signed by Mark Maxwell and Don Davis, another famous space artist.  Finally we will have books of prints of the high resolution images and also large sized versions of our digitized Earth Rise and other cool lunar images, including blow ups of the Apollo 12 and 14 landing sites before the landing!

If we don't make the total, we will still do everything possible to finish.  It is our expectation that if the crowd funding takes off, we will go ahead and get a loan to cover some of the costs to start working so you should see some results before the crowdfunding is over!  The images go straight to the NASA server and are posted as they are completed.  The LOIRP Gallery will have the images that are free to the public for downloading.  

The Impact

The impact of this crowdfunded effort will seal the legacy of these historic images.  You the crowdfunding donor will participate in what we have coined the word as technoarchaeology, or the archeology of technology.

We have had worldwide acclaim, including front page newspapers with our Earthrise  image (LA Times).  We have had multiple documentaries (links below), and have been honored to have our images included in the inauguration presidential swag bag in 2013.  

We are also providing these images for the scientific community for all time.  The raw and processed images will be forever stored on NASA's cloud servers at the National Space Science Data Center and the Lunar Orbiter images will be available to the scientific community in their highest quality, closest to original form as well as in raw form.  By saving the data in raw form, in the future when our computers today are as much of a joke as the computers of 1966, researchers will be able to do magic with the images that we cannot think of today.  

You, the crowdfunding donor will be literally helping to make history by funding our efforts to preserve the history of the Apollo era.   We call this citizen science and you will participate in it.  We also have students who work with us doing real science with the images who we hope to employ this summer.   Never again can we do what has taken us six years to do with digitizing all these tapes.  That work is done, but we have to finish!  So thanks in advance and take a look at our links and images!

Our Wikipedia Page

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lunar_Orbiter_Image_Recovery_Project

Documentary on LOIRP by Scott Manley of the Kerball Space Program!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CGwyhc4g3q4
A 1960's NASA Documentary on Lunar Orbiter and its importance to the Apollo landings

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GBs3rd_u90Q

Geekbeat TV

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f6pw_l9yLdA

Carnegie Museum of Art Short on Lunar Orbiter Image Recovery Project

https://vimeo.com/100736619

Digital Amnesia, a Dutch Documentary About Losing our Digital Heritage, Featuring the Lunar Orbiter Image Recovery Project.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NdZxI3nFVJs

Spacevidcast interview about the LOIRP project and lunar exploration and development.

http://sservi.nasa.gov/articles/dennis-wingo-on-loirp-and-lunar-utilization/

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is not to do this.  We have the images, we have processed a few hundred of them, we just need to finish the job.  For us the biggest risk has always that we have not had enough money to do this right.  $100k will barely get us there.  If we can we can go over it would really help.  We have always been doing this on a shoestring and we really need as much help as we can get to finish strong!

We have overcome many challenges to get here, from getting the tape drives running, obtaining heads, developing the software for image processing, all of these have been overcome.  We just need to finish!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us financially then you can help to spread the word.  We have lost some of our media support from before and rely more than ever on viral spreading of the word.  We have a new twitter feed and we are on Facebook at 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/17596829126/

We will have a new twitter feed that we need followers on as well and we will keep folks updated via that way as well as through frequent updates here on indiegogo.

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't help us financially then you can help to spread the word.  We have lost some of our media support from before and rely more than ever on viral spreading of the word.  We have a new twitter feed and we are on Facebook at 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/17596829126/
We will have a new twitter feed that we need followers on as well and we will keep folks updated via that way as well as through frequent updates here on indiegogo.

story:
Samy T & Lil Magik


Somos Samy T ( Santi Novoa, Aviles, Asturias ) y Lil Magik ( Nacho Muiño, La Linea de la Concepción, Cádiz )

Desde hace casi tres años, emigramos a Miami, en busca de hacer realidad nuestro sueño, la música.

Estamos creando una música nueva, una fusión de mezclas que hace que sea única, letras basadas en el día a día de las personas, hablando de ese sentimiento interior que todos llevamos dentro pero muchas veces no sabemos como explicar, esa voz somos nosotros, la voz de tu interior.


¿Por qué os necesitamos?


Nos encontramos profundamente sumergidos en el lanzamiento de nuestro próximo disco, STRUGGLE.
Con más de 50 canciones compuestas, hemos seleccionado las 5 que mas nos representan y mas os representan también a vosotros.

Necesitamos que nos ayudeis, los medios que tenemos son muy limitados, estamos trabajando con un equipo amateur consiguiendo unos resultados realmente sorprendentes para el poco presupuesto que tenemos, pero necesitamos mas.
Necesitamos poder regalaros este disco en la calidad que se lo merece, necesitamos compartir con vosotros un sentimiento que solo se podrá apreciar si podemos conseguir que nuestro trabajo suene de la manera mas profesional posible.


Donaciones


Todas las donaciones recaudadas irán destinadas única y exclusivamente al desarollo de nuestro estudio.
Como os hemos dicho, tenemos un equipo básico que ya no nos permite seguir trabajando al nivel que nos proponemos.
Invertiremos las donaciones en conseguir una calidad más nítida de grabación, en un mejor resultado a la hora de la mezcla,  y en nuevos instrumentos para poder dejar de lado los sonidos MIDI, y poder darle ese toque de realidad que nos pide cada canción que creamos.

Agradecimientos


De antemano, queremos agradeceros que estéis leyendo esto, entendiendo nuestra situación, y apoyándonos como lo estáis haciendo hasta ahora compartiendo nuestra música, enseñandosela a todos vuestros amigos..

Pero vamos a más, y por eso a toda la gente que nos aporte su granito de arena queremos darle nuestro pequeño regalo.

- 5 $ : Si quieres ayudarnos con el precio de un paquete de tabaco, 5 $, verás tu nombre plasmado en la contraportada de nuestro próximo disco, Struggle.

- 20 $ : Si tienes un buen día y te apetece contribuir con esta cantidad, te enviaremos nuestro disco que con tanto cariño estamos preparando, y al mismo tiempo también verás tu nombre en la contraportada.

- 50 $ : Si crees en nosotros tanto como nosotros lo hacemos, y quieres ayudarnos con un mínimo de 50$ , te mandaremos una camiseta personalizada de " Samy T & Lil Magik", nuestro disco, y tambien verás tu nombre en el mismo.

NO OLVIDEIS MANDAR VUESTRA DIRECCION POSTAL A samytbeatz@gmail.com !!!


Somos una familia


Desde que empezamos en esta aventura, hemos recibido muchos mensajes de familiares, amigos, gente cercana, y al mismo tiempo no tan cercana, admirando el esfuerzo que estamos haciendo, el paso adelante que hemos dado dejando atrás todo nuestro pasado, con un único objetivo, hacer este sueño realidad.

Pero no somos solo dos personas, Samy T & Lil Magik sois todos vosotros cada vez que escucháis una de nuestras canciones, cada vez que nos dais un LIKE en nuestra página de facebook, o cada vez que nuestra música puede haceros ver la vida de una manera diferente.

No somos una moda pasajera, estamos aquí para dejar huella con nuestra música, dejar un poco de nosotros dentro de ustedes.

Somos tu voz interior.

1 LUV

story:
Short Summary

Hi, we're Crunkasaurus Rex! We're an easycore band from Indianapolis, Indiana! Since forming in September 2013, we've released our first EP "Here It Comes!" in addition to a lyric video and a music video. Currently, we're in the studio recording our second EP.

We've opened for many national acts within Indiana including: Hawthorne Heights, The Red Jumpsuit Apparatus, Norma Jean, Emery, Dance Gavin Dance, SECRETS, Defeat The Low, Alive Like Me, The Ongoing Concept, BoyMeetsWorld, Famous Last Words, Night Verses, It Lies Within, Conquer Divide, Blood On The Dance Floor, and Sweet Ascent.

This summer, we will jump headfirst into the touring life taking three weeks in June to travel around the East Coast. But, our maiden voyage can't happen unless we have the means to get to you.

In the past when we traveled to play shows, we took multiple cars; however, that wouldn't be practical for traveling across the country. We need a van. But with our current jobs and living situations, we can't purchase a van without outside help. That's why we created this Indiegogo. Your help can get us mobile. 

We're not the type to beg; we really aren't. If you give to us, we will give back to you. When you donate, you can receive (among other things): t-shirts, previews of our new tracks, our cab art, a dinner date, and even a tattoo in your honor (on our bassist's butt!).

Even if you can't donate, sharing our Indiegogo and/or telling someone about it would mean a lot to us. Every little bit helps. We are, and forever will be, grateful for everything you do; we couldn't have gotten this far without you.

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone, my name is Brian Doherty. I am a singer/songwriter out of Chicago, Illinois. I have recently started going public as such, and have released my first full original album titled "Short Stories" early in February. You can check it out right now on spotify and bandcamp (more importantly I hope you enjoy it). My campaign will be used to further my career as an artist. I am attempting to start a tour by this summer as well as create music videos to the music on the album. The money you contribute will go towards funds to accomplish this task. I am extremely grateful for the opportunity to be funded, as well as blessed to have the support of the wonderful people who enjoy my music.

  • What We Need & What You Get

We needed $2,000 to fund both the tour (musicians, transportation, lodging ect.) as well for the production of the videos. 

Now to for the Awesome Perks you get

$10 You will receive album art themed guitar picks

$30 You will receive a album art Tshirt with a printed signiture of Brian Doherty

$100 Brian Doherty will play the cover of your choice on his YouTube Channel

$300 Brian Doherty will play a private show for you and friends at the location of your choice.

Funds will still go to the tour if this goal is not reached!!

The Impact

I want to reach my music out to as many people as possible, and I want people to experience the music I write with me. There is nothing better in the world than sharing an experience with someone. I am lucky enough where I have the opportunity to share music with the people I care about (family, firends, fans). I am a new artist, and need the support from a community that I want to give back to tenfold. 


Other Ways You Can Help

You can check out my music at:

Bandcamp: http://briandoherty.bandcamp.com/album/short-stories

Spotify: Brian Doherty- Short Stories

Itunes: Brian Doherty- Short Stories

Youtube: www.youtube.com/watch?v=t-GXNcQ66G4&list=PLqGT2zLKqAmnUGSqKB8e8odxzacR6bx8w

story:
Short Summary

Hello IndieGoGo viewers! 

I'm a big-haired country singing girl from Texas! I've been making music and travelling across our great state for the past 4 years. Below is lots of info about a new adventure I'm ready to take, but I need the help of y'all! Watch the video for the 4-1-1 and below is a lengthy version that will explain what this is all about! 

Friends, Family and Fans… I have such exciting news that I have been dying to share with you… I’m ready to make some new MUSIC!!!!! Yes, you heard it from the horse’s mouth – It’s time to get back in the studio and crank out some new material. My last EP (short 6 song album) was released in March 2014 and blew my mind – because of YOU it was a Top 200 iTunes Country Album Download! (#163 to be exact) Not only that but my first radio single “Just Another Blonde” went to #94 on the Texas Country Radio Charts and my second single "Avalanche" went to #21!!! I mean really?! This year was amazing. Not only did I have digital success, but there were some life moments that no dollar sign could buy. I was nominated for "New Female Vocalist of the Year" for the Texas Regional Radio Awards and was featured as a "New Face" in Texas Country! I sang at the legendary Bluebird Café in Nashville. I recorded with the top musicians at OmniSound on music row. I’ve been able to go out on the road and play over 200 shows the past 2 years. I went into the studio for the first time EVER September 2013 to record my first song, "Life Changes" and now I'm looking at putting together a full length album! 

That’s just the tip of the iceberg. I have been busting my butt to save money, promote my music and get out there and meet y’all and I think this year has been a HUGE stepping stone in expanding that dream from just singing in some bars in Dallas to getting out on the road and seeing all of Texas and playing bigger venues (remember when we had 1,500 people at my EP release party in March? Yeah, that was awesome). 

Which brings me to a fork in the road. Thankfully I was able to gain financial support from a few investors to make this last record happen, and could never thank them enough. They allowed me to get my feet off the ground for the first time and now I’m not quite ready to come back down. The EP record produced 3 radio singles; “Life Changes”, “Just Another Blonde” that went to #94 and was on the charts for 27 weeks, and “Avalanche” which went to #21 on the charts (my first Top 25 single EK)!  

I’ve got the material and the momentum from YOU the fans, but we are a few dollars short on getting the final touches together for a full length album.  This is why I’m reaching out to y’all, I get asked ALL THE TIME, “when are you putting out new music”, “when can we expect another album”… well, when I can raise some money! Haha. Music is more than a hobby to me, it’s my passion and without it I don’t know what I would do with my nights and weekends… watch Real Housewives?! (oh wait, I already do that…) But really… I LOVE music and feel I have been blessed thus far, and from the encouragement I have gotten from people over the past few years, this is something I should continue to pursue as long as it will let me.

In addition to putting together a new full length album, we are planning to send out ANOTHER single ("It's A Song") from the EP to radio September 21st! Then a single from the NEW album out in Feb 2016 and then the full length album out March 2016 (estimated times). I mean things are about to start CRANKING Y'ALL! 

I have already been in the works putting together a launch team that is AMAZING (like seriously), but we need your help to get the funds to back these new efforts! 

What We Need & What You Get

If you have gotten to this point of my soap box BLESS YOUR HEART! I’m going to get to the nitty-gritty now I promise. To record a full length album; the hard costs are hiring the band to record, rent the studio, the engineer, mix and mastering (the button flipping process that makes it sound good, that I do not understand, and that is much harder than I just explained). Then we have my Rock-Star Producer Zac Maloy who is coming in on this project, HE IS THE MAN!!! He not only produced my 6 song EP, but he co-wrote on half the album. The man that brought you The Nixons, songs recorded by Carrie Underwood, Blake Shelton, Tim McGraw...need I keep going? He's on board. So you should be too! 

Then there are the costs to physically have CDs printed to take to shows and mail out to venues for booking, and then the radio single to mail out to stations. In addition to the minimum hard costs, the additional marketing/promotion cost to make the album/single successful….You have to pay a radio promoter to get the single out to radio (Thank the lord for Dorothea Ivey, Cabin Creek Promotions who is the master-mind behind “Avalanche” and will be working "It's A Song"). THENNNNNN, we have a photo shoot to try and make me look cool (which is very very hard) so we can create an album cover and artwork, and use those pictures for the website, social media, one-sheet mail outs, etc. Which turns into BOOKING GIGS and going on the road. Because they will only book you if you have all of the above FIRST.... Soooo here is a breakdown of the budget for y'all to peak at! 

Where is the money going?

  • Promoting Next Radio Single – "It's A Song"
  • Record & Produce FULL Length Album
  • Promotion for New Single from Full Length Album - Feb 2016
  • Production cost of Full Length CDs and distribution 
  • Promotional Material for Marketing (Posters, one-sheets, photo shoot, album artwork)
  • Press/Radio Tour Costs 

The Impact

So. With all that being said, the minimum hard costs outlined are $20,500. But, adding in the additional marketing/promotion costs we are looking at a grand total of $25,550. That’s a car. A down-payment on a house. Or a record, haha.

Here is the breakdown of our goals and what we will be able to do with the amount of money raised! 

  • 10k = Recording all New Songs 
  • 13k = Recording + Radio Promotion for Single "It's A Song"
  • 18k = Recording + Radio Promo (2nd single) + New CD Distribution 
  • 20k  = Recording + Radio + CD Distribution + Marketing Design 
  • 25k = ALL ABOVE NEEDS + Marketing Materials, Videos, Photos, etc.! 

I’m not finished yet! Because I value everyone’s dollar, I want you to get an awesome PERK for your selfless donation. I’ve tried to be super creative on these perks you see listed, and would encourage you to check them out! Everything from a free song downloads, to coming to Nashville with me, to SINGING ON THE RECORD (it’s okay if you’re not a great singer, we have auto-tune, hehe)… I want you to be part of this record in every way possible!!!!!


Thank you ALL so much for everything you have done to date. I appreciate all of y'all coming out on a Wednesday and drinking cowgirl punch is hard on a work night, and driving hours to a show that you have seen before and coming and bearing the heat with me for a National Anthem -- I appreciate every single person that comes out and supports me! Seriously, I could NOT do this without y’all. No amount is too little on a fundraiser like this and I know it’s a lot to ask, but I wouldn’t do so if I didn’t feel like this next record would be HUGELY successful and something I think we can all agree on is just plain FUN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

 Xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxo times infinity. Adrian. 

Risks & Challenges

Thankfully with campaign outlets like IndieGoGo we are able to set up a fundraiser, that even if we do not fulfill our entire goal, we will still walk away with what we DO raise! If we aren't able to raise the entire amount, then that's okay! We will still go into the studio and work on what we can and get new music out to y'all. It may not be a full album, or (2) radio singles, and we may not be able to do all the promotion and marketing bells and whistles we want to, but we will still make NEW music no matter what and it will make a huge splash! It might take a little longer to get a full project completed, but any donation will help get us started! Anything is better than the $0 we have now :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't get paid for another two weeks and need to keep you electricity turned on? I HEAR YA! It's okay if you aren't able to donate! Spreading the word is JUST as important! Copy this link and post this on Facebook, or send via text message to your friends and family to let them know about these really cool perks they can win! Also, we have live shows coming up and coming out and supporting a live show is JUST as important!!!! Head on over to www.Facebook.com/AdrianJohnstonOfficial and give me a LIKE - any additional exposure will help and is GREATLY appreciated!!!!

     cost of Full Length CDs and distribution 
Promotional
     Material for Marketing (Posters, one-sheets, photo shoot, album artwork)
Press/Radio
     Tour Costs 

The Impact
So. With all that being said, the minimum hard costs outlined
are $20,500. But, adding in the additional marketing/promotion costs we are
looking at a grand total of $25,550. That’s a car. A down-payment on a house.
Or a record, haha.
Here is the breakdown of our goals and what we will be able to
do with the amount of money raised! 

10k = Recording all New Songs 
13k = Recording + Radio Promotion for Single "It's
     A Song"
18k = Recording + Radio Promo (2nd single) + New CD
     Distribution 
20k  = Recording + Radio + CD Distribution +
     Marketing Design 
25k = ALL ABOVE NEEDS + Marketing Materials, Videos,
     Photos, etc.! 

I’m not finished yet! Because I value everyone’s dollar, I want
you to get an awesome PERK for your selfless donation. I’ve tried to be super
creative on these perks you see listed, and would encourage you to check them
out! Everything from a free song downloads, to coming to Nashville with me, to
SINGING ON THE RECORD (it’s okay if you’re not a great singer, we have
auto-tune, hehe)… I want you to be part of this record in every way possible!!!!!





Thank you ALL so much for everything you have done to date. I
appreciate all of y'all coming out on a Wednesday and drinking cowgirl punch is
hard on a work night, and driving hours to a show that you have seen before and
coming and bearing the heat with me for a National Anthem -- I appreciate every
single person that comes out and supports me! Seriously, I could NOT do this
without y’all. No amount is too little on a fundraiser like this and I know
it’s a lot to ask, but I wouldn’t do so if I didn’t feel like this next record
would be HUGELY successful and something I think we can all agree on is just
plain FUN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
 Xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxo times infinity. Adrian. 
Risks & Challenges
Thankfully with campaign outlets like IndieGoGo we are able to
set up a fundraiser, that even if we do not fulfill our entire goal, we will
still walk away with what we DO raise! If we aren't able to raise the entire
amount, then that's okay! We will still go into the studio and work on what we
can and get new music out to y'all. It may not be a full album, or (2) radio
singles, and we may not be able to do all the promotion and marketing bells and
whistles we want to, but we will still make NEW music no matter what and it
will make a huge splash! It might take a little longer to get a full project
completed, but any donation will help get us started! Anything is better than
the $0 we have now :) 
Other Ways You Can Help
Don't get paid for another two weeks and need to keep you
electricity turned on? I HEAR YA! It's okay if you aren't able to donate!
Spreading the word is JUST as important! Copy this link and post this on
Facebook, or send via text message to your friends and family to let them know
about these really cool perks they can win! Also, we have live shows coming up
and coming out and supporting a live show is JUST as important!!!! Head on over
to www.Facebook.com/AdrianJohnstonOfficial and
give me a LIKE - any additional exposure will help and is GREATLY
appreciated!!!!

story:
OUR STORY:

If you are part of the Blameshift family, you know that we eat, sleep and breath Blameshift. We have put everything on the line and sacrificed it all in the name of music and continuing to pursue this crazy dream. However, without our fans we would never be able to do it. 

The music business has changed over the years and for better or worse, we are in this together. Whether you are an artist or a fan you realize the impact of this new digital age in music. Where labels used to control the industry, this shift has allowed artists to create a tighter bond, connection and relationship with their fans. The fans are now the label. The fans have the control and it's a beautiful thing. What is better than the fans funding music that they love and having an integral part in its making & success. 

That's where you guys come in. After spending the last year and a half solid on the road we are ready to get back into the studio and make new music for YOU! You keep us going every day and we want you to be a part of this alongside us. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

We are trying to raise $15,000 to be able to get into the studio and record new music! We spent the better part of two years touring the country non-stop and now we are hoping our friends and fans from around the world will help us in this next phase of our careers.

Remember, anything that is available through the perks is exclusive to the campaign. None of them will ever be printed again in this way.


EXCLUSIVE FUNDRAISER PACKAGES:






BE PART OF OUR STORY...

We are really excited to take this next step in our career with you guys by our side. No matter what the music industry has thrown at us over the years, knowing that you guys are out there supporting us and believing in us, makes it all worthwhile. We want this new music to be something that we can all feel we had a piece in making and all be proud of. Our story has always been about the fans more than anything and we hope you will join us on this next part of the journey. 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP...

If you cannot make a monetary contribution, don't count yourself out. There are still ways you can help us achieve our goal. Start with using our Eye Heart Blameshift graphic and make it your profile pic, post the Logo on Instagram, Twitter, Myspace, Tinder, Plenty of Fish, Farmers Only, etc. And don't forget to tag the band! Let's do whatever it takes to get the awareness out there! The more people that know about our fundraiser, the better.
